loans.name: Nazdar's Group

texts.en:
Nazdar is a 49-year-old Iraqi woman. She is married and has 3 children. With limited career options due to cultural restrictions and domestic constraints, Nazdar is one of the many Iraqi woman who is working from home, using her sewing skills to generate some income and participate in meeting the financial needs of her family.

Nazdar has 12 years of experience with the small home based sewing business activity which she is constantly trying to improve. In the past she took a loan from Relief International - Microfinance Iraq to purchase a new sewing machine. Having successfully repaid the previous loan, she now took a new loan to buy an over lock machine and some nice, good quality materials. 

Relief International - Microfinance Iraq offers "Group loans" for clients unable to provide a guarantor - thereby unable to apply for a loan as an individual. As a group, the members collectively guarantee the loan. Groups consist of 3 to 5 clients and each client is evaluated on his or her repayment capacity. All group members receive the same loan amount as the individual with the lowest repayment capacity in the group. 

Based on the political and social challenges of lending in Iraq, personally identifiable information about this borrower has been altered for their protection. RI-Iraq appreciates Kiva lenders' consideration of these challenges and encourages lenders to continue their support for Iraqi borrowers.

loans.use: to buy an over lock machine and some nice, good quality materials.

loans.name: Anonymous Group

texts.en:
This group of Iraqi women would like to remain anonymous. The leader of this group is a 27-year-old Iraqi woman. She is married and a mother of one child. With limited career options due to cultural restrictions and domestic constraints, she is one of the many Iraqi woman who is working from home, using her sewing skills to generate some income and participate in meeting the financial needs of her family.

The leader of this group has 5 years of experience with her small home based sewing business which she would like to improve now. She would like to renew her work area to work under better conditions and she would also like to buy a some nice quality fabric and raw materials to offer better choices for her customers. To be able to pay for these improvements she took a loan from Relief International - Microfinance Iraq.  

Relief International - Microfinance Iraq offers "Group loans" for clients unable to provide a guarantor - thereby unable to apply for a loan as an individual. As a group, the members collectively guarantee the loan. Groups consist of 3 to 5 clients and each client is evaluated on his or her repayment capacity. All group members receive the same loan amount as the individual with the lowest repayment capacity in the group. 

Based on the political and social challenges of lending in Iraq, personally identifiable information about this borrower has been altered for their protection. RI-Iraq appreciates Kiva lenders' consideration of these challenges and encourages lenders to continue their support for Iraqi borrowers.

loans.use: to renew her work area and to buy a some nice quality fabric and raw materials.

loans.name: Rwnak's Group

texts.en:
Rwnak is a 40-year-old Iraqi woman. She is married and a mother of 3 children. With limited career options due to cultural restrictions and domestic constraints, Rwnak is one of the many Iraqi woman who is working from home, using her sewing skills to generate some income and participate in meeting the financial needs of her family.

Rwnak has 6 years of experience with the small home based business activity which she would like to improve by concentrating on creating better work conditions for herself. She would like to renew her work area, and to pay for the work she took a loan from Relief International - Microfinance Iraq.  

Relief International - Microfinance Iraq offers "Group loans" for clients unable to provide a guarantor - thereby unable to apply for a loan as an individual. As a group, the members collectively guarantee the loan. Groups consist of 3 to 5 clients and each client is evaluated on his or her repayment capacity. All group members receive the same loan amount as the individual with the lowest repayment capacity in the group. 

Based on the political and social challenges of lending in Iraq, personally identifiable information about this borrower has been altered for their protection. RI-Iraq appreciates Kiva lenders' consideration of these challenges and encourages lenders to continue their support for Iraqi borrowers.

loans.use: to renew her work area.

loans.name: Seran's Group

texts.en:
Seran is 23 years old. She is an young Iraqi woman, married, and a mother of two children. With limited career options due to cultural restrictions and domestic constraints, Seran is one of the many Iraqi woman who is working from home, using her sewing skills to generate some income and participate in meeting the financial needs of her family.

Searn has 3 years of experience with the small home based business activity which she is constantly working on improving. In the past she took a loan from Relief International - Microfinance Iraq to buy a new sewing machine, an iron and some raw materials. Having successfully repaid the loan, she now took a loan to renew her work area and improve her work conditions.

Relief International - Microfinance Iraq offers "Group loans" for clients unable to provide a guarantor - thereby unable to apply for a loan as an individual. As a group, the members collectively guarantee the loan. Groups consist of 3 to 5 clients and each client is evaluated on his or her repayment capacity. All group members receive the same loan amount as the individual with the lowest repayment capacity in the group. 

Based on the political and social challenges of lending in Iraq, personally identifiable information about this borrower has been altered for their protection. RI-Iraq appreciates Kiva lenders' consideration of these challenges and encourages lenders to continue their support for Iraqi borrowers.

All members of this group are under 30, and qualify for a 'youth loan'.

loans.use: to renew her work area and improve her work conditions.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is a married woman. She has 3 children. She describes herself to be a determined woman. She operates a restaurant where she sells food, tea and snacks. Her business is located within a busy urban area and her primary customers are business people. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient water for cooking. 

She will use the Kes 26,500 loan to buy a water tank which she will use with her five family members and also in her business. Her business goal is to improve her business within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will expand her business. Lucy also does dairy farming which increases her business income.

loans.use: to buy a water tank.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
Francisca is a 34-year-old married woman. She has 2 children. She describes herself to be a creative woman. She operates a pharmacy where she sells beauty products and medicine. She has been involved in this business for 3 years. Her business is located within a potential business area and her primary customers are residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the high prices of beauty products and medicine. 

She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy beauty products and medicine for resale. Her business goal is to run a fully stocked retail business within 5 years. She hopes that in the future she will own several pharmacy outlets. She managed to pay back her previous loan of Kes 20,000 successfully.

loans.use: To buy more pharmaceutical drugs.

loans.name: Otis.s

texts.en:
Otis is running a shoe store in Ganta where he sells shoes and sneakers. He started this business with help from his father, and he learned this way of selling from his father. Presently the problem he faces is that he has few materials in stock, so he is requesting a loan to buy shoes and sneakers for his business. 

He enjoys his business because it keeps him busy. He is a 12th grade dropout, 48 years old, and married with four children between the ages of 16 and 4. They are in school and live at home. His dream is to expand his business even more and send his children to college since he did not reach that far in school.

loans.use: to buy shoes and sneakers for his business.

loans.name: Nertila

texts.en:
Nertila is twenty-six, married, has one child aged seven and is an Egyptian woman from a major city in central Albania. Approximately 80,000 Egyptians have been living in this city for a long time. They were extremely discriminated against and lived poorly under the Communist era; yet, in recent years the Albanian government and foreign organizations have helped tremendously in reducing the stigma and discrimination against this wonderful minority and improve their living conditions.

For the past two years Nertila started selling used clothes and has been the sole provider for her family since then. She makes a small income that gives them the opportunity to have some very basic food on the table and is happy for that.

Nertila is now applying for a loan for the first time to purchase some inventory of used clothes. Being a responsible person, she promises she will pay back the loan.

loans.use: to purchase some inventory of used clothes to sell to locals.

loans.name: Arbre De Vie Group

texts.en:
“Arbre de Vie”, which means Tree of Life in English, is a group of 16 owners of small businesses chaired by Emmanuel. Its members are jointly liable for loans granted by Kiva to grow their businesses.

Emmanuel, married and age 36, operates a general store. His business is located to the southeast of the city of Lubumbashi. He started his business in 2010. Emmanuel is happy to be one of Hope’s clients. His dream is to expand through Hope’s loans for his business. 

Due to the high demand in his community, he intends with the next loan to buy more goods for resale in order to meet client demand, and thereby generate additional profits. This will help him to achieve his plans to grow the business. It brings in a profit of about US$100 per week. Emmanuel is the father of six children whose ages are between 1 and 12 years old. Three of them go to school.

loans.use: to purchase additional goods for his store to sell at a profit.

loans.name: Gjelina

texts.en:
Gjelina is thirty-two and is married with three children, with all of them going to school. She and her family lived in the most rural areas of northwest Albania until recently, and life was extremely tough for them. With the recent move to the newest region, life seems easier and they all are content. 

In the past five years Gjelina has been selling milk and other dairy products to the locals and the income has been somewhat good for their family. She is the only one in her family who brings an income, yet her husband helps her out as well by taking the dairy and milk to the market every morning.

Gjelina is now requesting a loan for the first time to repair the very primitive animal stable she had built. She is in a hurry to build it before the winter starts, so those animals stay warm throughout the winter.

She wants to thank all lenders for their contribution.

loans.use: to repair the animal stable before winter kicks in.

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas 1, 2, 3 & 4 Group

texts.en:
Paula is the coordinator of her group, Mujeres Unidas (United Women) 1, 2, 3 & 4, this group compounded by 20 micro-entrepreuners (women and men) located in the lush, rugged Samana peninsula. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her long-term partner and their five children.

Paula is excited to be taking her 15th loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. This businesswomen runs different sales in her business, one is selling sewing machines (used and for domestic uses) and the other sales are coconut oils. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business by purchasing sewing machines to sell and coconuts to extract oil. 

She said that her most difficult challenge has been to raise her children and educate them while she has been working to support her long-term partner. She will use the profits to reinvest and to save for any needs in her family. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: to buy sewing machines and supplies and coconuts.

loans.name: Houénagnon Grégoire

texts.fr: Houénagnon Grégoire est âgé de 40 ans et vit au Bénin. Houénagnon Grégoire est marié à une marchande du nom de Suzanne. Le couple a quatre enfants dont certains scolarisés et tous à leur charge. En plus de leurs enfants, le couple a deux autres enfants à charge. Houénagnon Grégoire vit ensemble avec sa femme et ses enfants et assure ensemble avec sa femme, les charges de la maison. Afin d’assurer les diverses charges de la famille, Houénagnon Grégoire mène comme activité depuis une dizaine d’année, la charcuterie dans sa région. Parallèlement à cette activité, Houénagnon Grégoire vend des boissons. Houénagnon Grégoire s’approvisionne dans des régions du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Houénagnon Grégoire sollicite pour la deuxième fois, un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Ce prêt lui permettra certainement de rehausser le niveau de son activité et de se faire plus de profits. Le premier prêt a été bien remboursé.
texts.en:
Houénagnon Grégoire is 40 years old and lives in Benin. He is married to a merchant named Suzanne. The couple has four children, some of whom attend school, and all remain under their care. Additionally, the couple has two other children that they take care of. Houénagnon Grégoire and his wife live with their children, and together they meet their household needs.

In order to meet these household needs, Houénagnon Grégoire has been selling cooked meats for the past ten years. In addition to this business, he also sells drinks. He procures his goods from around Benin. 

In pursuit of customer satisfaction and to increase his turnover and income, Houénagnon Grégoire is requesting, for a second time, a loan from Alidé. This loan will allow him to increase business and his profits. His first loan has been fully repaid.

loans.use: to buy drinks

loans.name: Sandro Abel

texts.es:
Sandro tiene 35 años es casado y tiene 4 hijos. Sandro empezó con una tienda muy pequeña con pocas cosas que vender pero a medida que fueron mejorando sus ingresos fue incrementando más productos de insumos hoy en día su tienda es mucho mas grande que cuando empezó. 
Trabaja de lunes a domingo todo el día con la ayuda de su esposa. Con el prestamo quiere comprar aceite, azucar, granos, bebidas. Su meta es que su negocio siga creciendo y tener un minimarket para así poder satisfacer las necesidades del cliente y desea darle lo mejor a su familia
texts.en:
Sandro is 35 years old, married and has four children. Sandro began with a very small store with only a few things to sell but as his income improved he gradually increased his inventory of products. These days his store is much larger than when he started. 

He works all day Monday to Sunday with the help of his wife. With the loan he wants to buy oil, sugar, grains and drinks. His goal is that his business would continue to grow and that he would have a "minimarket" in order thus to be able to meet the customer's needs. He wishes to give his family the best.

loans.use: to purchase oil, sugar, grains etc. for his business.

loans.name: Adandé Bénoit

texts.fr: Adandé Bénoit est âgé de 33 ans et vit au Bénin. Adandé Bénoit a fréquenté l’école jusqu’au niveau primaire. Adandé Bénoit est marié à Alice, une revendeuse. Le couple a cinq enfants à leur charge, dont certains scolarisés. Parmi les enfants, quatre sont leurs propres enfants. Adandé Bénoit vit ensemble avec sa femme et ses enfants et assure ensemble avec sa femme, les charges de la maison. Afin d’assurer les diverses charges de la famille, Adandé Bénoit mène comme activité depuis une dizaine d’année, la menuiserie dans sa région. Parallèlement à cette activité, Adandé Bénoit fait la location des bâches et des chaises. Adandé Bénoit s’approvisionne dans des régions du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Adandé Bénoit sollicite pour la quatrième fois, un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Ce prêt lui permettra certainement de rehausser le niveau de son activité et de se faire plus de profits. Les premiers prêts ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
Adandé Bénoit is 33 years old and lives in Benin. He is married to Alice, a retailer. The couple has five children under their care, some of whom go to school. Among the children, four are their own. Adandé Bénoit lives with his wife and children. The couple together takes care of the household needs. Adandé Bénoit attended primary school.

In order to meet his different household needs, Adandé Bénoit has been doing woodworking in his area for the last ten years. In addition to this business, he also rents out tarps and chairs. He procures his goods from around Benin.

In the pursuit of customer satisfaction and to increase turnover and his income, Adandé Bénoit is asking, for the fourth time, a loan from Alidé. This loan will allow him to increase business and earn more profits. His previous loans have all been fully repaid.

loans.use: to buy lumber and woodworking equipment

loans.name: Fuente Para El Desarrollo 1, 2 &3 Group

texts.en:
Juana is one of the members of the Fuente Para el Desarrollo (Font for Development) 1, 2 & 3. They are micro-businesspeople who sell clothes, natural products, shoes, artisan crafts, etc. They are in the city of Samana, a tourist town in development, bordered by the Atlantic and rich in natural resources. Juana is a single mother with two children. 

Juana is very excited to be receiving her fourth loan from Esperanza International. She has successfully paid off her previous loans and taken steps to grow her business. She started her business five years ago. She will invest her new loan in purchasing an electrical generator. She runs a beauty salon. She will use her earnings to re-invest in the business while she saves for her children's education and other needs. Juana thanks you for your support!

loans.use: To buy an electrical generator for her salon.

loans.name: Salim

texts.en:
Salim lives in Mariakani area of Coast Province, Kenya. He is married. He owns a transport business which he has been operating for one year. He learnt about Milango through friends who invited him to the group and he joined with the aim of accessing credit to improve his business operations. His main challenges are high transport and fuel prices, seasonal weather and finding customers.

Salim is applying for a loan of 21,050 Kenya shillings to add to his savings and purchase a motorcycle. The extra income from the loan will be added to his savings to expand his business. His dream is to see his business grow and buy other motorbikes to boost his transport business.

loans.use: To add to his savings and purchase a motorcycle.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy cables and bulbs to sell.

loans.name: Rispah

texts.en:
Rispah lives in the Kongowea area of Coast Province in Kenya. She is married and has three children. She owns a clothes shop, a business she has been operating for one year.

She learned about Milango through friends who invited her to the group. She joined with the aim of accessing credit to improve her business operations. Her main challenges are fluctuating prices and finding customers.

Rispah is applying for a loan of 10650 KES to purchase secondhand clothes. The extra income from the loan will be added to her savings to pay the school fees for her children. Her dream is to see her business grow.

loans.use: To purchase secondhand clothes.

loans.name: Martin

texts.en:
Martin lives in Likoni area of Coast Province, Kenya. He is married and has three children. He owns a butchery and a car wash business which he has been operating for one year.

He learnt about Milango through friends who invited him to the group and he joined with the aim of accessing credit to improve his business operations. His main challenge is seasonal weather.

Martin is applying for a loan of 41,850 Kenya shillings to add a stock of meat. The extra income from the loan will be added to his savings to increase his savings. His dream is to see his business grow and to start buying his own cows.

loans.use: To add a stock of meat.

loans.name: Clement

texts.en:
Clement lives in Mariakani area of Coast Province, Kenya. He is married and has six children. He owns a clinic which he has been operating for fifteen years. He sold his cattle and borrowed some funds from his friends to start off the business.

He learnt about Milango through friends who invited him to the group and he joined with the aim of accessing credit to improve his business operations. His main challenges are price fluctuations and inflations and customers not paying on time.

Clement is applying for a loan of 41,850 Kenya shillings to renovate the business premises. This is in line with the statutory requirements. The extra income from the loan will be added to his savings to buy drugs. His dream is to see his business grow and open a maternity wing.

loans.use: To renovate the business premises.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase an additional stock of food stuff such as tomatoes, onions and kales.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy storage tanks for his water business.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence lives in the Kongowea area of Coast Province in Kenya. She is married and has four children, three of whom are school-going. She owns a green grocer, a business she has been operating for three years. Florence also farms and at times sells cassavas, maize, etc.

Florence learned about Milango through friends who invited her to the group. She joined with the aim of accessing credit to improve her business operations. Her main challenges are bad debts and a lack of enough funds to run the business. She believes these challenges can be partly alleviated by this loan.

Florence is applying for a loan of 27,050 KES to buy vegetables and fruits in wholesale. The extra income from the loan will be added to her savings to pay the school fees for her children and improve the living standards of her family. Her dream is to see her business expand.

loans.use: To buy vegetables and fruits to sell in her store.

loans.name: Lucy Concepcion

texts.es: La Sra. Lucy  tiene 28 años tiene cinco hijos todos pequeños,  se dedica  al venta de comida en su puesto de venta que se encuentra en la zona de Alto Obrajes,    este préstamo es su segunda secuencia dentro de la institución,  la solicitante vive en casa familiar,  Esta solicitando el crédito para la compra artefactos de cocina y utensilios, para la elaboración de sus platillos  y  de esta manera poder elabora más rápido sus platillos y   brindar variedad de platillos a sus clientes,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es seguir mejorando en su  negocio, la Sra. Lucy va a utilizar los beneficios para ir comprando insumos y así mejorando sus ingresos, La Sra. Lucy es una persona muy trabajadora se siente feliz por la oportunidad brindada.
texts.en:
Sra. Lucy is 28 years old and has five small children. She makes a living from the sale of food in her stall located in the region of Alto Obrajes. This loan is her second with this institution. 

Lucy lives in the family home. She is asking for the loan to purchase kitchen appliances and utensils which she needs to prepare her food. This will allow her to prepare the dishes faster and to offer a greater variety to her customers. The reason she is requesting this loan is to continue improving her business. Lucy will use the money to buy ingredients which will help her improve her earnings. 

Lucy is a very hard-working person and she is happy about the opportunity offered.

loans.use: to purchase kitchen appliances and utensils.

loans.name: Leah

texts.en:
Leah is a resident of Mariakani of Coast province, Kenya. She is single and runs a food cafe, a business that she has been operating for ten years. She sells rice, beans, potatoes etc. Besides this, she also owns a dress-making shop.

She learnt about Milango through an employee and joined with the aim of accessing credit to improve the operations of her business. Her main challenge is some customers not paying on time.

Leah is applying for a loan of 73,100 Kenya shillings to purchase some flour, sugar, cereals, cooking oil and other equipment for the cafe. The extra income from the loan will be added to her savings to improve her living standards. She aspires to open a big restaurant in the future.

loans.use: To buy flour, sugar, cereals, cooking oil and other equipment for the cafe.

loans.name: Wellington

texts.en:
Wellington lives in Changamwe, Kenya. He school which has been in operation for seven years. He is a married father of eight children though only the last three are in school. Most of the older children are grown-ups.

Wellington learnt of Milango from his friends; he has had one loan already and has completed the repayment. 

Wellington is applying for a loan of 93,850 Kenya shillings to purchase text books and build additional classrooms. His main challenge is that some children delay paying the school fees. The main aim is to steer the investment till he can provide tertiary level education to the children around the area.

The income obtained from this loan will help him pay his own children’s school fees and also provide good health care for them.

loans.use: To  purchase text books and build additional classrooms.

loans.name: Lourdes Ivon

texts.es:
Lourdes  tiene 30 años es soltera y no tiene hijos. Lourdes ha trabajado desde su adolescencia ya que  ella consiguió trabajo como empleada privada y trabajo por mucho tiempo pero, a medida que fue pasando el tiempo se dio cuenta que ese trabajo no llenaba toda sus expectativas no se sentía bien entonces decidió instalar su propio negocio de venta de ropa. 

Lourdes trabaja sola todos los días a toda hora, ella no tiene descanso ella dice que hay que esforzarse mucho para lograr lo que uno desea, ya que  le ha resultado muy difícil tener este el negocio ya que las calles del sector no están pavimentadas por lo que el polvo contamina su mercadería. Con el prestamo quiere comprar ropa para mujeres y hombres como blusas, camisas etc. La meta de Lourdes es que su negocio crezca y tener una mejor ubicación para su negocio.
texts.en:
Lourdes is 30 years old, single, and doesn't have any children.  She has worked since she was a teenager.  Lourdes managed to get a job working as a private employee and worked in her job for a long time.  However, as time went by, she realized that the work did not meet all her expectations and she didn't feel satisfied so she decided to set up her own business selling clothing.

Lourdes works alone every day, all day long.  She does not rest.  She says that you have to work hard to achieve your goals.  It has been very difficult for Lourdes to run her business as the streets in her neighborhood aren't paved and the dust dirties her merchandise.  She would like to use her loan to buy men's and women's clothing such as blouses, shirts, etc.  Lourdes' goal is to grow her business and to have a better location for it.

loans.use: to buy men's and women's clothing such as blouses and shirts

loans.name: Paulina

texts.en:
Paulina, who lives in the Kongowea, Kenya is a water vendor. She is married and has two school-going children. She supplies water to her neighborhood; this idea came from the fact that there is a challenge of water delivery in the area. She began the business three years ago and also sells doughnuts.

A loan of KES 21,050 will help Paulina purchase a new water meter. Apart from the high cost of living all over which has reduced the disposable income of many customers of this type of business, Paulina has been facing the challenge of lack of finances for expansion.

loans.use: To purchase a new water meter.

loans.name: Eleni

texts.en:
Eleni is a 32-year-old married woman with five children. She would like to start growing taro and crops such as bananas to earn a living. 

Eleni has asked for a loan to purchase all the necessary equipment for her business. She has been a member of SPBD for years. Eleni will spend her profits to supply her family's daily needs.

loans.use: to buy shovels, a wheelbarrow and gloves.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace lives in the Kongowea area of Kenya. She is married and has three children. She owns a grocery shop, a business she has been operating for 10 years.

Grace learned about Milango through friends who invited her to the group. She joined with the aim of accessing credit to improve her business operations. Her main challenge is the inconsistency of her suppliers. 

Grace is applying for a loan of 21,050 KES to purchase additional stock of farm produce such as potatoes for sale. Her extra income from the loan will be added to her savings to improve the living standards of her family. Her dream is to see her business grow into a wholesale business.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock of farm produce such as potatoes for sale.

loans.name: Henry

texts.en:
Henry lives in Mariakani area of Coast province, Kenya. He is married and has six children. He owns a hardware store from where he sells timber and has been running it for the last sixteen years. He also runs a retail shop.

He learnt about Milango through a friend who invited him to the group and he joined with an aim of accessing credit to improve the business operations. The challenge he is facing is competition from other carpenters.

Henry is applying for a loan of 21,050 Kenya shillings to buy timber for the business. The extra income from the loan will be added to his savings to improve on the living standards of his family. His plan for the future is to become a major supplier of timber.

loans.use: To buy timber for the business.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy lives in Malindi area of Coast Province, Kenya. She is married and has two children; one of whom is in school. She owns a retail shop selling juice, bottled water, sweets etc and the business has been operating for three years. Lucy started the business through her personal savings. 

Lucy learnt about Milango through friends who invited her to the group and she joined the group with the aim of accessing credit to improve her business operations. Her main challenges are price fluctuations and inflation.

Lucy is applying for a loan of 21,050 Kenya shillings to buy retail stock like flour, sugar, salt, water, etc. The extra income from the loan will be added to her savings to help her pay the loan. Her future plan is to expand to a wholesale shop.

loans.use: To buy retail stock like flour, sugar, salt and water.

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha lives in the Malindi area of Coast province, Kenya. She is married and has two children, one who is in school. She is a green grocer and has been operating her store for three years, selling goods including fruit and vegetables, flour and cooking oil.

Martha learnt about Milango through a friend and joined with the aim of accessing credit to improve her business operations. The challenges she is facing are price fluctuations and inflation, the costs of purchasing stock and the seasonal nature of her business. She is applying for a loan of 41,900 Kenyan shillings (KES) to buy more vegetables wholesale. The extra income she generates from the loan will be added to her savings to expand the business. Martha's plans for the future are to start a clothes shop.

loans.use: To buy vegetables for her grocery store.

loans.name: Alititaiolemoana

texts.en:
Alititaiolemoana is a 23-year-old married woman with three children. She would like to start growing taro crops, taamu crops and bananas to earn a living. 

Alititaiolemoana has requested a loan to purchase equipment to start her business. She has been a member of SPBD for one year. Alititaiolemoana will spend her profits to provide for her family's daily needs.

loans.use: to buy shovels, a wheelbarrow, gloves and weed killer.

loans.name: Serafi

texts.en: Serafi is a 42-year-old married  woman with two children. She would like to start growing taro crops, taamu crops and bananas  to earn a living. Serafi has requested a loan to start her business. She has been a member of SPBD for one year. Serafi will spend her profits to help her children's education.

loans.use: to buy shovels, weed killer, gloves, bush knives.

loans.name: Fuafanua

texts.en: Fuafanua is a 44-year-old married woman with six children. She would like to start growing taro, taamu and bananas to earn a living. Fuafanua has requested a loan to buy equipment for her business. She has been a member of SPBD for a number of years. Fuafanua will spend her profits to help provide her family with their daily needs.

loans.use: to buy shovels, weed killer, gloves, and a wheel barrow.

loans.name: Kalala

texts.en: Kalala is a 32-year-old married woman with seven children. She makes and sells pork buns in her community to earn a living. She has many years of experience with this business. Kalala needs a loan to buy cooking ingredients for her business. She plans to use her profits to provide for her family's needs and also for her children's education. Kalala has been a member of SPBD since 2009.

loans.use: to buy flour, cooking oil, baking soda yeast and sugar.

loans.name: Luaao

texts.en: Luaao is a 22-year-old married woman with three children. She would like to start growing a variety of vegetables to earn a living. Luaao has requested a loan to buy fertilizers, sprayers, chemicals, chicken manure, a rake, a wheelbarrow and water hose for her business. She has been a member of SPBD since 2012. Luaao will spend her profits to pay for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, sprayers, chemicals, chicken manure, a rake, a wheelbarrow and water hose.

loans.name: Tagiilima

texts.en: Tagiilima is 54 years old and married with seven children. She wants to start a small business making and selling pancakes in her community. To do this, she needs a loan to buy a frying pan, flour, sugar, cooking oil and yeast. In the future, Tagiilima hopes to help out with her family's weekly expenses. She joined SPBD in 2012 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, frying pan, cooking oil and yeast.

loans.name: Marina

texts.en: Marina is 40 years old and married with 7 children. She wants to start a small business selling fish in her community. To do this, she needs a loan to buy some fishing equipment such as, goggles, fishing nets, spears, and flippers. In the future, Marina hopes to save some money for her children's college education. She joined SPBD in 2012 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy goggles, fishing nets, a spear and flippers.

loans.name: Edy Fernando

texts.es:
Edy es un hombre de 47 años, soltero, tiene cursados estudios de primaria y vive con su hijo de 15 años y su hija de 12. Juntos viven en una parroquia rural de la ciudad de Quito capital de la provincia del Ecuador, su nombre es Gualea, parroquia ubicada al noroccidente de la Provincia de Pichincha, que fue residencia de una cultura ecuatoriana conocida como Los Yumbos. Es un lugar poseedor de diversidad de flora y fauna y además ríos y cascadas que son una fuente cristalina que atrae turistas nacionales y extranjeros, por lo que sus habitantes aprovechan la oportunidad para ofrecer tours, servicio de hospedaje, alimentación, deportes naturales como cabalgatas, etc. Otro medio de producción de la zona es la ganadería con la producción de leche y carne y también la agricultura con la producción de caña de azúcar, yuca, caña, maíz, naranjas, mandarinas y papayas. Las artesanías elaboradas a mano también son una oportunidad de negocio en el lugar, que son demandadas por el uso particular de materiales naturales como semillas del bosque. Por todo esto las autoridades locales se han preocupado por hacer instalaciones adecuadas para que todos sus más de 2000 habitantes tengan acceso a los servicios básicos.
Edy encontró la oportunidad de crecimiento en la actividad ganadera que le enseñaron sus padres y en la cual emprendió desde hace 26 años. Cada día se levanta muy temprano para ordeñar sus vacas y salir a vender la leche a sus clientes, lo que suma 8 horas y a veces más. Edy mira a Fundación Alternativa como una oportunidad de crecimiento, por el apoyo que brindan al sector rural con créditos y capacitaciones oportunos, por lo que solicitó un crédito con el cual comprará más vacas para incrementar su producción y de esta forma mejorar sus ingresos y así cubrir por completo las necesidades de sus hijos a quienes espera un día poderlos ver convertidos en unos excelentes profesionales.
texts.en:
Edy is a 47-year-old single man who has an elementary school level of education and lives with his 15-year-old son and 12-year-old daughter.  The family lives together in a rural parish, in the city of Quito, the capital of Ecuador.  The parish is called Gualea and it is in the north-west of Pinchincha province which was home to an Ecuadoran culture known as Los Yumbos.  This area boasts a diversity of flora and fauna, as well as rivers and waterfalls which are crystal clear and attract both domestic and international tourists.  Locals make the most of this opportunity to offer tours, accommodations, food and outdoor sports such as horse riding, etc.  Other common businesses in the area are livestock raising (for meat and milk) and the farming of sugarcane, cassava, maize, oranges, mandarins and papaya.  Hand-made crafts are also a good business opportunity here and the goods are in demand because they use natural materials such as seeds.  As a result of all this, the local authorities have worked to install adequate systems so that all of the 2,000+ inhabitants have access to basic services.

Edy has the opportunity to develop the livestock-raising business that he learned from his parents and which he has been working in for the last 26 years.  Every day, he gets up very early to milk his cows and goes out to sell their milk to his customers.  He works for eight hours, sometimes more.  Edy sees Fundación Alternativa as offering an opportunity to grow his business because they provide support to the rural community through loans and training.  He requested a loan to buy more cows so that he can increase his production and thereby improve his income and cover all his children's needs because, one day, he would like to see them become top professionals.

loans.use: to buy cows to produce more milk

loans.name: Selema

texts.en: Selema is 50 years old and married with 6 children. She wants to start a small business making and selling ice cakes and ice pops in her community. To do this, she needs a loan to buy cordials, sugar, plastic bags, foam cups and a cooler. In the future, Selema hopes to expand her business. She joined SPBD in 2012 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy cordials, sugar, a cooler, plastic bags, and foam cups.

loans.name: Ana

texts.en:
Ana is 24 years old and single  with no children. She has a small plantation where she grows taro, bananas, etc., that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for many years. 

Ana needs a loan to buy new equipment to improve her business. She has been a member of SPBD since 2008. Ana will use the profits from her sales to help provide her family's daily needs.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, weed killers, a grass cutter, and bush knives,.

loans.name: Aneta

texts.en: Aneta is 21 years old and married with one child. She wants to start a small business making and selling pork buns in her community. To do this, she needs a loan to buy some flour, pots, salt, cooking oil, pork, and ginger. In the future, Aneta hopes to expand her business. She joined SPBD in 2012 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy pork, cooking oil, a large pot, salt, ginger, and flour to make pork buns to sell.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is 25 years old and married with four children. She runs a small business selling pancakes in her community and has been doing this for many years. 

Victoria has requested a loan to improve her home's condition and to buy more goods for her business. She joined SPBD in 2008 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Victoria will help her family's living condition.

loans.use: to buy flour, cooking oil, sugar, and a new frying pan for her pancake-making business.

loans.name: Faaiuga

texts.en:
Faaiuga is a 28-year-old married woman with no children. She would like to start growing a variety of veggies to earn a living. 

Faaiuga has requested a loan to buy sprayers, chemicals, chicken manure, shovels and a wheelbarrow. She has been a member of SPBD since 2012. Faaiuga will use her profits to maintain the well-being of her family.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, sprayers, chicken manure, shovels, and a wheelbarrow

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is 25 years old and married with three children. She wants to start a small business selling fish in her community. To do this, she needs a loan to buy a fishing net, lures, and other fishing gear. 

In the future, Agnes hopes to buy another fishing boat to help out with her business. She joined SPBD in 2012 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets, lures and other fishing gear

loans.name: Sialei

texts.en:
Sialei is 24 years old and married with four children. She wants to start a small business selling fish in her community. To do this, she needs a loan to buy lures, bait, hooks, and a canoe. 

In the future, Sialei hopes to expand her business in other nearby villages. She joined SPBD in 2012 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy lures, bait, hooks, fishing nets and a canoe

loans.name: Jérôme

texts.fr: Jérôme est âgé de 34 ans et vit au Bénin. Jérôme a fréquenté l’école jusqu’au niveau primaire. Jérôme est marié à Léontine, une marchande. Le couple a trois enfants à leur charge, tous scolarisés. Parmi les enfants, deux sont leurs propres enfants. Jérôme vit ensemble avec sa femme et ses enfants et assure ensemble avec sa femme, les charges de la maison. Afin d’assurer les diverses charges de la famille, Jérôme mène comme activité depuis dix neuf ans, la vente des porcs à son domicile. Jérôme s’approvisionne dans une ville du Bénin et au Burkina Faso. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Jérôme sollicite pour la première fois, un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Ce prêt lui permettra certainement de rehausser le niveau de son activité et de se faire plus de profits.
texts.en:
Jérôme is 34 years old and lives in Benin. He has a primary school education. He is married to a merchant named Léontine. The couple has three children living in their care, all of whom have received schooling. Two of the children living in their care are their own biological children. Jérôme lives with his wife and children, and he and his wife both cover the household expenses together.

In order to cover his family's expenses, Jérôme has been selling pigs from his home for nineteen years now. He stocks up in a town in Benin and in Burkina Faso.

Jérôme is seeking a loan from ALIDé for the first time, in the hopes of satisfying his customers and increasing his sales and revenue. The loan will definitely allow him to expand his business and earn more profit.

loans.use: to buy pigs

loans.name: Omar

texts.en:
Omar lives in Malindi area of Coast Province, Kenya. He is married and has four children; three of whom are in school. He owns a retail shop that he has been operating for three years. He also runs a food café.

He learnt about Milango through friends who invited him to the group and he joined the group with the aim of accessing credit to improve his business operations. His main challenges are price fluctuations and inflation, seasonal weather and purchasing stock.

Omar is applying for a loan of 21,050 Kenya shillings to buy retail stock like cooking oil, soap, flour etc. The extra income from the loan will be added to his savings to pay for school fees. His future plan is to open another stall.

loans.use: To buy retail stock like cooking oil, soap and flour.

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.en:
This is Eduardo. He previously accessed a 10,000 PHP loan that he used to buy spare parts and accessories and pay for the maintenance of his tricycle unit. His earnings were a big help for the education of his children and in his personal, household, and business expenditures. 

He would like to apply for another 15,000 PHP loan to buy spare parts, pay for the maintenance of his tricycle unit, and also buy some equipment for his repair shop. His profits from his business will definitely help him to sustain his daily needs and pay for the educational expenses of his children. He looks forward to this financial increase with happiness and thankfulness in his heart. 

Eduardo hopes to buy another tricycle unit and hopes to support his children's schooling up to the college level. He faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work every week. He also draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for the spare parts and maintenance of his tricycle unit

loans.name: Kazungu

texts.en:
Kazungu is a married business lady who lives in Malindi and sells roofing materials commonly referred to as ‘makuti’. These items are preferred for roofing in the Malindi area and on the coast in general since they protect from the heat which is experienced at the coast during the day time. She has been running the business for two years.

Kazungu was introduced to Milango by her friends and is applying for a loan of 21,050 Kenya shillings to purchase more coconut leaves and thread for sewing. Her main challenges are high inflation which has reduced the purchasing power of most customers and lack of reliable customers. Kazungu will save the additional income from this loan.

loans.use: To buy more coconut leaves and thread for sewing.

loans.name: Carmen Rita

texts.es:
Carmen es madre soltera tiene 2 hijos ella empezó hace seis años en el negocio de las ventas de cosméticos perfume y bisutería. Una amiga de Carmen  la incentivo para que vendiera productos de AVION y L’BEL .Carmen necesitaba de alguna forma tener ingresos ya que tenia cumplir con  la responsabilidad de sus hijos y casa y de alguna forma tenia que responder con las necesidades de ellos es así que se decidió por entrar en este negocio lo hace bien y los resultados de los ingresos son excelente. Ella trabaja sola  de 9.00 am hasta 18:00 pm. 
Ella visita a familiares, amigos y conocidos a sus hogares para ofrecerles los productos. Carmen le teme a la delincuencia que cuando este recaudando dinero a sus clientes le roben. Con el prestamo quiere comprar perfumes, cremas, cosmeticos, desodorantes etc. Su meta es ser una consultora ser la líder  en el  mercado de ventas de productos AVION y L’BEL en  tener un local para exhibir el producto.
texts.en:
Carmen is a single mother with two children.  She started her business selling cosmetics, perfumes and costume jewelry six years ago.  A friend encouraged her to sell Avon and L'Bel products.  Carmen needed a way of making money because she had to meet her responsibilities toward her children and her home and provide for their needs.  For that reason, she decided to go into this business.  She is doing well and her income is excellent.  She works alone, from 9.00am to 6.00pm. 

Carmen visits family members, friends and acquaintances in their homes to offer them her products.  She fears crime.  She is afraid that when she is collecting money from her customers, somebody will steal from her.  She would like to use her loan to buy perfumes, creams, cosmetics, deodorants, etc.  Her goal is to become a consultant and to become the market leader selling Avon and L'Bel products.  She would also like to have premises where she can display her products.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, creams, cosmetics and deodorants

loans.name: Deimer

texts.es: Deimer tiene 22 años u muchos sueños de prosperidad, entre los que está generar para su vida y para su familia cada vez más un mejor nivel de vida.Él se dedica al negocio de venta de fritos, desde hace 5 años  cuando se lo ideo por la falta de una oportunidad laboral estable;  actualmente vende patacones rellenos, arepa de huevo, papa rellena, empanadas y los ofrece directamente al consumidor final, de contado y con una frecuencia diaria. Sus compras las realiza en el mercado público de Barranquilla, buscando siempre los proveedores que mejor precio y calidad le ofrezcan. Su meta más adelante es tener un local propio, para no tener que pagar arriendo. Su propósito inmediato es que sus hijos terminen sus estudios y su mayor desafío es apoyarlos económicamente hasta conseguir su sueño.En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva que invertiría en la compra de materias primas e insumos en un mayor volumen,  como  aceite, yuca, papa, maíz, carne, y para  comprar un mesón en lámina galvanizada; planea que con esta inversión su negocio mejore su estructura y lograr disminuir los costos, para ganar más dinero con el que aumentar su bienestar familiar.
texts.en:
Deimer is 22 years old and has dreams of prosperity.  These dreams include making enough money for himself and his family so that they can continue improving their standard of living.  Deimer's business is selling fried food.  He has been in this business for five years and started it because he couldn't find a stable job.  He currently sells stuffed fried plantain, arepas filled with egg, 'papas rellenas' (ground beef covered with mashed potato and fried) and empanadas.  He sells his food directly to the customers who eat it.  He makes his sales every day, for cash.

Deimer makes his purchases in the public market in Barranquilla.  He is always looking for suppliers who offer the best price and quality.  His goal for the future is to own his own premises so that he no longer has to pay rent.  His immediate goal is for his children to finish their studies and his biggest challenge is supporting them financially until he achieves this dream.  Deimer is currently applying for a Kiva loan which he will invest in buying raw materials and supplies in larger quantities.  He will buy oil, cassava, potatoes, maize and meat, and also a galvanized metal counter.  With this investment, he plans to improve his business structure and lower his costs so that he can earn more money and improve his family's well-being.

loans.use: to buy raw materials and supplies such as oil, cassava, potatoes, corn and meat in large quantities and to buy a galvanized metal counter

loans.name: Taaloga

texts.en:
Taaloga is a 34-year-old married woman with six children. She makes and sells donuts, sandwiches, drinks etc in her community to earn a living. She has five years of experience with this business. 

Taaloga needs a loan to buy more goods to expand her business. She plans to use her profits to supply her family’s daily needs. Taaloga became a member of SPBD in 2012.

loans.use: to buy flour, cooking oil, baking soda and yeast.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is here again to ask for financial assistance from Kiva lenders who once helped her with her business through her previous loan. 

She has been engaged in vending fruits and vegetables in her village for a long time. Her income from vending is being used to sustain her family’s daily needs. She hopes to maintain her business for the welfare of her family. Teresita requests a loan of PHP 8,000 to use as her additional working capital to purchase more goods to sell. Some of her loan will also be used to sustain the vegetables that she planted in their backyard. It needs fertilizer and other medicines to have a good harvest. She hopes to avail herself the loan for the development of her business. 

Teresita is married to Juanito who is also one of the farmers in their village. They have five children, four of whom are adults already. Their youngest is still attending high school and he is the only one left studying.

loans.use: To purchase more goods to sell and more fertilizer for her fields.

loans.name: Thy's Group

texts.en:
Thy is aged 33 years and married. She has two children, both of whom are under her responsibility as they are still in school. Her family lives in a rural area of the Dambae district of Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. To support the family, she has been planting cassava for ten years and supplementing the family’s income by selling grocery items. From the current business, she is able to earn almost 27,000 KHR per day and manages to save about 10,000 KHR each day for future needs. 

Thy has been with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, for two cycles and successfully repaid the loans while the other member has just joined VisionFund this cycle. She has wisely used to past loans to support her children’s education. Now she is leading her group of two to apply for a loan.

Thy will use her portion to buy fertilizer and pesticides for her farmland and use a portion of it to pay for labourers. She hopes this loan will enable her to grow cassava more productively and sell it for a good price so as to improve her standard of living and keep her children in school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticides for her farmland.

loans.name: Lim's Group

texts.en:
Lim, 30, is married with two daughters, both of whom are dependent on her and still in school. Her family lives in a rural area of the Ou Reang Ov district of Kampong Cham province. To support the family, she has been farming rice on one-hectare of farmland for eighteen years and supplementing the income by working as a paid worker in the local area. The current business earns her approximately 15,000 KHR per day and she manages to save about 7,000 KHR each day after deducting daily expenses. The low price of her crop yield is the main challenge for her business.

Lim’s group consists of two female members who are both first-cycle clients with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. Both of them are requesting the same loan amount of 1,000,000 KHR. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland and use a portion of it to pay for labor fees. She hopes this loan will enable her to grow her rice in a timely and fruitful manner so she will be able to sell it for a high price. This will allow her to make a better living and also to fulfill her dream of expanding her current business.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and to pay for the cost of labor on her farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ou Reang Ov district

loans.name: Ouk's Group

texts.en:
Living in a rural area of the Ou Reang Ov district of Kampong Cham province, Cambodia, Ouk is a 61-year-old mother of four children. She has earned a living to support the family through farming rice on a two-hectare area of farmland for thirty-three years. The current business earns her approximately 15,000 KHR per day and she manages to save about 8,000 KHR each day after deducting daily expenses. Low crop yield is the main challenge for her business.

This is the first microloan for Ouk’s group with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. She and her group member are applying for a loan with VisionFund of 1,000,000 KHR and 500,000 respectively KHR. As the leader, Ouk will use her portion of the loan to buy fertilizer for her farmland and use a portion of it to pay for labor to transplant rice seedlings. She hopes her crop yield will become more profitable so as to improve her living conditions and also so she will be able to expand her paddy-field.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ou Reang Ov district

loans.name: Jesil

texts.en:
Jesil is 39 years old and married. She has four children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Jesil is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Jesil has been farming rice  for six years and also earns additional income from raising ducks.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Ana

texts.en:
This is Ana, 40, a resident of GMA, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Rolly and a mother to their children. She together with her husband manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Ana makes and sells chicken breading. She has workers in her business who help her in making the mix for the breading. She is the supplier of some grocery stores and variety stores. She earns a minimum of PHP 800 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 20,000 loan. She will be using the loan to buy ingredients and supplies needed in her business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Ana hopes to give her children a good and quality education and dreams to have a good life through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for ingredients and supplies needed in her business.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecelia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase more items to sell in her store.

NWTF is relisting Cecelia's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell in her store.

loans.name: Mai

texts.en:
Mai, 44, is single. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. 

Mai supports her family by running a general store in front of her house. She started this business two years ago. She sells snacks, toys, soft drinks, yogurt and other household items to people in her community. 

She is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying a greater variety of products, in particular foods and household items, to stock her store and better satisfy her customers. She hopes her business runs smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy a greater variety of products to stock her store.

loans.name: 040126 Giang Sơn -Hoằng Trường Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Thảo operates a food stall/restaurant selling fish. Thảo has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. 

Thảo is 48 years old and she is married with three children. Thảo supports her two dependent children with her business in Hoang Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province. Her third child is grown up. The main hardship that Thảo faces in her business is the lack of capital.

She is requesting a loan to purchase a net to fish. This is Thảo first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women. She is the leader of a 7-member group, the 040126 Giang Sơn -Hoằng Trường solidarity group. 

In the future, Thảo hopes to make enough money to provide for her kids, to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business, and to maintain a successful business.

loans.use: to purchase a net to fish.

loans.name: Altantuya

texts.en:
Mr. Altantuya, who is 43 years old, lives with his wife and two children, in a house, in the Orhon province of Mongolia. His wife's name is Dariimaa. His son is a college student, and his daughter is secondary school student. Since 1994, Mr. Altantuya has been doing his organic vegetable business in Uvs and Orhon provinces. He plants organic potatoes, organic tomatos, cucumbers etc. He is well-experienced in this sector. 

His wife, Dariimaa, rents an organic vegetable-selling counter in the market of Orhon province. Mr. Altantuya planted a 5.5 hectare organic vegetable field.  He is asking for 5,000,000 MNT to spend on gasoline, food and wages for his workers to harvest organic vegetables. He is honest, and his family members are hardworking people.

loans.use: To pay for gasoline, food and wages for his workers to harvest organic vegetables.

loans.name: Men's Group

texts.en:
Age 62 years, Men is a widowed mother of six children, one of whom is dependent on her and helps the family’s business. Men lives in a rural village of the Or Reang Ov district of Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She has struggled to feed the children through farming rice on one hectare of farmland. Having been in this business for 27 years, she is able to earn about 10,000 KHR per day and manage to save about 3,000 KHR each day after offsetting daily expenses. 

Men is in her first loan with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. She is now leading her group of two females to ask for a loan of 1,000,000 KHR each. As the leader, she is going to buy fertilizers for her farmland and use a portion of it to buy a water pump for her rice field. She hopes this loan will enable her to grow her rice more productively and qualitatively so as to improve her family's standard of living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and a water pump for her farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ou Reang Ov district

loans.name: Juan Jose

texts.es:
Juan José  es un hombre agricultor de 33 años de edad. El vive en Sololá, con su esposa, su hija de 2 años y sus padres. 

El cultiva zuquini, alverja china y maíz en el lugar de su vivienda. Lo realiza desde hace 7 años por que se dio cuenta que son las verduras que mantienen mejores precios en su región. La cual tiene el deseo de seguir sembrando en otros terrenos que el tiene para tener beneficios. 

El necesita y solicita un préstamo por la cantidad de Q 4,000.00 para la compra de plantillas de alverja china, abono orgánico, insecticida y mas. Viendo las ganancias que obtiene actualmente el quiere seguir trabajando más para sostener a toda su familia.

En el futuro el sueña con construir una mejor vivienda y poder darle mejores estudios académicos a su hija ya que el no tuvo esa oportunidad de asistir a una escuela pero quiere darle ese apoya a su hija.
texts.en:
Juan José is a 33 year old farmer.  He lives in Sololá with his wife, their two year old daughter, and his parents.

He grows zucchini, snow peas, and corn at the place where his house is.  He has been doing this for seven years because he realized that these are the vegetable that maintain better prices in his region.  He wishes to continue planting on other land that he has in order to have profits.

He needs to request a loan for 4,000 quetzales in order to buy young snow pea plants, organic fertilizer, insecticide, and more.  Upon seeing the income that he currently gets, he wants to continue working more in order to support his whole family.

In the future he dreams of building a better house and being able to give his daughter a better education.  He never had the opportunity to go to school, and he wants to give this support to his daughter.

loans.use: to buy young snow pea plants to cultivate.

loans.name: Ut

texts.en:
Ut is a 50-year-old widowed woman living in Ho Chi Minh City. She has two children. 

Ut earns a living running a general store and Internet service, which she has done for 20 years. 

Ut would like to take a loan to renovate her Internet service by buying new computers and accessories. She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her existing customers and attract additional customers. She also hopes that through the loan her business will generate a higher income and will help her to improve her family's living conditions and enable her to save money to meet any future difficulties.

loans.use: to buy new computers and accessories for her internet service.

loans.name: Heam's Group

texts.en:
A resident from a rural area of the Ou Reang Ov district of Kampong Cham province, Cambodia, Heam is 57 years old and married with five children, one of whom is dependent on her and still in school. To make a living, Heam has been farming rice on five-hectare of farmland for 25 years and complements the family’s income by raising pigs. She is able to earn about 15,000 KHR per day and save about 7,000 KHR each day for future needs. Low price of her crop yield is the main challenge for her paddy-field. 

Heam’s group consists of four female members; all of whom are first-time borrowers and requesting the same loan amount of 1,000,000 KHR each. As the leader, Heam is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland and use a portion of it to buy pig feed. She hopes to grow her rice healthfully and fruitfully so as to make living better and keep her child in school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her farmland and pig's feed

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ou Reang Ov district

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase four window sills and four door frames for the new rooms.

loans.name: Giau

texts.en:
Giau is 54 years old and divorced. She has two daughters. 

She supports her family by selling seafood in the local community. She would like to borrow a loan to buy a larger quantity and higher quality of food such as shellfish, snails and other ingredients at wholesale prices to sell from her stall. 

She hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy a larger quantity and higher quality of food such as shellfish and snails to sell from her stall.

loans.name: 040134 Giang Sơn -Hoằng Trường Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Nhiều operates a food stall/restaurant selling fish. She is requesting a loan to purchase a net to fish. 

Nhiều is 54 years old and she is married with four children. She supports two of her children who are dependent on her with her business in Hoang Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province. Nhiều has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.
The main hardship that Nhiều faces in her business is the lack of capital.

This is Nhiều  first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women. She is the leader of a 6-member group, the 040138 Giang Sơn -Hoằng Trường  solidarity group. 

In the future, Nhiều hopes her children will graduate from college and find a good job, and that she will maintain a successful business.

loans.use: to purchase a net to fish.

loans.name: Sonia Patricia

texts.es:
Sonia inicio con su negocio gracias a la ayuda de sus familiares que la vieron sola y le recomendaron poner su negocio en casa. Ahora pueda  cuidar a sus a 2 hijos unos ya es mayor de edad y el otro es menor que están bajo su responsabilidad gracias al apoyo de sus familiares ha podido seguir adelante. Su trabajo lo hace sola desde las 8:00am hasta las 18:00pm.

Tiene un taller de costura en donde hace blusas, vestidos. Unas de sus dificultades son las enfermedades ya cuando se enferma tiene que sacar Fuerzas de donde sea ya que es el pilar fundamental en su hogar. Con el prestamo quiere comprar telas y una maquina de coser. Unas de sus metas es trabajar para mi familia y seguir trabajando para  D-miro para aumentar su negocio.
texts.en:
Sonia started her business based on the support of her relatives who saw that she was alone and suggested establishing a business at home. 

Now is able to take care of her two children. One of them is already grown up but the other is still young. She is looking after them and thanks to the support of her relatives they are able to get by. She does all her work between 8 am and 6 pm. 

Sonia has a sewing workshop where she makes blouses and dresses. Sickness is a great difficulty for her because when she is sick she still has to find the strength to continue somehow because she is the pillar of the household. 

With the loan she plans to purchase fabric and a sewing machine. One of her goals is to work for her family and to continue working with D-MIRO to grow her business.

loans.use: to purchase fabric and a sewing machine.

loans.name: Oun's Group

texts.en:
Oun, 45 years old, is a married mother who lives in a rural area of the Tbaung Khmum district of Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She has five children, two of whom are dependent on her. To make a living, she has been working in rubber-fields for others for a fee. Engaging in this business for twenty-five years, she is able to earn about 8,000 KHR per day and manages to save about 2,000 KHR each day after daily expenses. 

Oun’s group consists of three members. She has already been with VisionFund for one cycle while the other members are new to VisionFund this cycle. The first loan, which she has recently just repaid, helped her to relieve family’s burden and improve their livelihood. 

Now she and her group members are seeking for a loan of 1,000,000 KHR each. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to renovate her house. She hopes this loan will enable her to have a decent house for her children, so she does not need to worry about her house conditions especially during the rainy season.

loans.use: To renovate her house.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Thavy's Group

texts.en:
Thavy, 39, lives in a rural village of the Tbaung Khmum district of Kampong Cham province. She is married with four children, two of whom are dependent on her. To support the family, she has been working in a rubber-field for others for a fee. Having been involved in this for five years, she is able to earn about 8,000 KHR per day and manage to save about 2,000 KHR each day after deducting daily expenses for future needs. 

This is Thavy’s second loan with VisionFund and she completely repaid the past loan which has improved her family living’s conditions. Now she is leading her group of three to apply for a loan. Thavy, who is the leader, will use her portion to buy household supplies. She hopes this loan will enable her to have enough working capital for running a new business so as to make a better living.

loans.use: To buy household supplies.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: 58-07-03-Quảng Hưng Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Hạnh works in agriculture farming poultry and cattle. She is requesting a loan to purchase poultry and cattle to raise for reselling in the future. 

Hạnh is 55 years old, married, and has two children. She is the group leader of the 58-07-03-Quảng Hưng solidarity group, which consists of seven members. 

She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, a urban area in Thanh Hoa province, with one dependent, her other child is grown. 

In 2010, Hạnh joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Hạnh has successfully repaid four loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Hạnh has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main harship that Hạnh faces in her business is the lack of capital. 

With her business profits, Hạnh hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her children to graduate from college, and to build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase poultry and cattle to raise for reselling in the future.

loans.name: Leitu

texts.en:
Leitu is 28 years old, married, and has one child. She has a small plantation and grows taro, taamu (giant taro), and bananas, which she has been doing for many years.

Leitu is requesting a loan, which she will use to buy new equipment for her business. She has been a member of SPBD since 2011. With her profits, Leitu hopes to expand her business and increase her income.

loans.use: to purchase shovels, bush knives, grass cutter, and gloves.

loans.name: Chea's Group

texts.en:
Originally from a village of the Kampong Cham province's Ou Reang Ov district of Cambodia, Chea is a 63-year-old married mother of four children. The main source of her family's income is from rice farming, which she has engaged in for forty-three years in order to overcome her family's financial harship. She is able to earn approximately 15,000 Riel (KHR) per day and manages to save about 10,000 KHR each day after offsetting daily expenses. 

This is the first loan for Chea's group with Kiva's partner, VisionFund. She and her group member are applying for a loan of 1,000,000 KHR and 500,000 KHR respectively. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes to grow her rice more productively so as to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ou Reang Ov district

loans.name: 040138 Giang Sơn -Hoằng Trường Group

texts.en:
Mão is 49 years old and married with 4 children. She is the leader of a 6-member group, the 040138 Giang Sơn -Hoằng Trường solidarity group. Mão supports 1 dependent with her business in Hoang Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province. Three other children are grown up. Mrs. Mão operates a food stall/restaurant selling fish. She has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Mão faces in her business is the lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase a net to fish.

In 2005, Mão joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Mão has successfully repaid 5 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.



In the future, Mão hopes to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business, for her family to be healthy and happy, and to maintain  a successful business.

loans.use: to purchase a net to fish

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en: Marilou is a responsible mother who owns and manages a variety store in the Public Market to help her husband in gaining income for their family. She is 43 years old and has 3 school-age children. Due to the hardships of living, Marilou aimed to strengthen her variety store to generate sufficient income. She needed to earn a higher income so that they will continue sending their children to school and satisfy their necessities. She wants to ask for additional capital of 10,000 PHP to buy canned goods, noodles, seasonings, beverages, snack foods, soft drinks and vegetables to sell. She mentioned that this loan will be a great help for her to improve the business and she is hoping that she will make the business grow and more profitable.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, noodles, seasonings, beverages, snack food, soft drinks and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Eteroma

texts.en: Eteroma is 33 years old, married, and has one child. She wants to start a small business making and selling fish in her community. To do this, she needs a loan to buy a new canoe, spears, nets, and fishing lines. In the future, Eteroma hopes to help her family financially. She joined SPBD in 2012 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy a new canoe, spears, nets, and fishing lines

loans.name: Joel

texts.en:
Being a responsible father, Joel aims to become successful in life to provide his family's needs and give his children a better life. Likewise, Joel aims to strengthen his resources to earn sufficient income for his family. 

He is 37 years old and has three school-age children. He wants to continue sending his children to school so that they will earn degrees and find good jobs someday. 

Due to the high cost of school fees and commodities, he engages himself in a hog-raising business to generate additional income. He plans to raise more piglets for fattening but he has not enough capital. Therefore, he is asking for an additional PHP 25,000 to buy feeds, vitamins, vaccines and additional piglets to raise. He believes that through this loan, he will work out his plan and hopes that someday he will make the business profitable.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins, vaccines and additional piglets to raise.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph is 37 years old and married to Maricar. To make a living, Joseph provides motorcycle transport services to local community members. He has been engaged to his business for more than three years and earns approximately 300 PHP daily. Right now, Joseph is requesting a loan of  9,000 PHP which he will use to purchase paint, oil and gasoline for the maintenance of his business. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to purchase paint, oil and gasoline for the maintenance of his business.

loans.name: Taloa

texts.en: Taloa is a 44-year-old married woman with nine children. She would like to start growing taro, bananas and other crops to earn a living. Taloa has requested a loan to buy equipment for her business. She has been a member of SPBD for one year. Taloa will use her profits to supply her family's daily needs.

loans.use: to buy shovels, gloves, bush knives, a grass cutter and wheel barrow.

loans.name: Soknov's Group

texts.en:
Soknov, 42 years old, is a farmer who lives in a rural area of the Dambae district of Kampong Cham province. She has six children, five of whom are dependent on her and still in school. 

She earns a living through planting cassava on a four-hectare area of farmland that she and her husband have been farming for ten years. Lack of  working capital for supporting the current business remains the main challenge for her.

Soknov has been with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, for three cycles already while the other member has been with VisionFund for one cycle. The past loans have helped her to increase her income from the cassava planting business. 

Now leading her group of two to ask for a loan of 1,200,000 KHR each, Soknov will use her portion to buy pesticides for protecting her cassava business and to pay for weeding fees. 

She hopes to gain a good quality from her cassava yield in order to sell it for a high price, so she can obtain a better standard of living and keep her children in school.

loans.use: To buy pesticides for protecting her cassava business.

loans.name: Chantha's Group

texts.en:
Chantha, 32 years old, is a farmer who lives in a rural village of the Ratanak Mondul district of Battambang province. She has one son who is dependent on her and still in school. To support the family, she has been growing corn on two and half hectares of farmland for four years and complements the family’s income by selling grocery items.
