She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Annalisa operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns a profit by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 14,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Annalisa hopes to give her children a good and quality education and dreams of having a good life through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Felicidad

texts.en:
Felicidad is from Malibangcao, Clarin. She is 66 years old. Felicidad is married and has 6 children. To make a living, Felicidad plants, harvests and sells corn.  She has been doing this for 8 years and earns PHP 6,810 a month from these activities. 

In 2005, Felicidad joined GDMPC.  She is requesting a loan of PHP 8500, which will be used to purchase fertilizer such as manure. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: buy fertilizer

loans.name: Phustina

texts.en: Phustina continues operating her water vending business, which she has been doing for several years. Her biggest challenge is the frequent breakdown of the water pump and having to do general servicing of it. However, she does not give up. Phustina is requesting another loan to repair her water pump,  which is an important equipment for her business. She thanks Kiva and Yehu for their humble support.

loans.use: repair her water pump

loans.name: Filomena

texts.en: Filomena is a 58-year old resident of Ozamis City. She provides for her 3 children's needs from the little amount of 7,000 PHP she gains monthly from her piggery business which she has owned for 8 years.  She has been a member of GDMPC since 2010.  Filomena applied for a loan at GDMPC micro-finance for 7,500 PHP to buy feeding supplies. Filomena wants to make expansion to her business one day.

loans.use: buy feed for her pigs

loans.name: Cherryrose

texts.en:
Cherryrose is 25 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 2 children. 

Cherryrose makes and sells in her community, like banana cake and rice cake. She has had this business for 3 years. She requested a loan for 8,000 PHP to buy raw ingredients for making snacks, like sugar, rice, flour and cheese.

Cherryrose has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: buy ingredients to make snacks for sale

loans.name: Mukombogo

texts.en:
Mukombogo, 50, is a widow. She lives in her own house that has electricity but no piped water. Mukombogo has seven grown children, three of whom are still under her care.

She started raising and selling local poultry more than 15 years ago to earn income and support her family’s daily needs. It has been a profitable business, which sustained her even before her husband passed on. She is also thankful for her children's contribution to paying her expenses.

She has requested a 50,000 KES loan to buy chicks and chicken feeds. She hopes her sales will increase so that the business will grow. She enjoys this business because it is not too involved and gives her time to spend with her grandchildren.

loans.use: to buy chicks and chicken feeds.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: restock her store

loans.name: Thanya

texts.en: Thanya is a 49-year-old married female from Al Kaledieh in Jordan.  She has 2 children.  Thanya has requested a JOD 500 loan to open a grocery store near her house.  In the future she would like to expand her project and improve her family's situation.

loans.use: open a grocery store

loans.name: Afepeb Group

texts.fr: AFEPEB est un groupe de dix personnes, dont les membres résident dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, Albertine (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 44 ans et ne vit plus avec son mari. Albertine est mère de deux enfants tous scolarisés et sa charge. Albertine vit seule avec ses enfants. Albertine assure seule ses divers besoins ainsi que ceux de ses enfants. Albertine a peu fréquenté l’école. Il y a seize ans environs que Albertine mène comme activité la vente des tissus par le système de distribution et de façon ambulante. Albertine exerce cette activité passionnément, ce qui lui permet de subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants. Albertine s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle, Albertine sollicite un premier crédit avec les autres membres du groupe AFEPEB. Ce crédit leur servira à mieux répondre aux demandes de leur clientèle et à se faire plus de profits.
texts.en: Afepeb is a group of 10 individuals living in the same neighborhood. The group’s representative, Albertine (the one raising her hand in the photo), is 44 years old and separated from her husband. Albertine has two children, both attending school and in her care. Albertine lives alone with her two children. Albertine supports herself and her children. She has had little formal schooling. For about 16 years, Albertine has been selling fabric through a distribution system and also as a street vendor. She is dedicated to this work, which allows her to provide for her and her children’s needs. Albertine stocks up at one of the markets in Benin. With the goal of meeting customer demand, Albertine, along with the other members of the Afepeb group, is seeking her first loan. This loan will allow the group members to better respond to customer demand and increase their  revenues.

loans.use: to buy fabric.

loans.name: Jonathan

texts.en:
Jonathan is 64 years old, married and has four children.  To earn a living, he does crop farming.  He has been farming for 12 years. He also does fish and livestock farming.  Since he joined Faulu Kenya, Jonathan has grown his business because he has been trained on business management skills. 

Jonathan hopes to practice large-scale farming in the future.  He has requested for a loan of 20,000 KES to buy fertilizer, seedlings and pesticides.

loans.use: buy fertilizer, seedlings and pesticides

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is 35 years old.  She  is married to Wesamba and together they have four children.  She is a dairy farmer and has been in the business for the past eight years.  She gets a monthly income of 10,000 KES.

This is Beatrice's first loan with KADET LTD.  She was introduced to KADET LTD by loan officers.  She will use the loan amount to purchase dairy feed and also build a structure for her cows.  She hopes to be a leading dairy farmer in the near future.

loans.use: buy cow feed and build a cow shed

loans.name: Khatuna

texts.en:
Khatuna is fromTskaltubo district in West Georgia. She is 42 years old and lives with her husband and sister-in-law. Khatuna’s sister-in-law works as a cleaner at the local kindergarten and gets a small monthly income. The family runs an animal husbandry business -- they have 2 milk cows, a calf, a pig and 2 piglets. Khatuna milks the cows and produces cheese products. She also has agricultural land where maize is grown. The family does all the  relevant seasonal work to insure a good harvest. Their agricultural production is sold at the local market. Khatuna is very hard-working person, with great experience in her work.

Khatuna requested a loan to renovate her house. The existing house is old and damaged. Khatuna will purchase building materials and repair it. Then, the living conditions for the family will be improved and they will be able to spend their evenings after a hard working day in a more comfortable environment. Khatuna hopes for your help and kindness.

loans.use: renovate her house

loans.name: Edjromahu Group

texts.fr: EDJROMAHU est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres résident dans le même quartier au Bénin. La représentante du groupe, Elisabeth (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 44 ans et est mariée à Moïse, un pêcheur. Le couple a quatre enfants à leur charge, certains scolarisés. Elisabeth vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari. Elisabeth assure seule les différentes charges des enfants. Elisabeth n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Il y a près de quinze ans que Elisabeth mène comme activité la vente des crevettes et des poissons de façon ambulante. Elisabeth exerce cette activité passionnément, ce qui lui permet de subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants. Elisabeth s’approvisionne dans une ville du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle, Elisabeth sollicite un sixième crédit avec les autres membres du groupe EDJROMAHU. Ce crédit leur servira à mieux répondre aux demandes de leur clientèle et à se faire plus de profits. Les crédits précédents ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
EDJROMAHU is a group of three persons whose members reside in the same district in Benin. The group's representative, Elisabeth (whose hand is raised in the photo), is 44 years old and married to Moïse, a fisherman. The couple support four children, not all in school. Elisabeth lives together with her children and husband. She is alone in ensuring that the different expenses are covered for the children. 

Elisabeth did not attend school. For nearly fifteen years, she has had a business selling shrimp and fish door to door. She operates her business with passion, and this enables her to meet her needs and those of her children. She gets her supplies from a city in Benin. 

Seeking to satisfy her customers, Elisabeth is requesting, along with the other members of the group EDJROMAHU, a sixth loan for responding better to customer demands and making more profit. The previous loans were indeed paid back.

loans.use: to purchase fish to sell

loans.name: Arsenia

texts.en:
Arsenia is single without children.  She is 49 years old and lives in Pan-ay, Clarin.  Arsenia is a farmer and grows rice crops to earn a living. She has been doing this for 5 years.  

Arsenia has requested a loan to purchase additional fertilizer.  She has been a member of PMPC for 1 year. In the future, she hopes to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: buy fertilizer

loans.name: Jericho Nomba One Group

texts.fr: JERICHO NOMBA ONE est un groupe de deux personnes, dont les membres résident dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, Antoinette (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 66 ans et est mariée à un certain Joseph. Le couple a six enfants dont certains scolarisés et un reste à leur charge. Antoinette vit seule avec ses enfants et assure ensemble avec son mari, les différentes charges des enfants. Antoinette a arrêté l’école au niveau primaire. Il y a près de seize ans que Antoinette mène comme activité la vente des sacs de charbons de bois à son domicile. Antoinette exerce cette activité passionnément, ce qui lui permet de subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants. Antoinette s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle, Antoinette sollicite un troisième crédit avec les autres membres du groupe JERICHO NOMBA ONE. Ce crédit leur servira à mieux répondre aux demandes de leur clientèle et à se faire plus de profits. Les crédits précédemment reçus ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
JERICHO NOMBA ONE is a group of two persons whose members reside in the same district. The group's representative, Antoinette (whose hand is raised in the photo), is 66 years old and married to a man named Joseph. The couple have six children, not all in school. One of the children remains in their care. Antoinette lives alone with her children and ensures along with her husband that the different expenses are covered for the children.

Antoinette left school at the primary level. For nearly sixteen years, she has had a business selling sacks of charcoal out of her home. She operates her business with passion, and this enables her to meet her needs and those of her children. She gets her supplies from a market in Benin. 

Seeking to satisfy her customers, Antoinette is requesting, along with the other members of the group JERICHO NOMBA ONE, a third loan for responding better to customer demands and making more profit. The previously received loans were indeed paid back.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal to sell

loans.name: Roldano

texts.en:
Roldano is 30 years old, married, and has three children. He lives in Talibon, Bohol, Philippines. He is engaged in the tricycle transport business, which he has been doing for over four years.
 
Roldano is requesting a loan for 5,000 PHP, which he will use to buy fuel and spare parts for his motorcycle.  He joined CEVI because he was amazed by the positive changes the organization has made to the lives of the people in his community. In the future, Roldano wants to improve his livelihood and save money for the future schooling of his children.

loans.use: to purchase fuel and spare parts for his tricycle.

loans.name: Geneflor

texts.en:
Geneflor is 34 years old, married, and has two children. She lives in Clarin. Geneflor owns and operates a farm, planting and harvesting bananas, which he has been doing for five years. She earns 10,000 PHP a month. 

Geneflor is requesting a loan for 26,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase farm chemicals. She joined GDMPC in 2008. In the future, Geneflor wants to make improvements to her house and see her children finish their studies.

loans.use: to purchase farm chemicals.

loans.name: Alexander

texts.es: Alexander, tiene 28 años de edad, casado, vive con su esposa en el municipio de Tela, Atlántida. Hace 5 años que realiza su propia actividad de negocio, se dedica a la venta de productos lácteos como ser: leche, queso y cuajada. El compra leche a los productores y sale a vender en su vehículo todos los días de casa en casa en la comunidad y también elabora queso y cuajada. Este negocio es rentable y tiene buena clientela. El préstamo que solicita es por 10,000 Lempiras y lo utilizara para reparar el vehículo que utiliza para repartir el producto, le comprara las llantas nuevas.  Esta inversión le ayudara a brindar un buen servicio al cliente y a mantener activo su negocio. Su meta es expandir más el negocio y llegar a tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Alexander, 28, is married living with his wife in Tela, Atlántida.  He’s been in business for himself for five years.  He sells dairy products like milk, cheese and curd.  He buys milk from producers and then goes out to sell it in his vehicle from house to house in the community; he also makes cheese and curd.

This is a profitable business because he has a very good clientele.  He’s asking for a 10,000 Lempira loan to use to repair the vehicle he uses to deliver the product; he’ll buy new tires for it.  This investment will help him provide good customer service and to stay in business.  His goal is to expand the business more and to manage to get a house of his own.

loans.use: to buy tires for the truck he uses to sell dairy products.

loans.name: Amanda De Jesus

texts.es:
Amanda es una persona muy luchadora que con mucho esfuerzo ha tenido que ir saliendo adelante superando las grandes adversidades que se le han presentado en la vida. Desde hace unos años el padre de sus 2 hijos la abandonó y desde entonces ha quedado a cargo de las obligaciones del hogar, por esto comenzó una venta de dulces en una chaza en su municipio y con esto ha venido generando los ingresos para su hogar. Pese a que no cuenta con mucho capital, su esfuerzo le ha permitido ir creciendo poco a poco, y ahora que tiene la oportunidad de mejorar sus ventas, Amanda busca un préstamo para comprar surtido de dulces.

Amanda espera poder ofrecerles una mejor calidad de vida a sus 2 hijos y uno de ellos es una hija que se encuentra en muy mal estado de salud. Su sueño es lograr ubicarse en un local para tener mejores condiciones laborales.
texts.en:
Amanda’s a very tenacious person who has through her efforts been getting ahead overcoming the great difficulties that have arisen in her life.  A few years ago the father of her two children abandoned them and since then she’s had to take charge of household obligations so she started selling candy in a local square earning money for her home this way.  Despite not having much capital, her effort has made it possible for her to gradually grow and now that she has the opportunity of increasing sales, Amanda is looking for financing to buy an assortment of candy.

Amanda hopes to be able to provide her two children with a better quality of life.  One of her children is a daughter who is in very poor health.  Amanda’s dream is to be able to set up shop in a permanent locale so that she can work under more comfortable conditions.

loans.use: to buy an assortment of candies.

loans.name: Mariana

texts.es: Cuando Mariana compró un congelador usado desarrolló su idea de negocio, pues empezó vendiendo pollo y carne a lo que agregó huevos y posteriormente carnes frías. Esto ocurrió hace 2 años y aun no se detiene, porque a sus 29 años tiene muchos sueños de prosperidad, como el de educar a su hija profesionalmente, para potencializar su éxito y por eso, se esmera trabajando diariamente con el fin de lograrlo. En un establecimiento ubicado en su domicilio, ofrece los productos a sus clientes, que son principalmente vecinos del sector y referidos por ellos, a quienes les vende en un 70% de contado y el resto lo vende a crédito, desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 6 de la tarde sin descanso. En la actualidad su clientela se ha incrementado, pues es  el segundo semestre del año, época en la cual las ventas repuntan y muchas veces la rotación es tan rápida, que no puede satisfacer completamente a su clientela. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación, mediante el cual comprará pollo, carne de res y carnes frías, en mayor volumen, para ganar descuentos especiales e impactar a su clientela y ganar un poco más de lo acostumbrado y es que esta es la razón de éxito de su credikiva, porque su sueños es, más adelante, ampliar su oferta de productos, hasta convertir su negocio de cárnicos, en una tienda donde venda  al detalle, ranchos, víveres, enlatados, refrescos y de todo un poco de lo que sus vecinos necesiten encontrar.
texts.en:
Mariana developed her business idea when she bought a second-hand freezer. She started selling chicken and beef and then added eggs and processed meats. That happened two years ago and she doesn't stop. She is 29 years old and has many dreams of prosperity, such as to educate professionally her daughter, in order to boost her success. For this reason, she works hard every day with the goal to achieve it. 

In a business located at her home, she offers products to her customers, who are mainly neighbors from the area and others referred by them. She sells 70% in cash and the rest is sold on credit, from 8am to 6pm without any break. 

Today, her customers have increased, because is the second semester of the year at which time sales rebound. Often, rotation is so rapid that she can't satisfy completely her customers. This is the reason why she is applying for a Kiva loan, first financing she is doing with the Foundation. She will use the loan to buy chicken, beef, and processed meats in bulk, in order to get special discounts and impact her customers. She hopes to earn more than usual, and that's when the Kiva loan will be a success. 

Her dream is to expand her product offering in the future, until she turns her meat business into a retail store selling meals, supplies, canned food, soft drinks, and a bit of everything of what her neighbors need.

loans.use: to buy chicken, beef, and processed meats in bulk.

loans.name: Linda

texts.es: Linda de 28 años de edad vive en el municipio de Soledad, con su cónyuge y sus 4 hijos en las edades de 1 a 6 años. Ella se dedica a la preparación y venta de comidas rápidas, desde hace 5 años, cuando no encontró empleo y se dedicó a lo que conocía muy bien: las comidas rápidas”. En su negocio vende pizza, perros calientes derivados de la harina frituras y otras alternativas que ha creado paso a paso, para complacer a su clientela. Su negocio está ubicado en la puerta de su domicilio y es muy conocido por su clientela que la conforma, transeúntes, y vecinos del sector. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo mediante el cual comprará con el cual comprará materias primas como harina, panes, salchichas, papas, aceite y diversos tipos de carnes en mayor volumen, con los cuales ganará descuentos que trasladará al precio de ventas de cada producto, mientras deleita a su distinguida clientela.
texts.en:
Linda, 28, lives in Soledad with her spouse and four children whose ages range from 1 to 6 years.  She has been making fast-food to sell for the last five years.  When she was unable to find employment she went into what she knows how to do very well: fast-food meals.  She sells pizza, hot-dogs, various items made from fried dough and other items she’s created step by step to please her customers.  Her business is located at her doorstep and it’s very well-known among her customers, passersby and local neighbors.

She’s currently applying for a Kiva loan, her first from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo that she will use to buy raw materials like flour, bread, sausages, potatoes, oil and various types of meat in large volume so that she can qualify for discounts that she’ll pass on to her sales price of each product for her distinguished clientele’s enjoyment.

loans.use: to buy raw materials like flour, bread, sausages, potatoes, oil and various types of meat in large volume.

loans.name: Isaac

texts.en:
Isaac is a 17-year-old full-time student at African Leadership Academy (ALA), a two-year pre-university program in Johannesburg, South Africa, with a mission to identify, develop, and connect Africa’s future leaders. 

Isaac was selected as one of 95 ALA students out of a pool of over 3,000 applicants from across the continent for his passion for public service, his commitment to Africa, and his demonstrated leadership potential to lead change in Africa and beyond. 

Isaac is applying for a loan of $500, which will enable him to purchase a laptop to conduct assignments and research, to run his community service project and/or student run business which forms part of the ALA curriculum, and to participate fully in the world-class program offered by ALA.

Isaac comes from Benoni, South Africa where he lived with his mother, a single parent.

For Isaac, being a leader means that “in the face of a difficult situation or when solutions are needed, he is willing to assist in all relief efforts, to take a stand and think big.”

He is passionate about helping the less privileged and sees his mission as “sustaining the smiles of those who are already smiling and putting a smile on the faces of those who are sad.” He is also very passionate about healthcare and wants to become a neuro-cardiologist. To this end, Isaac volunteers at a local hospital. 

Academically, Isaac is a high achiever. He has won the Principals Award for academic merit and was among the top ten performing students at his school.

Isaac plans to impact Africa by providing essential healthcare facilities and healthcare education within communities. He wants to earn leadership roles that will enable him to initiate healthcare reform and to pioneer the study of neuro-cardiology to make the brain and heart collaborate to prevent heart disease and extend life.  He also wants to use music to promote freedom and unity.  “We can create equality when we have equal access to good health care, and we can communicate together efficiently when we sing in the same harmony,” he says.

Through politics, he also plans to implement the necessary healthcare reforms that will "make the continent a jewel in global transformation." Lastly, he hopes to venture into music and use it to "inspire future generations to move forward with positivity." He hopes to found the "spread love foundation" with the mission of "transforming and changing the lives of people living in Africa so that our progress can have a massive ripple effect: a tsunami of change."

loans.use: to purchase a laptop for his studies

loans.name: Nuvia Xiomara

texts.es:
Nuvia, de 36 años de edad, está casada y tiene 4 hijos de 12, 15, 16 y 19 años de edad, vive con su familia en una aldea del municipio Esparta Atlántida.
 Doña Nuvia, es una persona muy emprendedora, ella tiene dos negocios uno es la cría y venta de cerdos y el otro es una pulpería donde vende productos de la canasta básica familiar como ser granos básicos, lácteos, churros, productos de limpieza, medicamentos, jugos, refrescos etc. La pulpería la estableció hace 5 años  y la otra actividad de cría de cerdos hace más de 3 años. Su gran motivación de obtener ingresos y esforzarse con los negocios ha sido el deseo de superación de sus hijos dándoles la oportunidad de estudio.
Esta solicitando un segundo préstamo por 25,000 Lempiras con el cual quiere comprar más cerdos para engorde y venderlos en esta temporada de fin de año y comprar pollos para cría que también en su comunidad tiene gran demanda. El préstamo anterior le ayudo a generar ganancias y a mantener activo sus actividades de negocio. Su meta es generar buenas ganancias para el bienestar familiar.
texts.en:
Nuvia, 36, is married and has four children who are 12, 15, 16 and 19 years old; she lives with her family in a village in the municipality of Esparta, Atlántida.

Nuvia is a very enterprising woman.  She has two businesses:  one is raising and selling pigs and the other is a grocery store where she sells staples like basic grains, dairy products, packaged snacks, cleaning supplies, medicine, juice, soft-drinks, etc.  She opened the grocery store five years ago and she’s been in the pig business for three years.  Her great motivator is to earn income and to strive with the businesses so that she can provide her children with the opportunity of having an education and improving themselves.

She’s asking for her second loan in the amount of 25,000 Lempiras to buy more pigs to fatten up and sell during the end of year season and also to buy chicks to raise which are also in high demand in her community.  The previous loan helped her to generate profits and to stay in business.  Her goal is to generate good income for her family’s wellbeing.

loans.use: to buy pigs and chicks to raise for subsequent sale.

loans.name: Rhoda

texts.en:
Rhoda is 28 years old. She is a boutique owner in Mombasa. She is married to James and together they are blessed with two children aged eight and four years.  She has been doing the boutique business for the past two years successfully. 

This is Rhoda’s second business loan from KADET LTD to finance her business. She plans to purchase more shirts, blouses, shoes, trousers and handbags to sell to her customers. She will use the anticipated profits to repay her loan and educate her children. 

She hopes to own a bigger, more profitable boutique shop.

loans.use: to purchase more shirts, blouses, shoes, trousers and handbags

loans.name: Gordon

texts.en:
Gordon is a 17-year-old full-time student at African Leadership Academy (ALA), a two year pre-university program in Johannesburg, South Africa, with a mission to identify, develop, and connect Africa’s future leaders.
 
Gordon was selected as one of 95 ALA students out of a pool of over 3,000 applicants from across the continent for his passion for public service, his commitment to Africa, and his demonstrated leadership potential to lead change in Africa and beyond. 

Gordon is applying for a loan of $500, which will enable him to purchase a laptop to conduct assignments and research, to run his community service project and/or student run business which forms part of the ALA curriculum, and to participate fully in the world-class program offered by ALA.

Gordon’s entrepreneurial drive began as early as the 4th grade when he started a business in school selling newspapers for a publishing firm. He would also sell food items to colleagues and teachers. 
Gordon’s passion for business developed further when he started an enterprise known as Churchill Inc., based at his boarding school in Ghana, producing and selling post cards and wristbands. As CEO of Churchill Inc., Gordon employs eight people and has solicited orders from 25 schools so far. With the income generated from Churchill Inc., Gordon managed to raise funds to buy 2,000 textbooks along with pens and pencils for 1,000 primary school students after he saw that they lacked these basic resources. 

In addition to running a successful business at school, Gordon assumed numerous leadership roles including  dorm prefect, personal assistant to the General Secretary of the Students Representative Council, and the Student Representative to the Council for his class. 

He was also the Production Manager of the Pope John Junior Achievement Company at his high school and an active member of the school’s Olympic Club, through which he successfully organized the school’s 41st inter-House Athletics Competition.

Gordon would like to expand the work of his company Churchill Inc. to create employment in Ghana and around the continent. Ideally, he would like to use the enterprise to support the less privileged in society.

loans.use: to purchase a laptop for his studies

loans.name: Blanca Azucena

texts.es: La señora Blanca tiene 51 años de edad, tiene 4 hijos quienes son independientes, vive en el municipio de San Manuel Cortes y le acompaña sus dos sobrinas, la demás familia viven en el extranjero. Doña Blanca tiene 4 años de generar sus propios ingresos vendiendo variedad de mercadería, ella vende ropa interior para damas y caballeros, zapatos, sandalias y otros. Sus ventas las realiza de manera ambulante y por pedidos. Ella solicita un préstamo de 10,000 Lempiras para comprar mercadería y cumplir con los pedidos hechos por los clientes. Esta inversión de ayudara a incrementar su clientela y sus ventas. Con las ganancias ella espera hacerle mejoras a su casa y mejorar el nivel de vida.
texts.en: Blanca, 51, has four children who are all now independent.  She lives in San Manuel, Cortes, with two nieces; the rest of the family lives abroad.  Blanca has been earning her own income for four years selling a variety of merchandise like underwear for women and men, shoes, sandals and others from place to place and to order.  She’s requesting a 10,000 Lempira loan to buy merchandise to fill pending customer orders.  The investment will help her increase clientele and sales.  She hopes to use profits to make some home improvements and improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy merchandise like sandals, women's and men's underwear.

loans.name: Ernesto Dionisio

texts.es:
ERNESTO DIONISIO tiene 44 años de edad es casado tiene una hija, vive con la esposa y con la hija en la ciudad de Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.

Ernesto Dionisio se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz. Solicita el crédito para comprar fertilizantes, urea, insecticidas, ranger, líquido para la maleza. 

Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar lo necesario para la agricultura. Las compras las realizará en Ventanas. 

El sueño es tener un cultivo de cacao. Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta es la competencia. En el tiempo libre le gusta jugar boly y el indor.
texts.en:
Ernesto Dionisio is 44 years old, is married, and has one daughter. He lives with his wife and daughter in the town of Ventanas, province of Los Ríos. Ernesto Dionisio is devoted to agriculture, planting corn. 

He is requesting the loan to buy fertilizers, urea, pesticides, Roundup, and liquid for weeds. With the help of this loan, he will buy agriculture supplies. The purchases will be made in Ventanas. His dream is to farm cocoa. The challenge he is facing is competition. In his spare time, he enjoys playing volleyball and indoor soccer.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, urea, pesticides, Roundup, and liquid for weeds.

loans.name: Amani

texts.en:
Amani is a 17-year-old full-time student at African Leadership Academy (ALA), a two-year pre-university program in Johannesburg, South Africa, with a mission to identify, develop, and connect Africa’s future leaders. 

Amani was selected as one of 95 ALA students out of a pool of over 3,000 applicants from across the continent for his passion for public service, his commitment to Africa, and his demonstrated leadership potential to lead change in Africa and beyond. 

Amani is applying for a loan of $500, which will enable him to purchase a laptop to conduct assignments and research, to run his community service project and/or student run business which forms part of the ALA curriculum, and to participate fully in the world-class program offered by ALA.

Amani is an orphan and grew up with his uncle in Kagera, Tanzania.
 
Through his school’s environmental club, Amani headed a team that led recycling, garbage collection, and landfill initiatives. In a strong indication of his perseverance and resilience as a leader, Amani rose from a leader in Form 1 to the club’s chairperson. As one teacher describes him, “Africa needs creative leaders - Amani has demonstrated creativity throughout his stay by designing programs and mobilizing fellow students in the environmental club.”

An additional forum through which Amani was able to display strong leadership capabilities was in the capacity of Chairman of the Tanzanian Student’s Christian Fellowship. In this role he started a mass district choir that competed in the regional level and won first place. He was also a youth leader for his church and the district chairman of Tanzanian Students’ Christian Fellowship.  

Amani plans to become a doctor and wants to start health centers and institutions that will provide quality services and health education. He would like to impact Africa by making education more accessible for children from all over the continent.

loans.use: a laptop for his studies

loans.name: Jordan

texts.en:
Jordan is a 17-year-old full-time student at African Leadership Academy (ALA), a two-year pre-university program in Johannesburg, South Africa, with a mission to identify, develop, and connect Africa’s future leaders. 

Jordan was selected as one of 95 ALA students out of a pool of over 3,000 applicants from across the continent for his passion for public service, his commitment to Africa, and his demonstrated leadership potential to lead change in Africa and beyond. 

Jordan is applying for a loan of $500, which will enable him to purchase a laptop to conduct assignments and research, to run his community service project and/or student run business which forms part of the ALA curriculum, and to participate fully in the world-class program offered by ALA.

Jordan comes from Kampala, Uganda and is one of a family of nine.

As a young leader passionate about the environment and healthcare, Jordan understands the importance of addressing underlying causes of Africa’s health and environmental issues, rather than simply treating their symptoms. Jordan has used his strong leadership abilities and entrepreneurial mind-set to address some of these problems in Uganda.

In an effort to reduce litter and waste materials that collect in “channels breaking the water system and causing soil degradation,” Jordan constructed a chicken pen made solely from recycled water bottles, which he collected, filled with sand and arranged together like bricks. This has been standing for 6 months. The remaining bottles were used to pack liquid soap for people wanting to buy it in small quantities. Jordan now runs this operations as a small business.

When his community was required to retrieve water from a well as a result of a blocked drainage system rendering regular tap water unusable, Jordan took charge of the situation by ensuring that all of the stagnant water was removed. He explained the dangers of drinking stagnant water to the community at large, and helped mobilise the massive crowds of people into queues so that they could collect water in an orderly fashion. 
Jordan is also a top student and has been awarded a Certificate of Merit for academic excellence in Uganda. At school in Uganda he was involved in numerous extracurricular activities, including the Wildlife Conservation club, the Science club, and the United Nations club. 

Jordan sees ignorance as a key contributing factor to the high levels of health-related problems facing the African continent. He wants to become a doctor and help find causes, signs, and preventative measures, thereby freeing up money currently being spent on treatment to be invested in other important areas (e.g. agriculture and education).

loans.use: to pay for a laptop for his studies

loans.name: Teofila

texts.es: La señora Teófila tiene 54 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene dos hijos, y vive en el municipio de la Masica, Atlántida con un hijo y un nieto. Doña Teófila tiene aproximadamente 28 años de dedicarse al comercio. Siempre ha tenido su propia fuente de ingresos, ella vende ropa como pantalones, blusas, camisas, lociones, cremas, cosméticos y sandalias. Ella vende de manera ambulante y por pedidos. Y con el préstamo que está solicitando va comprar dos fardos de ropa mixta para incrementar el inventario y cumplir con los pedidos de sus clientes, ya que su propósito de invertir en el negocio es generar más ganancias para tener un bienestar familiar.
texts.en: Teófila, 54, is a single mother; she has two children and lives in Masica, Atlántida with one of her sons and a grandson.  Teófila has been working for about 28 years in commerce.  She’s always had her own source of income.  She sells clothes like pants, blouses, shirts, lotions, creams, cosmetics and sandals.  She sells from place to place and also on order.  She will use the loan she’s requesting to buy two large bundles of mixed clothes to increase inventory and fill customer orders because her reason for investing in the business is to generate more income for her family’s wellbeing.

loans.use: to buy two bundles of mixed clothes to sell.

loans.name: Hector Miguel

texts.es:
HECTOR MIGUEL tiene 48 años de edad es soltero tiene 3 hijos, vive con los hijos en la ciudad de Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos. 

HECTOR MIGUEL se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz. Solicita el crédito para comprar fertilizantes, urea, insecticidas, ranger, líquido para la maleza. 

Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar lo necesario para los cultivos. Las compras las realizará en Ventanas. 

El sueño es que si este año le va bien en la cosecha y el otro año le ira mejor. Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta es la competencia al momento de vender los productos.

En el tiempo libre le gusta pensar auq otro negocio puede aplicar para tener mayores ingresos.
texts.en: Héctor Miguel, 48, is single and has three children; he lives with them in Ventanas, Los Ríos Province.  He works growing corn.  He’s asking for the loan to buy fertilizer, urea, insecticide, Ranger [brand of herbicide] and weed killer.  With help from the loan he will be able to buy what he needs for his crop.  He will make his purchases in Ventanas.  His dream is that if this year’s harvest is good next year’s will be even better.  The challenge he faces is competition when the time comes to sell his products.  In his free time he likes to think up other businesses he can set up to earn higher income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, urea, insecticide, Ranger and weedkiller.

loans.name: Oñondivepa Group

texts.es:
El comité  oñondivepa, se conformo con la iniciativa de la señora Gregoria. El grupo se encuentran  en el primer ciclo, con 10 integrantes.
La Sra. Gregoria tiene una despensa en su casa, y comenta que con mucho sacrificio está saliendo adelante con la ayuda de toda su familia.  Ella es una persona que desde siempre ha trabajado y no se cansa para hacerlo, ya que sabe que es la única forma de hacerlo.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de bebidas, lácteos, panificados, verduras y demás. Ella agradece por la oportunidad que ellas y sus amigas están recibiendo.
texts.en: The “Oñondivepa” committee was formed by Gregoria.  The group is in its first cycle with ten members.  Gregoria has a grocery store at home and she comments that with much sacrifice she’s getting ahead with her entire family.  She’s a person who has worked always and does not tire of doing so because she knows that this is the only way to be.  She’s requesting the loan to buy beverages, dairy products, baked goods, vegetables and others.  She is grateful for the opportunity she and her friends are receiving.

loans.use: to buy beverages, dairy products, baked goods, vegetables and others.

loans.name: Sharon

texts.en:
Sharon is a 17-year-old full-time student at African Leadership Academy (ALA), a two-year pre-university program in Johannesburg, South Africa, with a mission to identify, develop, and connect Africa’s future leaders. 

She was selected as one of 95 ALA students out of a pool of over 3,000 applicants from across the continent for her passion for public service, her commitment to Africa, and her demonstrated leadership potential to lead change in Africa and beyond. 

Sharon is applying for a loan of $500, which will enable her to purchase a laptop to conduct assignments and research, to run her community service project and/or student run business which forms part of the ALA curriculum, and to participate fully in the world-class program offered by ALA.

Sharon comes from Limpopo, South Africa. She is passionate about social entrepreneurship and helping those who are less fortunate. A prime example of this is a project she worked on involving refugees near her home. Noticing that the refugees did not interact with others in the community because they could not speak English, Sharon started a program to address the language barrier.  She located space, recruited two volunteers, and started providing English classes for the refugees and immigrants in order to “cut communication barriers with their neighbors.”

Another example of Sharon’s innate desire to help others came about in her role as leader of the Apostolic Faith Mission Youth program. When she noticed a young orphan in her community who needed looking after, Sharon took it upon herself to write to the church to ensure that the orphan was taken care of.

Sharon’s strong leadership capabilities were recognized when shortly after moving to a new school, she was elected as treasurer and chief organizer of the school’s commerce club. Other leadership roles she occupied in school were debate team captain and president of Academics for her Students’ Representative Council. Academically, she was the best student in her school and held this position for the past two years. 

Sharon displayed courage and resilience when, despite losing her brother a few days before a math exam and Olympiad, she took the experience as a motivational one to encourage her to strive harder and perform well. From this experience, she has learned that “some situations are meant to be catalysts to make you achieve greater success.” She explains that one should “never allow any knock down to be a knock out; find strength to get back.”

Sharon wants to build an orphanage to shelter vulnerable children who have lost their parents. This is because she believes that “when a child has the right kind of support, love, and comfortable home living, it gives him one less thing to worry about so that he can concentrate on his studies and make a difference.”  In the next 20 years, she also hopes to build a “victory empowerment house to help people who are violated of their rights” and become a motivational speaker to help people discover their inner strength. 

She is passionate about bringing about positive change on the continent and  hopes "every African has access to education and primary health care, good sanitation, and running water and sleeps with a filled stomach.”

loans.use: to purchase a laptop for her studies

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary, a wife and mother of four in the Mukuru informal settlement of Nairobi, is ready to change her life. As she says, “It’s time to think higher and not be sleeping. It’s time to pull up our socks because life is hard.” Mary used to sell cabbages, but realized that venture was not lucrative. She then began working for a company that sells textbooks, but has found that it is similarly unprofitable and equally exhausting. Mary is tired of being part of someone else’s business; her dream is to start a business of her own. 

Mary was recommended to buy and run a Fresh Life toilet by a friend who has found the enterprise profitable. She would like to start her career as a businesswoman with Fresh Life because she understands the amount of cleanliness a sanitary toilet option can bring to her community.  The profits she makes will go towards providing for her family, including paying her children’s school tuition. However, Mary doesn't only want to provide for her family; she will also be able to provide a good job for her sister, Anne, who will operate the toilet. 

Mary wants to be a stronger woman, and believes that owning a Fresh Life toilet business will empower her for future endeavors. She hopes to eventually buy more toilets and dreams of venturing into other business opportunities.

loans.use: To purchase and run a Fresh Life toilet.

loans.name: Dúo Peña De Oro Group

texts.es:
Dúo Peña de Oro.
Este Dúo está integrado por la señora Vivian Isabel, tiene 30 años de edad  tiene 2 hijos, ella es originaria de Chimaltenango, ella se dedica a la venta de cosméticos por catálogo  desde hace varios años, ella se siente muy contenta ya que tiene la oportunidad de salir adelante en su negocio con el apoyo de su familia, está solicitando este crédito para la compra de cosméticos por catálogo  ya que necesita comprar más,  para generar mejores ganancias espera que le puedan dar ese apoyo que ella necesita para salir adelante.
texts.en:
"Peña de Oro" Duo.

Vivian Isabel, 30, is part of this Duo.  She has two children and is from Chimaltenango.  She has been selling cosmetics via catalogue for many years and feels very happy to have this opportunity to get ahead in her business with support from her family.  She’s requesting the loan to buy cosmetics via catalogue because she needs to buy more of them to generate higher profits.  She hopes that she will be given this support she needs to get ahead.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics.

loans.name: Frederick

texts.en:
This is Frederick, 42, resident of GMA, Cavite, Philippines. He is married to Rejine, a housewife, and is a father to his children. He, together with his wife, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, he is working hard to continually provide income for his everyday expenses.

Frederick operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. He earns a profit by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. His store is located adjacent to his house. His regular customers are his neighbors and the local community. He earns a minimum of 350 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help him continue the operation of his business, he is requesting a Php 10,000 loan. He will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand his product inventory. He expects a boost in his business income as he expands his business. 

Frederick hopes to give his children a good and quality education and dreams of having an abundant life in the future. He faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work every week and where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in his business.

loans.name: Djumaboi

texts.ru: Джумабой трудолюбивый мужчина, занимается откормом скота около 20 лет. Он хороший семьянин. Джумабой воспитывает четверых детей. Он обратился в Арванд для того чтобы улучшить свои условия проживания расширив свой бизнес. Джумабой в наличии имеет 5 коров и несколько овец. Кроме того, он продает их шерсти. На полученный кредит хочет купить несколько голов скота и увеличить свое стадо. Это его единственный доход поэтому хочет развивать свой бизнес. Заранее благодарит Арванд за финансовую поддержку.
texts.en: Djumaboi is a hardworking man, who has been involved in fattening up livestock for about 20 years.  He is a good family man.  Djumaboi is raising four children.  He came to Arvand to improve his living conditions by expanding his business.  Djumaboi has five cows and several sheep.  Besides, he sells their wool.  He wants to use this loan to buy several heads of livestock and increase his herd.  This is his sole source of income, and this is why he wants to expand his business.  Djumaboi is grateful to Arvand in advance for the financial support.

loans.use: to buy several heads of livestock and increase his herd

loans.name: Ancheta

texts.en:
Ancheta is 59 years old and now a widow. She has six adult-age children and they live happily in a village planting and harvesting rice and vegetables for sale. Due to financial difficulty, she puts-up a small variety store in their community to generate additional income. Despite problems and difficulties in life, she has the determination to improve their status of living to give her children a better life. 

She aims to improve her variety store by increasing her product offerings to satisfy her customers' demand but she does not have enough capital. She is asking for a loan of PHP 7,000.00 to buy noodles, junk food, candies, beverages, seasonings, and soft drinks for sale. She believes that through his patience and hard work she will make an improvement to her business and hopes that she will be successful in the future.

loans.use: to buy noodles, junk food, candies, beverages, seasonings, and soft drinks for sale

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es: Elizabeth, de 47 años es una mujer sencilla y luchadora. Vive en compañía de sus 5 hijos a los que cuida en su casa propia. Ella es una mujer con múltiples oficios, pues tiene que salir adelante para cuidar de sus hijos. Durante las mañanas se dedica a la venta de dulces y comida en un pequeño restaurante que puso en el interior de la escuela de su localidad, ahí obtiene un dinero considerable, ya que es la única que vende estos alimentos. Pero la actividad que le llena de mucha tranquilidad y paz es la siembra de papa, trigo, quinua y habas, los cuales cuida en sus terrenos propios, que le fueron heredados por parte de su padre. También cuida de sus animales como gallinas y cerdos que comercializa en la ciudad de Jauja, en la feria que se realiza una vez a la semana. Pero como es conocida, cuenta que en la cosecha de alimentos; los mismos comerciantes visitan sus terrenos productivos para comprar en su totalidad los alimentos maduros. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “mujeres luchadoras” y este es el cuarto crédito con MFP, se siente agradecido con el apoyo que encontró en su asociación pues le permite mejorar el capital de trabajo de su negocio. Por esa razón promete ser puntual en el pago de sus cuotas. Elizabeth, invertirá el dinero en la compra de fertilizantes naturales para esparcir entre sus cultivos de papa.
texts.en:
Elizabeth, 47, is an unassuming, hardworking woman.  She lives wither five children; she cares for the in her own house.  She is a woman with multiple occupations because she must get ahead in order to care for her children.

In the morning she sells food and candy in a small snack bar she set up in a local school.  She earns considerable money there since she’s the only one selling such items.  But the activity that fills her with calm and peace is growing potatoes, wheat, quinoa and lima beans that she cares for on her own land that she inherited from her father.

She also raises animals like chickens and pigs that she then sells in the city of Jauja in the street market that takes place once a week.  But since she’s well known, she says that during harvest time merchants come to her fields to buy her entire crops of ripe food products.

She belongs to the “Mujeres Luchadoras” communal bank and this is her fourth MFP loan.  She feels grateful for the support she found in her association because it allows her to improve her business’ working capital.  Because of this, she promises to be punctual with her installment payments.  Elizabeth will use the money to buy natural fertilizer to spread among her potato plants.

loans.use: to buy natural fertilizer.

loans.name: Aigul

texts.ru:
Айгул 36 лет, замужем, имеет 6 детей – пять дочерей и одного сына. Айгул в качестве основного дохода уже 16 лет занимается животноводством и полеводством, начав этот бизнес с суммы в 9,000 сом. Благодаря упорному труду Айгул в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний  день имеется  3 дойные коровы с приплодом, 13 голов мелкого рогатого скота. Также, Айгул обрабатывает землю с кукурузой, картошкой, что позволяет получать доход в 200,000 сом в год. 
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Айгул обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS)  на покупку скота – молодняка для откорма и перепродажи.  Доходы от кредита Айгул планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение количества домашней скотины, а в будущем мечтает дать образование всем детям.
texts.en: Aigul is 36 years old, married and has six children - five daughters and one son.  To provide the primary source of income, she has been involved in animal husbandry and farming for 16 years, having started this business with a sum of 9,000 som.  Thanks to Aigul's hard work, today her business contains three dairy cows with offspring and 13 heads of small livestock.  She also plants corn and potatoes, which allow her to get an income of 200,000 som per year.  In order to further develop her business, Aigul requested a loan in the amount of 100,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to buy young livestock for fattening up and resale.  She plans to invest the earnings from the loan into further increasing domestic livestock quantities and dreams of providing her children with education in the future.

loans.use: to buy young livestock for fattening up and resale

loans.name: Alicia

texts.es: Alicia, de 40 años es una mujer como muchas cualidades. Siempre honesta y con una sonrisa en el rostro. Ella tienen 5 hijos pero solo vive con 3 de ellos: Kelvin, Stefany y Deyvis a los que cuida en su casa propia. Su trabajo le ayudó a mantener a sus hijos por si sola. Sus principales cultivos constan de papa, trigo, cebolla y cebada, los que siembra en terrenos heredados de parte de su padre. Ya tiene 6 años de experiencia y lo que más le agrada es ayudar a las personas que la necesitan, ya que en temporada de cosecha contrata peones quienes le ayudan a recolectar los frutos maduros de la tierra. Le gusta el campo por ello hace algunos años se compró 2 vacas y varias ovejas, que le proporcionan leche y carne para consumo propio. Pero si tiene algún problema financiero, aprovecha y los vende, “mis animales son el plan de contingencia sobre cualquier problema económico”, afirma. Ahora ella desea ahorrar lo máximo para brindarles a sus hijos una buena educación, ya que son el motor de su progreso. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “mujeres luchadoras” y este es el cuarto crédito con MFP, se siente agradecido con el apoyo que encontró en su asociación pues le permite mejorar el capital de trabajo de su negocio. Por esa razón promete ser puntual en el pago de sus cuotas. Alicia; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de fertilizantes naturales para esparcir entre sus próximos cultivos de papa y cebolla.
texts.en:
Alicia, 40, is a woman with many qualities.  She’s always honest and with a smile on her face.  She has five children but only lives with three of them, Kelvin, Stefany and Deyvis, who she cares for in her own house.  

Her main crops are potatoes, wheat, onions and barley that she grows on land inherited from her father.  She has six years’ experience and what she likes the most is to help people who need her because during the harvest season she hires day laborers who help her reap the ripe fruits from the earth.  She likes working in the fields which is why a few years ago she bought two cows and several sheep that produce milk and meat for home consumption.  If any financial problem arises, she takes advantage of them and sells them off.  She affirms that her animals are her contingency plan for any unforeseen economic problem.

She now wants to save up as much as possible to provide her children with a good education because they are her motivating force to move forward.  She’s a member of the “Mujeres Luchadoras” communal bank and this is her 4th MFP loan.  She’s grateful for the support she’s gotten in her association because it allows here to increase her business’ working capital.  Because of this she promises to make her payments punctually.  Alicia will use the requested funds to buy natural fertilizer to spread among her next potato and onion crops.

loans.use: to buy sacks of natural fertilizers.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is 39 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. 

Alma buys and sells fruit and vegetables for a living. She has had this business for six years. She has requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy fruit and vegetables such as beans, squashes and mangoes.

Alma has been a member of HSPFI since 2008.  In the future she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy more fruit and vegetables to resell.

loans.name: Ahlam

texts.en:
Due to cultural reasons Ahlam prefers that her photo is not on the Internet; thus the above photo is of her husband.

Ahlam is a 41-year-old, married female from Al Zarqa in Jordan.  She has three children and requested a 700 JOD loan to pay for the education fees and expenses of her children.

loans.use: to pay for her children's education fees.

loans.name: Stallone

texts.en:
Stallone is 40 years old, married and has two children.  To earn a living, he farms crops.  He has been farming for twelve years.  He also does bee keeping for extra income.  He has employed two people in his farm.  Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has improved his business because he has been trained in business management skills.

Stallone hopes to practice large-scale farming in the future.  He has requested a loan of 70, 000 KES to buy fertilizer and seedlings.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seedlings.

loans.name: Fiqireta

texts.en:
Fiqireta is in her early fifties and a Romani woman from one of the most vulnerable ethnic minority communities of Albania. She has six children, all grownups and none of them are attending school. They live in a main city in Central Albania, where the majority of their community has been living ever since. 

With lots of hard work from the Romas, the government of Albania and other foreign agencies and organizations operating in Albania, many of the Roma families have experienced an improvement in quality of life during the years of democracy in Albania.  It has made them proud of themselves and thankful to all the parties involved in the process.

Fiqireta has been selling used items, particularly clothes and is now applying for a second loan to purchase more inventories. She hopes that Kiva lenders will show some understanding in this matter.

loans.use: to purchase an inventory of used clothes.

loans.name: Zipporah

texts.en:
Zipporah still operates her green grocery. Thanks to previous Kiva support; she was able to meet one of her dreams; to open a cereal shop, which she now has to sell various cereals.

In order to continue with her business she is requesting more financial support.

She continues working hard and with dedication every day. With the loan, she will pay school fees for her son.

One of her goals is to have a bigger cereal shop.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her son.

loans.name: Salvacion

texts.en:
This is Salvacion, 60, resident of GMA, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Raul, a driver and a mother to her children. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Salvacion operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighbourhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue the operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 20,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Salvacion dreams of having a good life through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia Kanini is 38 years old, a food stall owner in Mombasa. She is married and has been in this business for the past twelve years.

This marks her fifth business loan from Kadet Ltd to finance her business. She plans to purchase a variety of food stuffs, new chairs, tables and serving dishes. She will use the anticipated profits to invest back into her business. 

She hopes to excel in the business.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of food stuffs, new chairs, tables and serving dishes.

loans.name: Charlito

texts.en: Charlito is from Sta. Filomena, Dipolog City. He is 65 years old, married and has four adult-aged children. Charlito is just starting this business, an eatery. In 2012, Charlito joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. This is his first availment of a loan of 20,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase more raw ingredients for her new eatery business. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve his family's general living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase more raw ingredients for her new eatery business.

loans.name: Bercy

texts.en:
This is Bercy, 37, resident of GMA, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Rico, a driver and is a mother to her children. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Bercy operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 50,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Bercy dreams to have a good life through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Mahulolo Aa1 Group

texts.fr: MAHULOLO AA1 est un groupe de deux personnes, dont les membres sont des amies. La représentante du groupe, Antoinette (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 51 ans et est mariée à Séverin, un mécanicien. Le couple a cinq enfants dont certains scolarisés et trois restent à leur charge. Antoinette et son mari vivent ensemble avec leurs enfants et assurent ensemble les différentes charges de la maison. Antoinette n’a jamais été l’école. Il y a près de quinze ans que Antoinette mène comme activité la vente de divers produits et de l’huile à moteur à son domicile. Antoinette exerce cette activité passionnément, ce qui lui permet de subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants. Antoinette s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle, Antoinette sollicite un premier crédit avec les autres membres du groupe MAHULOLO AA1. Ce crédit leur servira à mieux répondre aux demandes de leur clientèle et à se faire plus de profits.
texts.en:
Mahulolo Aa1 is a group of two people, whose members are friends. The representative of the group is named Antoinette (shown in the photo with her hand raised). Antoinette is 51 years old and married to a mechanic named Séverin. The couple has five children, some of whom are enrolled in school, and three of whom are their dependents. Antoinette and her husband live together with their children and the two pay for all of the household's expenses. Antoinette has never had the opportunity to attend school.

For nearly fifteen years Antoinette has been running her business selling motor oil and various sundries from her home. Antoinette runs her business with passion, as it allows her to satisfy her needs as well as the needs of her children. She purchases her supplies from a market in Benin. Antoinette, along with the other member of Mahulolo Aa1, is seeking her first loan from Alidé. Her goal is to increase the satisfaction of her customers. This loan will allow her to better meet the demands of her clientele and thus earn more income.

loans.use: to purchase sundry goods and motor oil for resale.

loans.name: Wael

texts.en: Wael is a 40-year-old male from Al Hahmi - Amman in Jordan.  He has four children.  He has requested a 1000 JOD loan to buy a new welding machine for his work.  In the future he would like to improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a new machine for his work.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy groceries for her grocery store business.

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon is 26 years old and married. He operates  a motorcycle transport business in Mariakani which he has been doing for one year. His business is doing well.
 
Simon is requesting his second loan from KADET LTD, which he will use to purchase spare parts to service his motorcycle. He will use the anticipated profits to buy an additional motorcycle and use the rest of the profits to repay his loan.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts to service his motorcycle.

loans.name: Dolores Concepcion

texts.es:
Dolores, se dedica a la venta de atoles y tablilla, ella vive en casa familiar, tiene dos hijos, uno de ellos ya es independiente y el otro estudia, su esposo le colabora con algunos gastos del hogar y ella a través de las ventas que realiza de forma ambulante es que logra también ganarse algún dinero para su hogar, su hija que ya es mayor de edad le ayuda también a realizar las ventas tanto por la mañana y en la tarde.

Ella nos solicita un crédito para comprarse algunos materiales que son utilizados en la elaboración de la venta por ejemplo comprará cacao que es el utilizado para la tablilla, comprará arroz, semilla de marañón, máni, azúcar, que son utilizados para hacer los atoles, el crédito le ayudará a abastecerse de materia prima para poder realizar sus ventas diariamente sin tener ningún obstáculo.

Sus aspiraciones es lograr que su hijo menor pueda finalizar sus estudios, ya que manifiesta que con su trabajo y el de su esposo lograrán que sus hijos se forme para tener mejores oportunidades de desarrollo.
texts.en:
Dolores sells ‘atoles’ (flour, milk, nut and cocoa based beverages) and chocolate bars.  She lives in the family home and has two children.  One of them is independent already and the other is attending school.  Her husband helps with some of the household expenses and through the sales she does from place to lace she’s able to earn some money for the home, too.  Her daughter who is an adult also helps her to do the selling mornings and afternoons.

She’s requesting a loan to buy some of the supplies she needs to make the things she sells.  For example, she’ll buy cocoa that’s used for the chocolate bars and will buy rice, cashew nuts, peanuts and sugar that are used to make the atoles.  The loan will help her stock up on raw materials for her daily sales obstacle-free.

Her hopes are that her youngest son is able to complete his schooling because she states that with her and her husband’s work they will see that their children become prepared for better development opportunities.

loans.use: to buy cocoa, rice, cashew nuts, peanuts and sugar.

loans.name: Humora

texts.ru: Умная  таджичка нуждается вашей поддержки. Ее зовут Хумора и ей 18 лет. Она из семьи преподавателя. Ее родители работают учителями в сельской школе и их доход не достаточно для оплаты обучения Хумора в университете, так как в этом году она поступила в Худжанский Государственный Университет. Она является студенткой 1 курса и должна оплатить годовой договор. Она запрашивает займ для оплаты обучения в университете. Она ждет и надеется на вашу доброту.
texts.en: An intelligent Tajik woman needs your support. Her name is Humora and she is 18 years old. She is from a family of teachers. Her parents work as teachers in a village school and their income is not enough for Humora's tuition payment at university. This year, she was admitted into Khujand State University. She is a first-year student and needs to pay for her annual contract. She is requesting a loan for her university tuition payment. She awaits and hopes for your kindness.

loans.use: To pay for her education

loans.name: Glenda

texts.en:
Glenda is 39 years old and married. She is from Capucao, Ozamis City. She has two grown children who have helped her in taking care of their cassava and coconuts. 

Glenda has been in business for 19 years and earns  PHP 11,000 a month.  In 2007, Glenda joined GDMPC.  She has requested a loan of PHP 12,000 to purchase fertilizer and help with weeding costs.  She hopes for a bountiful harvest and to expand her cultivated area.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and buy products for weeding.

loans.name: Katana

texts.en:
Katana is a 40-year-old business man in Kilifi.  He sells brooms.  He is a married father of five school-going children.  He has been running this business for the past two years with great success.

This Katana's third business loan from KADET Ltd.  He plans to purchase more brooms for sell.  He will use the anticipated profits to educate his children. 

He hopes to grow his business and in future purchase a piece of land to build rental houses.

loans.use: to purchase more brooms for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy animal feed for his pigs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy clothes to resell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase tables, tableclothes, and chairs.

loans.name: Maria Josefa

texts.es:
Maria Josefa tiene 68 años de edad,  es casada, tiene 5 hijos que ya son mayores y trabajan, vive con su esposo en una aldea del Municipio de Choloma, Cortes.
Doña Maria Josefa cuenta con una fuente de ingreso que es un negocio de pulpería.  Inicio este negocio hace mas de 2 años, vende productos de la  canasta básica como harina, frijoles, arroz, azúcar, manteca, medicinas, golosinas, productos de abarrotería entre otros, ademas vende refrescos Big cola al por mayor. Doña Maria es una señora muy emprendedora tiene surtido su pulpería con los productos necesarios para ofrecer a sus clientes. 
Ella esta solicitando su segundo préstamo a ODEF, de 3,500 lempiras para comprar mas productos para mantener surtido el negocio como manteca, arroz, frijoles, harina, embutidos, lácteos, productos de limpieza y refrescos Para cumplir con la demanda de los clientes.
La meta de Doña Maria es ahorrar para tener un respaldo económico en cualquier problema que se le presente en el futuro y mejorar su nivel de vida.
texts.en:
María Josefa, 68, is married and has five children who are all working adults now.  She lives with her husband in a village in the municipality of Choloma, Cortes.  María Josefa’s source of income is a grocery store she has.  She opened it more than two years ago and sells basic staples like flour, beans, rice, sugar, lard, medicine, snacks and grocery items, among others.  She also sells Big Cola at wholesale.  María is a very enterprising lady who stocks her grocery store with the necessary products to offer her customers.

She’s asking ODEF for a 3,500 Lempira loan to buy more products like lard, rice, beans, flour, canned goods, dairy products, cleaning supplies and soft-drinks to keep her store stocked and meet customer demand.  Her goal is to save up to have back-up funds available for any future problem that might arise and to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy groceries to stock her store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy animal feed for his pigs.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is 55 years old and married. She is from Capucao, Ozamis City. She has one child who has helped her take care of her coconuts. She has been in business for 15 years and earns PHP 4,000 a month.  

Recently, Myrna joined GDMPC. She has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to purchase fertilizer and to help with weeding costs. She hopes for a bountiful harvest and to expand her cultivated area.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and help with weeding costs.

loans.name: Efrain

texts.es:
Efraín, vive junto a su esposa y dos hijos que depende de él, Efrain se dedica a la sastrería, iniciando este taller hace mucho tiempo como una ocupación para atraer ingresos económicos a su familia, lo tiene ubicado en una zona urbana, sus ventajas es tener contratos con centros escolares a quienes le elabora los uniformes estudiantiles.

Actualmente Efraín tiene la necesidad de comprar materiales de costura como lo es las telas, que son muy necesarias para poder confeccionar la ropa, algunos ciper, botones, hilos y ganchos, también dará mantenimiento a la maquinaria y de ser posible podrá tener para pagar algunos empleados que le colaboran. Éste crédito le dará los recursos necesarios para que pueda realizar el trabajo entregarlo en el tiempo solicitado.
Su aspiración con respecto al préstamo es poder tener a la mano todos los materiales que son necesarios para su trabajo, también quiere finalizar la construcción de la casa ya que le hace falta parte del techo para poderse trasladar junto a su familia a un lugar más amplio.
texts.en:
Efrain lives together with his wife and two children who are dependent on him. Efrain works as a tailor, opening his shop a while back as a way to earn income for his family. His shop is located in a city, which allows him to secure contracts with local schools to produce and mend school uniforms.

Currently Efrain needs to purchase sewing materials such as fabrics, which are essential for making clothing, some zippers, buttons, threads, and hangers. He will also do maintenance work on his machines and, if possible, hire a few employees to work with him. This loan will provide him with the necessary resources so that he can complete his work and meet contract deadlines. His goals with respect to this loan are to have all of the necessary materials on hand to do his work. He also hopes to be able to finish the construction of his house, which is missing a portion of the roof, so that he and his family may move together to a more comfortable home.

loans.use: to purchase sewing materials, zippers, buttons, thread, and hangers.

loans.name: Sarepta Group

texts.fr: La cliente Kapinga est entrepreneur excellente, présidente et doyenne du groupe d’affaire « Sarepta »,  âgée de d’environ 65 ans, mariée, mère de 10 enfants et plusieurs descendants. Tous ses 10 enfants ont leurs  diplômes universitaires. Son mari est un comptable dans une entreprise publique « Office national du café (ONC)». La cliente  est boulangère. Elle a aussi une boutique pour  maximiser assez des revenus. Il ya 33 ans qu’elle exerce cette activité de boulangerie. Elle démarra son business avec de fonds propre issu de production de récolte du champ. Cette récolte valait presque 6$ à l’époque. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir de s’approvisionner avec des matières premières (20 sacs de farine, sucre, levures, etc.). En plus, elle ambitionne agrandir son entreprise et surtout l’espace de production et initier ses enfants dans l’auto prise en charge.  La cliente remercie Hekima pour  ses actions en faveur de pauvres exclus de banque classique.
