In addition, Ana provides a safe place to entertain the young people who live in her neighborhood.

She is requesting a loan in order to buy a television, PlayStation console, and Nintendo controls. Ana needs to replace a few pieces of equipment that have been damaged. This will enable her to provide better service to her customers who are always looking to play video games. In the future, she would like to remodel her house so that she can set up a pastry shop. Her next goal is to focus on her children’s education.

loans.use: to buy a television, PlayStation console, and Nintendo controls.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy more firewood to sell

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is a 28 year old married woman. She has 3 children. She describes herself to be intelligent and warm. 

She operates a food stall where she sells food, tea and snacks. She has been involved in this business for 5 years. Her business is located within a slum  and her primary customers are residents from the slum. 

She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the business. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy cooking pots and food ingredients to be used in preparing meals for selling . Her business goal is to run a hotel within 5 years. She hopes that in the future she will expand her business. This is her first loan from SMEP DTM. She also gets help in terms of business income from her husband who is employed at one of the security firms.

loans.use: to buy a cooking pot and food ingredients for preparing meals for selling

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is a resident of Mariakani area of Coast province, Kenya. She is married and has four children. She owns a second-hand clothes shop, a business that she has been operating for six years. She also owns a retail shop.

She learnt about Milango through an employee and joined the company with an aim of accessing credit to improve the operations of her business. Her main challenges are that some customers do not pay on time and high purchase prices of the clothes.

Christine is applying for a loan of 41,850 Kenya shillings to purchase bales of second-hand clothes. The extra income from the loan will be added to her savings to pay school fees for her children. She aspires to start a transport business in the future.

loans.use: To purchase bales of second-hand clothes.

loans.name: Aidana

texts.ru:
Айдане 35 лет, имеет 4 детей. Айдана в качестве основного дохода с 2002 года занимается обработкой и перепродажей сушеных фруктов, в частности абрикосов, начав этот бизнес с суммы в 10,000 сом. Товар Айдана закупает на сельских рынках Кадамжайского и Баткенского района Кыргызстана, и реализует на Исфаринском рынке в Республике Таджикистан.
Благодаря такому нелегкому  труду и упорству  Айданы, в ее товарообороте находится около 150,000 сом, прибыль в месяц составляет около 30,000 сом.  
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Айдана обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 116,000 сом (KGS)  на закуп сушеного абрикоса для перепродажи.   Доходы от кредита Айдана планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение своего бизнеса, а в ближайшем будущем планирует провести свадьбу сына.
texts.en:
Aidana is thirty-five years old and has four children. Since 2002, her main source of income has come from treating and reselling dried fruits, apricots in particular. She stocks up her inventory via small local markets in the Kadamjaisk and Batken regions of Kyrgyzstan and then sells the goods on the Isfarin market in Tajikistan. 

Aidana began this business with a capitol of 10,000 soms; however, due to her hard work and dedication, she now consistently has 150,000 soms circulating as goods and generates a monthly profit of around 30,000 soms. 

Hoping to expand her business, Aidana approached "Bai Tushum and Partners" requesting a loan of 116,000 soms (KGS) in order to buy a batch of dried apricots that she intends to resell. She wants to use the profits generated by the loan as additional investments into her business and also plans to conduct a wedding for her son in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase a batch of dried apricots for resale.

loans.name: Ekaterine

texts.en:
Ekaterine is from Abasha district, West Georgia. She is 41 years old and lives with her husband and two children (12 and 15 years old). The children go to the local school. 

The family is involved in the agricultural business. They have small dairy farm of 7 milk cows whose milk is used for dairy production. Ekaterine produces Sulguni (Georgian pickled cheese) and sells on average 60 kg per month. In addition, they grow nuts and maize on a family-owned land. Part of the harvested productions is sold at the local open market and the rest is used for family needs. Ekaterine works hard, but the family still doesn’t have enough income to save up and improve the living conditions of the family.

She requested a loan to purchase construction materials for a new cattle-shed. The existing one is already too small and doesn’t allow Ekaterine to expand the family’s farming activities. In the future, she is going to develop an animal husbandry business so she can produce and sell more cheese. This will increase the family income and Ekaterine will be able to improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to build a cattle-shed.

loans.name: Nozanin

texts.ru: Нозанин незамужняя девушка, живет с родителями и семья занимается сельскохозяйственными работами.  У них в семье все работают на виноградном поле, которую арендуют в течении нескольких лет и получают от этого бизнеса приличную прибыль, на которую проживают целый год.  Хотя на поле работа трудная и требует многих затрат, родители Нозанин приучают всех членов семьи усердно работать.   Так как на винограднике много корма,семья постоянно держат крупный скот и дойных коров, как дополнительный доход.  В  нашу организацию Нозанин обратилась  чтобы получив кредит, купить еще несколько голов мелкого скота или еще одну дойную корову.   Она сама доит корову и продает молоко и подрабатывает себе на жизнь.  Заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку.
texts.en:
Nozanin is a single woman and lives with her parents. Her whole family works on some grape fields that they rent, thus generating a decent income. Although work on the fields is tough and demands many sacrifices, Nozanin's parents discipline everyone to work hard. 

Because the grape fields have lots of fodder, Nozanin's family have some large cattle and milking cows as an additional source of income. Nozanin approached Arvand in the hopes of procuring a loan and using it to purchase some small cattle and one more milking cow. She milks the cows herself and then earns money by selling the milk. 
She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy some small cattle and a cow.

loans.name: Mahoulome Group

texts.fr: MAHOULOME est un groupe de quatre personnes, dont les membres résident dans le même quartier au Bénin. La représentante du groupe, Joselyne Mondoukpè (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 32 ans et est mariée à un certain Oscor. Le couple a trois enfants tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Joselyne Mondoukpè et son mari vivent ensemble avec leurs enfants et assurent ensemble les différentes charges de la maison. Joselyne Mondoukpè n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Il y a quelques années, Joselyne Mondoukpè mène comme activité la vente des sachets et des pommades de façon ambulante. Joselyne Mondoukpè exerce cette activité passionnément, ce qui lui permet de subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants. Joselyne Mondoukpè s’approvisionne dans une ville du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle, Joselyne Mondoukpè sollicite un troisième crédit avec les autres membres du groupe MAHOULOME. Ce crédit leur servira à mieux répondre aux demandes de leur clientèle et à se faire plus de profits.
texts.en:
MAHOULOME is a group made up of four members who live in the same neighborhood in Benin.

The group's representative, Joselyne Mondoukpè, is the one raising her hand in the photo. She is 32 years old, married to a man named Oscor, and the mother of three children, all in school and their dependents.  Joselyne Mondoukpè and her husband live together with their children and jointly take care of the various household expenses.

Joselyne Mondoukpè did not attend school. For the past few years, she has been selling sachets and ointments.  She works as an itinerant seller, and she is passionate about her work, which allows her to meet her needs as well as those of her children. She buys her supplies from a town located in Benin.

To ensure the satisfaction of her customers,  Joselyne Mondoukpè is requesting a third loan, along with the other members of the MAHOULOME group.  This loan will be used to better meet their customers' expectations, and to increase their profits.

loans.use: to buy sachets and ointments.

loans.name: Jahiber

texts.es:
Jahiber tiene 30 años y nació en Manizales, Colombia. Desde los 11 años vive en Cali a donde llega junto con su madre que viene en busca de trabajo y un mejor futuro. Completar sus estudios universitarios significó para él entender que no hay imposibles y que la formación académica es el camino para lograr todo tipo de metas. 

Con esmero y mucho trabajo logra sortear las necesidades económicas para culminar sus estudios, trabajando inicialmente como vendedor de libros puerta a puerta, payaso titiritero y animador de fiestas. Posteriormente trabaja en la universidad como monitor en las clases de estética audiovisiual. Luego, dadas sus capacidades, trabaja como editor de audio y video en el centro de producción de Comunicación Social, culminando con éxito sus estudios e iniciando asi su carrera en el campo audiovisual. 

Hijo de madre soltera y con una hermana adolescente Jahiber se proyecta ahora estudiando una maestría en cine en Estados Unidos y espera obtener el apoyo de Kiva pues actualmente es su única alternativa para lograglo.

Esta es su historia:

Nunca olvidaré la primera vez que estuve en una sala de cine, tenía aproximadamente 7 años y mi madre y abuela, muy católicas, me llevaron a ver “El Mártir del Calvario con Enrique Rambal”. En esa enorme sala oscura experimenté emociones tan fuertes que me sentí como Jesús, lloré montones y fui crucificado, incluso quedaron en mi memoria algunos de sus diálogos que luego representaba en casa molestando a mi abuela, que finalmente terminaba riendo. 

Hoy en día, al recordar tal evento, sonrio al ver como los caminos y las decisiones que he tomado en mi vida se han confabulado para llevarme detrás de las cámaras, a conocer y amar este oficio que tantas experiencias y emociones genera.

Al terminar el colegio era impensable para mi estudiar en la universidad, ya mi madre había hecho todo su esfuerzo por darme el estudio y mi hermana menor hacía poco había llegado a este mundo, asi que  muy claro mi madre advirtió: “Hijo, hasta acá puedo ayudarte con tus estudios”. Esta noticia generó una sola idea en mi cabeza: trabajar para poder estudiar. Pues bien, esto no sucedió, ya que a pesar de mi esfuerzo por encontrar un trabajo en alguna empresa solo hubo gastos en hojas de vida, transporte y solicitudes. Cansado de esta situación, y motivado por una amiga que se alistaba para aplicar a la Universidad del Valle, vislumbré el sueño de ser un profesional. Años despúes, tras múltiples trabajos y mucho estudio, salía de una excelente universidad no sólo con un titulo profesional sino con la convicción del oficio cinematográfico en mi vida, y también con un importante reconocimiento: el “Premio Simón Bolivar a mejor emisión cultural en televisión” por escribir y dirigir mi primer documental.

Ahora tengo mis ojos y mi corazón puestos en una maestría en cinematografía en Estados Unidos y el apoyo de Kiva es una parte fundamental en este proceso de aplicación. Estoy totalmente convencido que a través de la misma, tendré las herramientas necesarias para regresar y contribuir, con la producción cinematográfica,  al desarrollo social y cultural de Colombia.
texts.en:
Jahiber, 30, was born in Manizales, Colombia.  He’s lived in Cali for the last 11 years.  He arrived there with his mother seeking employment and a better future.  Completing his university studies meant that there are no impossibles for him and that academic preparation is the path that leads to all sorts of goals.  With much effort and work he was able to skillfully deal with economic needs in order to finish his studies.  He initially worked selling books door to door, as a clown puppeteer and as a party entertainer.  He then worked at the university as a monitor in the audiovisual esthetics classes.  Later, given his skills, he worked as an audio and video editor in the social communication production center.  He graduated and started his career in the audiovisual field.  He’s the son of a single mother and has a teenage sister.  Jahiber sees himself in the future studying in the United States for a Master’s Degree in Cinematography and hopes to get help from Kiva because this is his only available alternative to do so.

This is his story:

“I’ll never forget the first time I went to the movies.  I was about 7-years-old and my mother and grandmother who were devout Catholics took me to see “The Martyr of Calvary” starring Enrique Rambal.  I felt such strong emotions in that enormous, dark room that I felt like Jesus himself; I cried my eyes out and it was as if I had been crucified too.  In fact, I retained some of the dialogue that I’d later recite at home annoying my grandmother who eventually would end up laughing.

Today, as I recall that event, it makes me smile to see how the roads I’ve taken and the decisions I’ve made in life have led me behind the cameras, to know and love this occupation that generates so many experiences and emotions.

When I finished high school it was unthinkable that I’d be able to attend university because my mother had exhausted all her efforts to provide schooling for me and my younger sister had just recently arrived in this world so my mother said to me quite clearly: ‘Son, this is as far as I can go helping with your schooling.’  This newsflash generated just one thought in my brain: I had to work to be able to continue studying.  Well, this did not happen because despite my effort to secure employment in some firm or other all I ended up doing was spend money to print copies of my curriculum vitae, on transportation costs and in filling out job applications.  Worn out by this situation and motivated by a girlfriend who was getting ready to apply to the Universidad del Valle, I got a glimpse of the dream of becoming a professional.  Years later, after many jobs and much study, I was graduating from an excellent university not only with a professional degree but also committed to a lifetime career as a cinematographer.  I also won an important prize: the Simón Bolívar Award for Best Cultural Television Production for writing and directing my first documentary.


Now, my eyes and my heart are set on getting a Master’s in Cinematography in the United States and Kiva’s help is a fundamental part of the application process.  I am totally convinced that through it I will have the necessary tools to return and contribute to Colombia’s social and cultural development through cinematography production.”

loans.use: to pay application fees for a Master's in Cinematography.

loans.name: Opetela

texts.en: Opetela is 25 years old, married and has 1 child. She would like to start growing taro and taamu plants to earn a living. Opetela has requested a loan to purchase farming tools and chemicals to start her business. She has been a member of SPBD for a year. Opetela will spend her profits to buy more farming tools to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy weed killers, a grass cutter, bush knives, and shovels.

loans.name: Viena

texts.en: Viena is a 35-year-old, married woman with 4 children. She would like to start growing cabbages and tomatoes to earn a living. Viena has requested a loan to start her business. She has been a member of SPBD since 2012. Viena will spend her profits to help her kids' education.

loans.use: buy vegie seeds, fertilizer, shovels and weed killer.

loans.name: Elvin

texts.en: Elvin is 32 years old and lives in Poblacion, Tampilisan, Zamboanga del Norte. He is single. Elvin works in the fish industry and sells fish for a living. He has been doing this for 10 years. He has requested loan of 25,000 PHP to purchase boxes of fish to sell retail. Elvin has been a member of PMPC for 1 year. In the future, Elvin hopes to expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase boxes of fish to sell retail

loans.name: Djromahuton Group

texts.fr: DJROMAHUTON est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres sont des amies. La représentante du groupe, Akouenoudé Philomène (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 31 ans et est mariée à un certain Jérôme. Akouenoudé Philomène est mère de trois enfants tous scolarisés et sa charge. Akouenoudé Philomène vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les divers besoins du ménage. Akouenoudé Philomène a peu fréquenté l’école. Il y a trois ans environs que Akouenoudé Philomène mène comme activité la vente des charbons de bois à son domicile. Akouenoudé Philomène exerce cette activité passionnément, ce qui lui permet de subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants. Akouenoudé Philomène s’approvisionne dans une ville du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle, Akouenoudé Philomène sollicite un premier crédit avec les autres membres du groupe DJROMAHUTON. Ce crédit leur servira à mieux répondre aux demandes de leur clientèle et à se faire plus de profits.
texts.en:
DJROMAHUTON is a group made up of three members who are friends. 

The group's representative,  Akouenoudé Philomène, is the one raising her hand in the photo. She is 31 years old, married to a man named Jérôme, and the mother of three children, all in school and her dependents.  Akouenoudé Philomène lives with her husband and children and shares the various household expenses with her husband.

Akouenoudé Philomène attended school for a short period of time. For the past three years or so, she has been selling charcoal from home. She is passionate about her work, which allows her to meet her needs as well as those of her children. She buys her supplies from a town located in Benin.

To ensure the satisfaction of her customers, she is requesting a first loan, along with the other members of the DJROMAHUTON group. This loan will be used to better meet their customers' expectations, and to increase their profits.

loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal.

loans.name: Sauileone

texts.en: Sauileone is a 60-year-old woman who is married with 4 children. She runs a business selling chicken leg quarters, rice, sugar, natural oil, beer, cigarettes and many goods in her community. She has 3 years of experience with this business. Sauileone has requested a loan to purchase more goods to expand her business. She plans to use her profits to save for her family needs. She has been a member of SPBD since 2012.

loans.use: buy sugar, rice, snacks, soft drinks, salts and cooking oil

loans.name: Sheryl

texts.en: Sheryl is 28 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 3 children. Sheryl has a food/retail shop, or sari-sari store, that buys and sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products, and beverages. She has had this business for 6 years. She requested a loan for  5,000 PHP to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages.  Sheryl has been a member of HSPFI since 2012. In the future, Sheryl hopes to improve her business for the education of her children.

loans.use: To buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages

loans.name: Ingrid

texts.es: Con su anterior credikiva, Ingrid compró sillas mecedoras, hamacas, bolsos, mochilas entre otros artículos, que vendió oportunamente. Nuevamente está aplicando a un credikiva y con él comprará hilos, lanas, botones, hebillas, correderas, agujas, para la fabricación de productos tejidos, porque tienen encargos a los cuales responder y requiere además tener inventarios que ofrecer. Ella envía el siguiente mensaje a sus financiadores: “Contar con su apoyo es muy importante,  ya que con este he podido suplir las necesidades de sus clientes y también he mejorado en varios aspectos las condiciones de vida de mis hijos. “
texts.en:
With her previous Kiva loan, Ingrid bought rocking chairs, hammocks, bags, backpacks and other items that she sold in season. With this new Kiva loan she is applying for she will buy thread, yarn, wool, buttons, buckles, sliders, and needles for the manufacture of knitted products because she has orders to fulfill and also needs inventory on hand.

She sends the following message to the lenders: “Having your support is very important because with it I could meet the needs of the customers and also I have improved the life conditions of my children in several ways.”

loans.use: to buy thread, yarn, wool, buttons, buckles, sliders and needles for the manufacture of knitted products.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 45 years old and is married with five children between the ages of four months and 19 years old. He sells cows from 6 a.m. until 5 p.m. everyday, except on Sunday, and he has two years of experience in this work. 

John has requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to buy more cows for resale. He plans to use any profits generated from this loan to satisfy his family's basic needs and to reinvest in his business.

loans.use: To buy more cows for resale.

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
This is Elvira, 60, a resident of Manila, Philippines. She is married to Tomas, a driver and a father to her children. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Elvira operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a 5 PHP-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 PHP in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, Elvira is requesting an 18,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Elvira dreams to have a good life through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Janelyne

texts.en:
Janelyne is friendly and loves cooking varieties of viand, so in the year 2004 she established a small restaurant which she has managed up to this time.

Janelyne's husband is a farmer. While she is busy with her restaurant, her husband is also busy cultivating their five hectares of corn field. The couple really wants to improve their living condition and educate their only child, so Janelyne decided to improve the viand she prepares daily to further encourage more customers to eat in her restaurant.

Janelyne didn't waste her time while improving her restaurant. For now, she has an additional business, which is raising hogs. She raised 12 fattening and one sow this time. She hopes to raise all her hogs and provide them proper nutrition so she could gain better profits not only from her restaurant. Janelyne is happy now because from the simple cooking of viand she is able to have her hog raising business.

Janelyne would like to thank the lenders for the financial assistance they provide for her business growth. Now, she is asking for a bigger capital amount of PHP 13,000. This will be used to buy soft drinks, raw meat and vegetables for the continuous development of her restaurant.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, raw meat and vegetables for her restaurant

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan said, "If you go into a business to make a profit, also prepare yourself to fail, because there are some factors that can affect your business. Such factors include calamity, credit, and unsatisfactory customer service."

Susan has been working in a fish-selling business for more than two years. Aside from this, she also manages a livestock and farming business. She grows corn crops on her five hectares of farmland and raises livestock. Susan would like to develop her businesses so that she can gain greater profits and satisfy her customers' demands.

Susan would like to take out a loan of PHP 10,000, which will be used to buy additional kilograms of meat, fish, and some vegetables. She needs to increase the kilograms she sells because it's harvest season, and she sells out of her products immediately. She hopes that her requested loan amount will be granted.

loans.use: To buy additional kilograms of meat, fish, and some vegetables for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more local drinks for resale.

loans.name: Shabana's Group

texts.en:
Shabana is a 40-year-old, hardworking housewife. She lives in Punjab, Pakistan, with her husband and 2 sons. Since 2011, her husband has had been driving his own taxi, which is the only source of income for the family. However, he is not able to generate any income from the taxi, as its engine is not working properly and needs to be repaired. Shabana, as a member of a three-person lending group, has requested a loan from Kiva partner, BRAC Pakistan, to help her husband to repair the engine of his taxi, so that he can continue his business. With the profit, at first she will pay back the loan amount to Kiva, and then she will make some savings for her children's future.  She hopes for a better future for her family.
 
Note: Shabana is holding a passbook, and her son is in the picture.

loans.use: To repair her husband's taxi engine

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy animal feed for the pigs

loans.name: Lucia Del Carmen

texts.es: Lucia del Carmen de  54 años de edad de la localidad de Chinandega, madre soltera con 6 hijos todos mayores de edad e independiente. Tiene por actividad económica una pulpería que consiste en la venta de granos básicos,  golosinas, gaseosas, lo tiene ubicado en  su casa de habitación. Tiene 9 años de experiencia en el negocio. La Sra.  Lucia es una mujer muy trabajadora, responsable, buena paga. Anteriormente ella tenía un taller de costura con un total de siete maquina en el cual trabajo 30 años  y por problemas de salud y recomendación del médico tuvo que dejar el negocio. Por  lo tanto junto a sus hijos decidió poner una pulpería  de la cual tiene nueve años en este negocio. Lo inicio con un poco de dinero propio, con el objetivo de mejorar los ingresos del hogar y como madre soltera sacar a sus hijos adelante. En la actualidad todos son independientes y su carga familiar es más leve. El financiamiento lo necesita para invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su pulpería para satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes. Lucia del Carmen agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan a los comerciantes de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua.
texts.en:
Lucia del Carmen is 54 years old and is from the town of Chinandega. She is a single mother with six children, all of them adults and independent. Her economic activity is a small shop where she sells basic grains, candies, and sodas, and it is located in her home. She has nine years of experience in the business. Lucia is a hard-working woman, responsible and self-satisfied. 

Previously, she had a sewing workshop with a total of seven machines where she worked for 30 years. However, for health reasons and doctor's recommendation, she had to leave the business. Then, with her children, she decided to start a small shop. Now she has nine years in the business. She started it with her own little money, with the goal to improve the household income and, as a single mother, get her children ahead. Today, all her children are independent and her family burden is lighter. 

She needs the financing to invest in working capital and stock her small shop to meet customer demand. Lucia del Carmen is grateful for the help that Kiva lenders provide to business people with limited resources in poor countries such as Nicaragua.

loans.use: to stock her small shop with daily products such as basic grains, candies, sodas, and juices.

loans.name: Sobheyeh

texts.en:
Due to cultural reasons, Sobheyeh prefers that her photo not be on the Internet; thus the above photo is of her husband.

Sobheyeh is a 34-year old married mother of eight from Al Koorah, Jordan. She has requested a 400 JOD loan to pay for her home improvement expenses and buy some electronic devices. In the future she would like to build an additional room.

loans.use: to pay for her home improvement expenses.

loans.name: Vicente Ramon

texts.es: Vicente Ramón de  32 años de edad del departamento de Chinandega, casado con tres hijos menores de edad 12, 9,2 años. Vicente labora como obrero de una empresa de riego. El está solicitando el financiamiento para realizar mejora en su vivienda como es la construcción de la cocina ya que en la actualidad se encuentra en condiciones bien deteriorada y se está cayendo. Mejoras que  desde hace 1 años quiere realizar pero por falta de recursos económicos no lo ha hecho. Motivo por el cual opto al crédito. Con el financiamiento comprara material de construcción como: zinc, cemento, pintura, hierro. Los sueños y meta de Vicente en un futuro no muy lejano es ver termina por completo su vivienda  y de dicha forma brindarles las condiciones adecuadas de vida a su familia. Agradece la ayuda que le brindan los inversionistas kiva a personas de escasos recursos  para tener un lugar donde vivir  digno de  cualquier persona.
texts.en:
Vicente Ramón is 32 years old. He is from Chinandega department, married, and has three minor children, ages 12,9, and 2. Vicente works as a laborer at an irrigation company. He is applying for the loan in order to undertake improvements to his home, such as building a kitchen, as currently it is in very poor condition and falling down. 

These are improvements he has wanted to carry out for a year, but for lack of financial resources has not done so. This is why he opted for the loan. 

With the loan, he will buy construction material such as zinc, cement, paint and rebar. Vicente's goal and dream in the not too distant future is to see his home completely finished and in this way offer proper living conditions to his family. 

He is grateful for the help the Kiva lenders offer low-income people, so that they can have a place to live worthy of anyone.

loans.use: To buy construction materials such as zinc, cement, paint, and rebar.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy animal feed for the pigs.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To overhaul her husband's auto rickshaw

loans.name: Silvana

texts.es:
Silvana, es soltera y tiene un hijo que esta en etapa escolar, vive en la casa de sus padres ocupando solo dos habitaciones con paredes de adobe y el piso de tierra, la casa se encuentra ubicada en la zona Alto San Pedro de la ciudad de La Paz.
Actualmente se dedica a la elaboración de tortas y empanadas para posteriormente venderlas de forma ambulante ya que no cuenta con un puesto de venta fijo ya que recibe contratos para diferentes eventos trabajando por más de diez horas al día y con lo que gana debe cubrir los gastos de alimentación, educación y pago de servicios básicos.
El crédito lo requiere para la compra de material de repostería como ser moldes para queques, pedestales, mangas para decorar,  etc., pues desea mostrar a sus clientes que su trabajo es profesional.
El sueño de Silvana es mejorar sus ingresos y poder independizarse para darle más comodidad a su hijo y mejorar su calidad de vida.
Es la primera vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y KIVA.
texts.en:
Silvana is single and has one school-aged son. She lives in her parents' home, occupying just two rooms, with adobe walls and earth floor. The house is located in the the Alto San Pedro area of the city of La Paz. 

Currently, she makes tortes and empanadas to subsequently sell as a street vendor, as she doesn't have a permanent stand. She receives orders for various events working for more than ten hours a day, and with what she earns must cover expenses for food, education, and payment of basic services. 

She needs the loan to buy pastry-making supplies such as cake molds, pedestals, decorating sleeves, etc., as she wishes to show her customers that her work is professional. 

Silvana's dream is to improve her income and be able to live on her own, in order to provide more comfort to her child, and improve their quality of life. 

It is the first time she has applied for a loan with IMPRO and Kiva.

loans.use: To buy molds for cakes and torts, pedestals, and decorating sleeves for her business making tortes, cakes, and empanadas.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda is 45 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. Imelda has a pigpen where she raises pigs that she sells when they are grown and mature. She has had this business for 11 years. 

Imelda has requested a loan of 4,000 PHP to buy animal feed for her pigs. She has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Imelda hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy animal feed for her pigs

loans.name: Faith

texts.en:
Faith is 34 years old, is married and together with her husband is blessed with four children. She has been operating a cereal business for the past eight years, earning a monthly income of KES 26,150.

Faith has applied for her second business loan of KES 60,000 which she intends to use to purchase more beans, maize and groundnuts to sell. She will use the anticipated profit to expand the business. Her future hopes and dreams are to have a stable business and a happy family.

loans.use: to buy more beans, maize and groundnuts to sell.

loans.name: Juana Francisca

texts.es: Juana, de oficio enfermera se dedica a prestar sus servicios de manera privada, atiende a personas de escasos recursos cerca de su comunidad , en Granada donde ella vive. Su anterior crédito fue de mucha ayuda pues la ayudo a resolver parte de las necesidades como era la falta de algodón, tijeras, gazas, sabanas, almohadas. Ahora necesita comprar camillas que necesita, guantes descartables, sueros, jeringas . Pues su proyecto es ir acondicionando mejor las condiciones de salud de sus pacientes. Además que ella promueve campañas de salud y vacunación para las personas aledañas a la comunidad.
texts.en:
Juana, a nurse by profession, provides services on a private basis. She tends to low-income people near her community, in Granada where she lives. 

Her previous loan was of great assistance, as it helped her to pay for part of what she needed, such as cotton wool, scissors, gauze, sheets and pillows. 

Now she needs to buy the stretchers she requires, disposable gloves, saline solution and syringes. Her plan is to gradually improve the health conditions of her patients. 

In addition, she promotes health and vaccination campaigns for people in the area surrounding the community.

loans.use: To buy the stretchers she requires, disposable gloves, saline solution and syringes.

loans.name: Vencedoras Group

texts.es:
Vencedoras es un grupo de tres mujeres que necesitan triunfar en la vida para poder mejorar la calidad de vida de sus hijos. De este grupo la presidenta es María quien se describe como una mujer trabajadora, emprendedora y sobre todo responsable en sus actividades. María vive con su esposo y su hijo en Ambato.

María se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales de granja como pollos, conejos, cuyes, chanchos entre otros, este negocio ayuda a María a sustentar las necesidades de su familia y tiene constante trabajo e ingresos. María necesita incrementar su negocio es por eso que solicita un crédito el mismo que va a ser invertido en la construcción de galpones, comprar alimento para sus animales y crías de conejos, cuyes, pollos y cerdos para criarlos. 

María y sus compañeras sueñan incrementar sus negocios constantemente y poder mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
“Vencedoras” (Winners) is a group of three women who need to triumph in life so that the can improve their children’s quality of life. The group president is María, who describes herself as a hardworking and enterprising woman. Above all, she is responsible in her business activities. She lives with her husband and son in Ambato.

María raises and sells farm animals such as chickens, rabbits, guinea pigs, pigs, and other creatures. This business helps María provide for the needs of her family and gives her a constant source of work and income. She needs to expand her business, so the loan she is requesting will be invested in the construction of animal pens. She will also buy animal feed as well as rabbits, guinea pigs, chickens, and pigs to raise.

María and her fellow group members dream of expanding their businesses on a constant basis so that they can improve their quality of life.

loans.use: to build animal pens and to buy animals to raise and the appropriate feed.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy banana leaves, corn, condiments, etc.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy, 49, is married and the mother of eight children. She lives in the outskirts of Kangemi, where she does dairy farming. She has been in this business for 10 years now and gets a monthly income of 10000 shillings.

Nancy has applied for her fourth loan from KADET LTD. She plans to use the money to buy dairy cows, and with the interest that she will get she will invest more in the dairy cow. 

In future, she wants to own a milk wholesale shop.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay the registration, tuition, and monthly fees related to his culinary studies.

loans.name: Sheyla María

texts.es:
El Sauce está ubicado a 90 km del departamento de León, es un bello pueblo rodeado de montañas florecidas y ríos caudalosos, se caracteriza por tener hermosas mujeres trabajadoras y emprendedoras, como es el caso de Sheyla María una señora de 42 años, casada, que se dedica al pequeño comercio.

Inició su negocio hace 25 años, el cual consiste en una pequeña y surtida Librería, la cual es muy concurrida por los pobladores de dicho municipio porque es la única que existe donde ofrecen de toda variedad de útiles escolares.

Está solicitando este crédito para compra de cartulinas, marcadores, lapiceros, folder, plastilinas, papelografo, papel lustrillo, resma de papel y libros con el fin de satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes ya que estamos en fiestas patrias en nuestro país donde es muy utilizado estos materiales.

Agradece a KIVA y Ceprodel por el apoyo con estos pequeños créditos que ayudan a mejorar las condiciones de vida de muchas familias de escasos recursos y que sin ello no se pudieran cumplir muchos sueños.
texts.en:
El Sauce is located 90 km from the department of León. It is a beautiful town surrounded by mountains in bloom and powerful rivers. It is known for having beautiful hard-working and entrepreneurial women, as is the case with Sheyla María, a married woman of 42, who works in her small business.

She began her business 25 years ago. It consists of a little, stocked book and stationery shop, which is well frequented by the population of this town because it is the only one that offers all type of school supplies.

She is applying for this loan to buy cardboard, markers, pencils, folders, play dough, flip charts, shiny art paper, a ream of paper, and books, with the aim of satisfying the demands of her customers, since it is now the season of patriotic festivals for this country, when these materials are much in use.

She is grateful to Kiva and to Ceprodel for the support of these small loans that help to improve the living conditions of many families of scarce resources and without which she would not be able to accomplish many dreams.

loans.use: to buy cardboard, markers, pencils, folders, play dough, flip charts, shiny art paper, a ream of paper, and books

loans.name: Manuela

texts.en:
Manuela, aged 58, lives in the Philippines and is married with two children. She has a food/retail shop (sari-sari store) where she buys and sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products and beverages. Manuela has had this business for 16 years. 

She has requested a loan of 6,000 PHP to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages to sell. Manuela has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, she hopes to improve her business so she can support her grandchildren's education.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages to sell

loans.name: María Del Carmen

texts.es:
María del Carmen vive en el municipio de El Sauce, ubicado al occidente del departamento de León, es una joven de 27 años, madre soltera de dos niños menores. Gracias a su profesión como profesora de primaria que ha desempeñado por muchos años les lleva el pan de cada día a sus hijos y les dota de lo mejor sin el apoyo de nadie, ya que quiere preparar a sus hijos con buenos principios y costumbres al igual que ella.

Está solicitando un crédito para compra de medicamentos, realización de exámenes y pago de consultas médicas ya que últimamente ha tenido un poco enfermos a sus pequeños los cuales los quiere sanar con el apoyo de este crédito, ya que con su pequeño salario no puede cubrir estos costos altos en medicina.

Se siente muy agradecida y satisfecha por el apoyo que le ha brindado KIVA y Ceprodel  al financiarle con estos créditos que ayudan a cumplir sueños y metas que no se pudieran llevar a cabo con los bajos salarios que se gana en nuestro país.
texts.en:
María del Carmen lives in the municipality of El Sauce, located in the western part of León department. She is a young woman of 27, and a single mother with two minor children. 

Thanks to her profession as a primary school teacher, that she has worked in for many years, she supports her children and provides them with the best; with help from no one. She wants to teach her children to have good moral principles and habits, just as she was taught. 

She is applying for a loan in order to buy medicines, have checkups done, and pay for doctor visits, as lately her children have been a little sick and she wants to cure them with the help of this loan. With her small salary, she cannot cover the high cost of medicines. 

She feels very grateful and pleased with the support that Kiva and Ceprodel have offered her; funding her through these loans that help to fulfill dreams and goals that couldn't be accomplished with the low salaries earned in her country.

loans.use: To buy medicines, have checkups done, and pay for doctor visits.

loans.name: Amina's Group

texts.en:
Amina is a 40-year-old divorced woman. She lives in Punjab, Pakistan with her 2 sons and 2 daughters. After her separation, she started her own business of a beauty salon and garment shop. She is the only parent of her children and she has so many responsibilities. She is a very hard-working and independent woman, who has to look after her house, children and her business as well. Amina's elder son is studying in collage while the elder daughter helps her mother in the business. 

Amina as a member of an 8-person lending group has requested a loan from KIVA partner BRAC Pakistan for purchasing some furniture and cosmetic products like beauty kits, laser machines, a variety of facial creams etc. for her beauty salon. She will also purchase some clothes for her garment shop. With the profit amount she wants to expand her garment shop. She prays for her children's bright future.

loans.use: To purchase products and furniture for her beauty salon and garment shop.

loans.name: Nelson

texts.en:
Nelson lives in Kaloleni where he has a grocery store. He chose this activity because he saw the need for one in his vicinity. Nelson is single and wants to move forward to prosper in the future and in preparation of his better living with his family when he gets married. 

Nelson started with a small amount of capital he saved through casual wages. With this small sum he started his business, buying only snacks, soft drinks, sweets, and flour. He gradually increased his products according to the demand of his customers. He feels satisfied that thanks to this business, he has been able to cover the expenses for himself and help his parents. Nelson is requesting a loan to increase his inventory by purchasing stocks of flour, rice, sugar, and other small, fast-selling goods. His goal for the future is to have a bigger store. Nelson also has a motorcycle taxi which is operated by his brother.

loans.use: purchase stocks of flour, rice, sugar, and other small, fast-selling goods.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is 35 years old and is married with five children. She wants to start a small business making and selling pancakes in her community. To do this, she needs a loan to buy flour, sugar, cooking oil, salt, onions and a frying pan. 

In the future, Nancy hopes to help out with her family's weekly expenses. She joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, cooking oil, salt, onions and a frying pan

loans.name: Progress Group

texts.en: Meet the members of the “Progress” group from Koidu, a city in Eastern Sierra Leone. They are all local entrepreneurs who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org, to apply for a loan of 500,000.00 Sierra Leonean Leones each. With the help of this loan they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their living conditions. Mabel is the leader of this group. The 39-year-old is married to a teacher and they have 4 school-going children. Mabel has been a businesswoman for 5 years now; she sells cloth, ready-to-wears, etc. With her share of this loan, she will buy the above mentioned items in wholesale to add to her current stock. (Also included in the right of the photo is loan officer Edward, handing over the loan to the borrowers)

loans.use: to buy cloth, ready-to-wears, etc. in wholesale to add to her current stock

loans.name: Heba

texts.en:
Due to cultural reasons Heba prefers that her photo is not on the Internet; thus the above photo is of her mother.
Heba is a 23-year-old single female from Marka in Jordan. She has requested a 500 JOD loan to buy clothes for sale. In the future Heba would like to open her own shop and proceed with her education in university.
Since Heba is under 30 years old, her loan is considered a youth loan.

loans.use: to pay for clothes to retail

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizer for his rice field

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is 26 years old and married to John. She has been earning a monthly income of KES 14,000 from her retail shop.

Mercy has applied for her second loan of KES.60,000 from KADET LTD after paying the previous loan well. She intends to use the loan to buy more stocks of sugar, bread and rice for sale. She will use the anticipated profit to widen the market scope of the business.

Her future hopes and dreams are to have a stable business and a happy family.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of sugar, bread and rice.

loans.name: Damaris

texts.es: La joven Damaris de 18 años de edad trabaja 40 horas semanales como asistente médico en una aclínica, estudia la carrera de licenciatura en  contaduría pública. Solicita apoyo de crédito para poder pagar el curso de titulación de su carrera, de no ser posible este préstamo le afectaría mucho ya que no tiene el dinero para pagar el titulo, tendría que ahorrar y esperar hasta el próximo año, le interesa su profesión porque podrá obtener una mejor oportunidad de empleo para ayudar a su familia, lo que comparte es que gracias a KIVA ella va lograr culminar su carrera.
texts.en: The young woman Damaris, who is 18 years old, works 40 hours a week as a medical assistant in a clinic. She is studying for a degree in public accounting. She is applying for the loan to be able to pay the final fees to certify her diploma. If this loan is not possible, it would affect her very much, since she does not have the money to pay her diploma fees and she would have to save and wait until the next year. She is interested in her profession because she will have better employment opportunities so that she can help her family. She wants to share that thanks to Kiva, she will succeed in finishing her program.

loans.use: to pay her diploma certification fees.

loans.name: Samalia

texts.en: Samalia is 52 years old and is married with seven children. She wants to start a small business growing and selling peanuts in her community. To do this, she needs a loan to buy shovels, chicken manure, chemicals and a wheelbarrow. In the future, Samalia hopes to expand her peanut farm. She joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy shovels, chicken manure, chemicals and a wheelbarrow

loans.name: Navy

texts.en: Navy is 47 years old and is married with three children. She wants to start a small business making and selling earrings made from coconut shells in her community. To do this, she needs a loan to buy a buffer, coconut shells and carving tools. In the future, Navy hopes to produce new products for sale. She joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy a buffer, coconut shells and carving tools

loans.name: Sameil

texts.en:
Sameil is 32 years old and is married with one child who is six years old. His clothing sales business is well organized. He starts at 7am and works until 8pm every day. He has three years of experience and one person to help him.

Sameil has requested a loan from Kiva's partner, Vision Finance Company, in order to buy more clothes (trousers) to sell. With the profit from this loan, Sameil will pay his child's school fees and reinvest in his business.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes (trousers) to sell.

loans.name: Naheed's Group

texts.en:
Naheed, aged 45, is married and is a hard-working woman. She lives with her husband, their four sons and daughter. One of her sons is running a mobile shop and another one is an electrician. For the past eight years, her husband has been running a welding shop. 

Now he needs to purchase some new machinery like a welding machine for his shop so that he can provide better services to his customers. Naheed and her husband want to open a new shop for their elder son. As a member of a 3-person group, Naheed has requested a loan from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan, to help her husband to purchase machinery for his welding shop. She dreams of a better future for their children.

loans.use: To purchase machinery for her husband's welding shop.

loans.name: Senayda De La Concepción

texts.es:
El Sauce es un pedacito de tierra donde nació Senayda de la concepción la cual se siente orgullosa por ser nicaragüense y Sauceña por gracia de Dios, la cual es una nación hermosa y valiente.

Senayda es una joven de 24 años que se gana la vida atendiendo su negocio que consiste en una pequeña pulpería donde ofrece abarrotería en general, la que inició hace dos años con capital que le regaló su esposo para que ejerciera este oficio y generara sus propios ingresos, el que le ha permitido desarrollarse como una pequeña comerciante y adquirir experiencia en este ramo.

este credito lo solicita para Compra de arroz, azúcar, aceite, jabón, maíz, frijoles y cosméticos. Uno de sus objetivos principales y meta que tiene con su esposo es ahorrar dinero de la ganancia del negocio para iniciar a construir su propia vivienda con todas las condiciones adecuadas, ya que cuentan con el lote de terreno.

Agradece a KIVA y Ceprodel por el apoyo brindado a través de estos préstamos que le han ayudado a mejorar el inventario de su negocio y así satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes.
texts.en:
El Sauce is a small piece of earth where Senayda de la Concepción was born. She feels proud to be a Nicaraguan and a Sauceña, by the grace of God. Nicaragua is a beautiful and brave nation. 

Senayda is a young woman of 24, who earns a living running her business, which consists of a small general store where she offers groceries in general. She started it two years ago with capital her husband gave her, so that she could carry on this occupation and generate her own income. This has allowed her to develop as a small business owner, and gain experience in this field.  

She is applying for this loan to buy rice, sugar, cooking oil, soap, corn, beans and cosmetics. One of her main objectives, and a goal she and her husband have, is to save money from the store's earnings to begin building their own home that will meet all their needs, as they have a plot of land. 

She is grateful to Kiva and Ceprodel for the support offered through these loans, which have helped her to improve her store's inventory and satisfy the demand from her customers.

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar, cooking oil, soap, corn, beans and cosmetics.

loans.name: Kwekwe

texts.en:
Kwekwe is from the coastal region of Kenya. She is a 41-year-old woman who has two children: she lives with the youngest while the oldest is married and independent. She is widowed and struggles to support her son who is in school. Despite all these adversities, Kwekwe has been working hard in her block-selling business for the past three years. She says that things are going very well.

Kwekwe is seeking the loan to buy more blocks to sell. This will be a very helpful investment in her business and it will bring her increased income.

loans.use: to buy more blocks to sell.

loans.name: Full Equipo Group

texts.es:
Este Banco Comunal se llama “Full Equipo” está conformado por 17 emprendedores quienes se dedican a diferentes rubros, entre los cuales se encuentran; bazar, venta de papas fritas, venta de pollo asado, venta de volantines, venta de empanadas, venta de pan amasado, ropa interior, feriantes, pastelería, venta de completos, venta de ensaladas, servicios entre otros. Todos ellos pertenecientes a la comuna de Puente Alto, ubicada en la ciudad de Santiago.
Alejandra, tesorera del grupo del Banco Comunal, quien en la foto se encuentra sentada en primera fila, ocupando el primer lugar de izquierda a derecha, viste un pantalón de color blanco. Polera de color negro y un sweater de color blanco, su cabello lo usa corto y es de color castaño claro.
Ella se dedica al rubro de preparación, reparación y accesorios de lavadoras automáticas, desde hace 8 meses. Comenta que trabaja con la ayuda de su marido en feria libres, a veces a domicilio y otras veces en su casa, trabajan toda la semana y su horario lo distribuyen de acuerdo a su disponibilidad.
La mercadería e insumos que necesita para la reparación de lavadoras las compra en distribuidoras e importadoras donde encuentra repuestos específicos para las lavadoras.
Con el crédito comprará repuestos, mallas, fundas, para el arreglo de lavadoras.
Una de las metas de Alejandra es tener un local establecido donde tenga su taller fijo y llegue su clientela y la atienda tranquilamente.
Alejandra vive junto a su esposo y tres hijos de 6, 6 y 2 años de edad. Sus sueños a nivel laboral es poder ser independiente y contar con los documentos necesarios para tener un local para reparar lavadoras automáticas.
Ella se encuentra muy contenta y agradecida de la oportunidad brindada por Fondo Esperanza, ya que le permitirá invertir en su negocio. Respecto al grupo del Banco Comunal del cual forma parte, comenta que en éste existe muy buena comunicación. Por otro lado las capacitaciones, le han servido para aprender nuevas estrategias de venta y contabilidad.
 Puente Alto es una comuna ubicada al norte de Santiago, capital de Chile. Fue fundada como un pequeño pueblo rural a fines del siglo XIX, pero dado su crecimiento demográfico es actualmente una de las comunas con mayor población de Chile, superando los 600 mil habitantes. Es la puerta de entrada a uno de los sectores precordilleranos de la región Metropolitana, conocido como el Cajón del Maipo, sector con espacios de caminatas, cabalgatas, rafting, entre otras actividades y servicios de alojamiento y alimentación.
texts.en:
This communal bank is called "Full Equipo." It consists of 17 entrepreneurs who work in different areas, among which are bazaar sales, selling french fries, selling roasted chicken, selling kites, selling empanadas, selling homemade bread, selling underwear, street market vendors, bakery, selling hot dogs, selling salads, and services, among others. All the members are from the community of Puente Alto, located in the city of Santiago

Alejandra is the treasurer of the communal bank group. In the photo she is seated in the first row, in the first seat going from left to right. She is wearing white pants, a black T-shirt, and a white sweater. Her hair is short and is light brown. She has been working in the area of installing, repairing, and accessories for automatic washing machines for 8 months. She comments that she works with the help of her husband at the Feria Libre market and sometimes in customers' homes, other times in her home. They work all week, and they plan their schedule according to their availability.

She buys the merchandise and supplies that she needs to repair washing machines from distributors and importers, where they have spare parts specifically for washing machines.  With the loan, she will buy spare parts, filters, and belts to repair washing machines. One of Alejandra's goals is to have an established location where she can have a regular workshop, her customers can come, and she can help them in a peaceful atmosphere. Alejandra lives with her husband and three children, ages 6, 6, and 2. Her dream with regard to her work is to be able to be independent and to have the necessary documents to have a shop to repair automatic washing machines.

She is very happy and thankful for the opportunity offered by Fondo Esperanza, since it will allow her to invest in her business. With regard to the communal bank group of which she is a part, she comments that in it there is very good communication. In addition, the training has helped her  to learn new strategies for sales and accounting.

Puente Alto is a community located in the north of Santiago, the capital of Chile. It was founded as a small rural town at the end of the 19th century, but given its demographic growth, it is now one of the communities in Chile with a large population, surpassing 600 thousand inhabitants. It is the port of entry to one of the mountain slope sectors of the metropolitan region, known as the Maipo River Canyon, an area with spaces for walking, horseback riding, and rafting, among other activities, and accommodation and food services.

loans.use: to buy spare parts, filters, and belts to repair washing machines.

loans.name: Nicholas

texts.en:
Nicholas, aged 28, is married and the father of two children. He operates a motorcycle transport business in the outskirts of Kangemi: he also does dairy farming for additional income. 

Nicholas has been in this transport business for two years and earns a monthly income of 24,000 KES. This is his first loan with KADET Ltd and he plans to use the entire loan to buy a motorcycle. 

In future, Nicholas wants to own a supermarket in his village area.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Lali

texts.en:
Lali is from Martvili district, West Georgia. She is 52 years old and lives with her husband and two grown sons. The family is involved in an agricultural business. In particular, they have a small dairy farm with a milk cow whose milk is used for dairy production. Lali produces sulguni (Georgian pickled cheese) and sells this at the local market. 

In addition, they grow nuts on family-owned land. Part of the harvest is sold at the local open market and the rest is used for the family's needs. Lali’s husband builds wood stoves which are the most popular heating appliances in the region. Lali works hard, but the family still doesn’t earn enough income to make some savings and improve their living conditions.

Lali has requested a loan to purchase construction materials for building wood stoves. After the materials are purchased, Lali’s husband will build more stoves and sell them at a good price. This will increase the family's income. With the increased income, Lali will improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials for building wood stoves.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en: Mariam is a single mother of four children, all of whom go to school. She doesn’t take care of any additional family members. Mariam has a business of selling green bananas and has been doing this for 10 years. She has applied for a loan of 2000000 Ugandan shillings from MCDTSACCO to buy more bunches of green bananas. Mariam works six days a week at the market, and sells on a retail basis only. Her major business challenges include seasonality and defaulters. She aspires to become a wholesaler and also to build her own house. She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees, rent and paying for utility bills.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of bananas for resale

loans.name: Bismark

texts.es:
El municipio de El Sauce se caracteriza por ser un pueblo calmo, lleno de personas trabajadoras y honradas como es el caso de Bismark, un joven emprendedor y luchador que hoy gracias a su propio esfuerzo tiene su propio negocio el que le da para sustentar a su familia y mejorar su propia vivienda.

Tiene 10 años de tener dicho negocio el cual es una Barbería ubicada en su casa de habitación donde atiende a todos los pobladores del barrio que visitan este negocio por la amabilidad del dueño y por la experiencia que tiene en el corte de cabello.

Está solicitando este crédito para compra de zinc, cemento y perlines, ya que quiere mejorar las condiciones de su negocio con el fin de que sus clientes tengan mayor comodidad y así atraer a mas clientes.

Está muy agradecido con KIVA y Ceprodel por el apoyo que le han brindado con estos créditos, ya que de alguna manera mejora las condiciones de vida de las personas. Espera y confía en Dios que estos inversionistas de buen corazón sigan prestando dinero a personas que lo necesitan en nuestro país.
texts.en:
The town of El Sauce is known as a tranquil place populated by hardworking and honest people such as Bismark. Bismark is a young and hardworking entrepreneur, who, through his own efforts, has his own business, which helps him support his family and improve his life.
He has been working in this business for the past ten years. It is located in his home. His customers are all the people from his neighborhood. They visit his business because the owner is friendly and because he has a lot of haircutting experience.
Bismark is asking for this loan in order to buy zinc, cement and metal supports in order to improve the condition of his business so that his customers are more comfortable and also to attract new customers.
He is thankful to KIVA and to Ceprodel for that support that they have provided with these loans. They help improve the lives of people. With the hope and confidence of God, he hopes that these good-hearted investors continue to lend money to people that need it in his country.

loans.use: to buy zinc, cement and metal supports to be used to increase his business location.

loans.name: Vicente Gonzalo

texts.es:
Vicente a la falta de empleo lo llevo a buscar alternativas para subsistir, busco oportunidades pero no encontró y se decidió en tener un negocio venta de morocho postre tipico de Guayaquil, por que vio un buen mercado  ahora todo va bien. 
Su trabajo  lo hace con su esposa quien le prepara el morocho y sale a vender en la parte central de Manta desde las 16:00pm.  Vicente tiene 2 hijos uno estudia en escuela fiscal y la otra niña es especial por lo cual su esposa tiene que llevarla todos los días atender al médico. 
Con el préstamo va a comprar  víveres para morocho arreglar su carreta ya que esta deteriorada y también mejorar el estado de su vivienda. Unas de sus aspiraciones es mejorar el nivel económico de su familia y darle un buen futuro para que sus hijos puedan terminar sus estudios.
texts.en:
Not having a job forced Vicente to look for alternatives to survive.  He looked for opportunities but couldn't find any so he decided to have a business selling "morocho," a traditional dessert of Guayaquil.  He saw a good market, so everything's going well now.  He does his job with his wife, who prepares the morocho for him and he goes out to sell it in the central area of Manta at 4 p.m.

Vicente has two children.  One of them studies in a public school and the other one, a girl, is special, so his wife has to take her to the doctor every day.

With the loan he's going to buy provisions for morocho and fix his cart because it's in bad shape.  He's also going to improve the state of his house.  Some of his goals are to improve his family's finances and give them a good future so his children can finish their studies.

loans.use: to buy milk for "morocho" [a dessert] and tools to fix his cart

loans.name: Karim's Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org based in Makeni in northern Sierra Leone, is very pleased to introduce to you this group of teachers from the eastern city of Koidu. They have requested a loan of 24,000,000 SLL from SMT/Kiva lenders in order to solve their immediate financial needs. At the end of each month, they will make payments using their monthly salaries to repay the loan. Their school’s bursar is directly responsible for deducting the payments and will repay SMT/Kiva lender on their behalf. 

Andrew is the leader of this group of teachers. Born in a place called Ngardorhun, in eastern Sierra Leone, Andrew, aged 48, has been in the teaching profession for 26 years. He is married and has five children – two in primary school, three in secondary school. Andrew has applied for this loan in order to buy construction materials: corrugated iron, cement, etc. to build a house for his family. He will also use part of the loan to pay his children's school fees.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to build a house, and to pay his children's school fees

loans.name: Shalet

texts.en: Shalet, 40, is married and the mother of four children between the ages of 6 and 19 years. Her husband Bahati is a police officer. She lives with her family in the town of Kaloleni, Kenya. Shalet states that due to the need of generating more income, she decided 5 years ago to start a business selling charcoal. She sells her charcoal at home where she has a small store. Shelet is currently asking for a 30,000 KES loan to buy more sacks of charcoal and expand her inventory. She believes that she will increase her income through this investment.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of charcoal

loans.name: Mehwish

texts.en:
Ms. Mehwish is a 19-year-old unmarried lady who lives with her parents and siblings. She is very talented and excels in machine embroidery. She has gotten a lot of appreciation for her skill from her community, so she decided to start her own business with the support of the Kashf Foundation. Her father is a public servant, but his income is insufficient to cover the family's expenses.

Mehwish is very satisfied with her business and requested a loan of 25,000 Pakistani rupees (PKR) to buy thread in different colors, beads, pearls, and other materials to meet current demand. She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan and wants to grow her business. She dreams of giving a good and quality education to her siblings through all her hard work in her business.

loans.use: To buy thread in different colors, beads, pearls, etc. to meet current demand.

loans.name: Mery Esther

texts.es: Mery Esther de 24 años, estudiante de la carrera de licenciatura de administración de empresas, no está trabajando aún, sus padres le ayudan con los gastos universitarios. Solicita apoyo de crédito para pagar el curso de titulación, de lo contrario se miraría obligada a buscar otros recursos a entidades que brinden el beneficio para poder pagar su curso, ya que le interesa mucho su profesión por que va a tener mejores oportunidades de lograr sus objetivos y nuevas metas, nos comparte que el éxito de cada persona y el futuro está en uno mismo.
texts.en: Mery Esther is a 24 year old student who is studying business administration. She isn’t working. Her parents help her with her university expenses. She is asking for this loan in order to pay for her university courses. If she doesn’t get this loan, she will be forced to look for other resources or entities that will help her pay for her coursework. The profession that she is studying interests her a lot as it will give her better opportunities to achieve her objectives and goals. She wishes to share that the success of a person and their future lies within them.

loans.use: to pay for her university courses.

loans.name: Silvia De Los Angeles

texts.es: Silvia de los Ángeles de  50 años de edad con 5 hijos de edades comprendías entre 31, 29, 25, 24,12 años de los cuales solamente el de  12 años está bajo su responsabilidad, porque es menor de edad, y está estudiando. Ella pertenece al departamento de Chinandega que está ubicado en la parte de occidente del país. Tiene por actividad económica la venta de ropa nueva, negocio en el que se desempeñado desde hace 25 años. Y lo tiene ubicado en uno de los mercados de la localidad. La rutina diaria de Silvia es de  10 horas  diarias desde la 8: am hasta 6 pm. Con el financiamiento comprara mercadería como: pantalones, camisas, faldas, short, ropa interior. Agrade la ayuda que le brindan los inversionistas  kiva a los pequeños comerciantes de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua. Para tener un medio de vida digno y fuentes y de trabajo.
texts.en: Silvia de los Ángeles is 50 years old, and has five children aged 31, 29, 25, 24, and 12, of which only the 12-year-old is under her care because he is younger and still in school. She comes from the department of Chinandega, located in the western part of Nicaragua. For the last 25 years her economic activity has been the sale of new clothing in one of the local markets, where she works every day from 8 am to 6 pm. With this loan she will buy merchandise such as pants, shirts, skirts, shorts and underwear. She is very pleased by the help that Kiva lenders have provided to small businesses with limited resources in poor countries like Nicaragua, allowing them to have a dignified means of living, income, and work.

loans.use: to purchase and sell new clothing like pants, shirts, skirts, shorts, dresses, and underwear

loans.name: Cheryl

texts.en:
Cheryl is a 29-year-old married woman and a mother of four young children aged 10, 7, 5, and 3. She lives in Talibon, Bohol, Philippines, with her husband and her children. Cheryl runs a sari-sari (convenience) store selling various types of goods to the people in the community.

Cheryl dreams of expanding her business but lacks the financial resources to do so. With a loan from CEVI, Cheryl will finally be able to to buy more goods to sell in her store, such as shampoo, detergent, cooking oil, seasonings, biscuits, and candies. With the additional inventory, she will be able to cater to more customers and buyers.

Cheryl wants to save more money for her children's schooling. She also hopes to experience the fullness of life together with her family.

loans.use: to buy more goods to sell in her store such as shampoo, detergent, cooking oil, seasonings, biscuits, and candies.

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es:
María  cuando llego a vivir al sector se dio cuenta de que había dos colegios junto  a su domicilio y  comenzó vendiendo comida primero a los profesores desayunos y almuerzos y así poco a poco se metió mas en el negocio. 
Su trabajo lo hace sola a veces la ayuda su hija y trabaja todo el día. Unas de sus dificultades es el espacio ya que es muy pequeño los clientes deben esperar mucho. María está casada su esposo es pescador y agricultor tiene 1 hijo que estudia en colegio fiscal. 
Con el préstamo va a comprar arroz, carnes y mariscos. Unas de sus metas es tener un restaurant con varias sillas mesas y tener mucha clientela.
texts.en:
When María came to live in this area, she realized that two high schools were located close to her home. She started selling prepared food. First she made breakfasts and lunches for the teachers. Little by little she grew her business.
She works alone sometimes and sometimes she her daughter helps her. She works all day. One of her problems is that her workspace is very small. Her customers sometimes have to wait a long time to receive their food. 
María’s husband is a fisherman and a farmer. They have one child who studies at a business college.
With this loan she will buy rice, meat and shellfish. One of her goals is to have a restaurant with many seats and tables and to have many customers.

loans.use: to buy rice, meat and shellfish to make prepared food for her customers.

loans.name: Félix Amanda

texts.es:
Félix Amanda vive en el municipio de El Sauce, ubicado al occidente del departamento de León, es una señora de 43 años, casada, con 4 hijos, una independiente que ya trabaja y los otros estudiantes universitarios. Gracias a su profesión como profesora de primaria que ha desempeñado por 24 años hoy tiene su propia vivienda la que ha ido mejorando poco a poco y que le está permitiendo preparar a sus hijos en una carrera profesional que en un futuro les permita defenderse por sí solos.

Gracias a estos créditos ha ido mejorando su vivienda en cuanto a las condiciones, poquito a poco va reparando algo de su casa como cerámica, repello de paredes y hoy está solicitando para terminar de construir una habitación para que sus hijos tengan más espacio, con el cual  comprará zinc, cemento, perlines y pago de mano de obra.
Se siente muy agradecida y satisfecha por el apoyo que le ha brindado KIVA y Ceprodel  al financiarle con estos créditos que ayudan a cumplir sueños y metas que no se pudieran llevar a cabo con los bajos salarios que se gana en nuestro país.
texts.en:
Félix Amanda lives in the municipality of El Sauce, located in the western part of the department of León in Nicaragua. She is 43 years old, married and has four children one of which is working, and three of which attend university. Thanks to her professional experience as a primary school teacher for the last 24 years, she now has her own house which she is improving little by little. This is helping her to prepare her children for a professional careers in the future which will allow them to fend for themselves. 

Thanks to these loans, she has slowly improved her housing conditions by repairing things in her house such as ceramics and plaster walls. Today she is asking for a loan in order to finish building a room so that her children can have more space. With the loan Félix Amanda will buy building supplies including zinc, cement, purlins, and manual labour. 

Félix Amanda feels grateful and pleased by the support provided by Kiva and Ceprodel to finance her. These loans help her to fulfill her dreams and goals that could not be accomplished otherwise with the low wages in her country.

loans.use: to buy zinc, cement, purlins, and to pay for manual labour

loans.name: Mnyazi

texts.en:
Mnyazi, aged 52, is widowed and lives in Kaloleni. She has her own home-based business. For over 10 years, she’s been busy in her tailoring business. She has a lot of experience and knows her customers very well. This is the reason why they like her as she always caters for their needs. 

Mnyazi has stayed in business thanks to the investment of loans; she’s already had one previous loan, the current application will be her second one. She is asking for 50,000 KES to buy clothing materials and thread to make garments. Her goal is to continue expanding her customer base in order to earn more income.

loans.use: to buy clothing materials and thread to make garments.

loans.name: Namkhainyambuu

texts.en: Namkhainyambuu, 33, works as a manager in a private company. He lives with his wife in a common apartment in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. His family furniture and inventories have not been replaced since he married his wife many years ago. Replacing most of the furniture “will be the big contribution to improve the living condition of my family,” he said. He is taking out a loan to cover the cost of the new furniture for his home.

loans.use: to cover the cost of new furniture for his home.

loans.name: Naveeda's Group

texts.en:
Naveeda is a 50-year-old, hard-working and independent woman. She lives in the Punjab, Pakistan with her husband, their two daughters and son. Her husband has diabetes and stays at home as his health doesn't allow him to work. Since 2000, for her profession, Naveeda has worked as an efficient and brilliant tailor. She and her daughters generate income by sewing clothes for the family and to pay the household's expenses.

Naveeda, as a member of a 3-person lending group, has requested a loan from KIVA's partner, BRAC Pakistan, to purchase a new tailoring machine for her daughter so that her daughter can help her by sewing clothes. With the profit, Naveeda is planning to purchase one more sewing machine and wants to extend her business as her other daughter also wants to help her by sewing clothes. She hopes for a good future for her daughters and son, and prays for her husband's good health.

loans.use: To purchase a new tailoring machine.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en: Nancy is a 30-year-old married woman from Al Hashmi in Jordan. She has 3 children and requested a loan of 300 Jordanian dinars (JOD) to pay for home-improvement expenses. In the future, she would like to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to pay for home-improvement expenses

loans.name: Yasmeen

texts.en:
Ms. Yasmeen is a vigorous 40-year-old lady and a mother of 5 children. She provides tents and associated services on special occasions such as weddings. Her husband assists her by making arrangements for chairs, tents, and crockery. They work happily together to support their family members

Ms. Yasmeen has been associated with the Kashf foundation for 3 years. To help her continue operating her business, she is requesting a loan of 25,000 Pakistani rupees (PKR)  to purchase more tents and chairs so she can serve more customers.
