In addition to repaying the loan, she will use part of the revenues to deal with personal expenses and increase her business capital.

loans.use: To purchase more tents and chairs to serve more customers

loans.name: Manal

texts.en:
Due to cultural reasons Manal prefers that her photo not appear on the Internet; thus the above photo is of her husband. Manal is a 27-year-old married woman who has seven family members and resides in Jarash, Jordan. She is requesting a loan of 500 JD to pay for her home improvements, including new furniture. In the future she wants to improve her living standard. 
Since Manal is under 30 year old, her loan is considered a youth loan.

loans.use: to pay for her home improvements.

loans.name: Batjargal

texts.en: Batjargal, 27,  runs a taxi business around the districts of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He has been running his business for a decade and he lives with his family in the ger district, the Mongolian traditional yurts and houses at the boundary of city. His daily earnings are approximately 20-25 USD. Lately, his old car has been using much fuel and emits much smoke into the air. He knows that it is very harmful for the health of people and the environment. So, he decided to replace his old car with a new one equipped with an electric engine. The loan he is taking out will be used to pay for the car with an electric engine.

loans.use: to pay for a car with an electric engine.

loans.name: Renan Miguel

texts.es:
Renan es joven de 19 años, vive en la ciudad de Ica, en el distrito de Santiago con su pareja y su pequeña bebé de 4 meses de nacida, él es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que junto con su pareja dedican todos sus esfuerzos por salir adelante; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad de trabajar para ayudar a su Madre, no pudo culminar sus estudios secundarios, ni estudiar la carrera profesional de Diseño Gráfico, pero le gustaría mucho poder hacerlo, en sus ratos libres le gusta jugar futbol con sus amigos y vecinos, y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Lomo Saltado para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Renan trabaja como obrero en construcciones, todos los días desde tempranas horas de la mañana inicia su labor, él puede trabajar un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por su buen desempeño y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
Renan se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar el pago de la cuta inicial de un pequeño terreno, en el cual desea construir su casa; de esta manera Renan espera poder iniciar la construcción de su casa propia para así poder salir de la casa de sus suegros y vivir con su familia en su propio hogar, así él seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para que junto con su familia salgan adelante.
texts.en:
Renan is young, 19 years old.  He lives in the city of Ica in the district of Santiago with his wife and little four-month-old baby.  He's a very kind, hardworking, and enthusiastic person.

He and his wife devote all their effort to getting ahead.  Unfortunately, for lack of financial resources and for the need to work to help his mother, he couldn't finish high school or study in a graphic design program, although he very much would like to have done so.  In his free time he likes to play soccer with his friends, and occasionally he makes a delicious Lomo Saltado [stir-fried beef and fried potatoes] to share with his family.

Through his own initiative and with a lot of hard work and dedication, Renan works as a construction worker.  Every day he starts work at a very early hour.  He can work approximately 10 hours a day and he believes it's going well for him because of his diligence and for the kind way he treats others.

Renan is very grateful to the Kiva lenders because thanks to their help he'll be able to make the initial payment on a small plot of land on which he wants to build his house.

This way Renan will be able to start construction on his own house to be able to move out of his in-laws' house and live with his family in their own home.  He will continue working and making the effort so he and his family can get ahead.

loans.use: to make the initial payment on a piece of land

loans.name: Sara Esmilda

texts.es:
Sara es una mujer de 28 años, vive en la ciudad de Chiclayo con sus 2 pequeños hijos a quienes ama y son su principal razón en la vida, lastimosamente por diversas razones desde hace varios años se separó de su pareja, desde entonces ella dedica todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia; gracias a su esfuerzo y al apoyo de sus padres, Sara pudo estudiar la carrera profesional de maestra de educación inicial, en sus ratos libres le gusta jugar vóley con sus amigas y en algunas ocasiones cocina unos riquísimo Tallarines Rojos para compartir con su familia.
Con mucho empeño y dedicación, Sara puso en marcha su pequeño negocio de venta de productos de belleza, ella cuenta con un pequeño espacio en su vivienda, donde tiene una vitrina donde exhibe sus productos, todos los días desde tempranas horas de la mañana inicia su labor, ella puede trabajar un aproximado de 8 horas y cree que le va bien por la variedad de productos que ofrece y por el trato amable que brinda a sus clientes.
Sara se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de mercadería para su negocio, tales como: cremas, maquillaje, perfumes, talcos, cosméticos, entre otros; de esta manera Sara tendrá su negocio mejor abastecido, así ella espera aumentar sus ventas e incrementar sus ingresos económicos, los cuales le servirán de mucho para ampliar su negocio y con ello desea cumplir su gran sueño de tener su casa propia, donde sus pequeños puedan desarrollarse adecuadamente.
texts.en:
Sara is a 28-year-old woman. She lives in Chiclayo with her two small children who she loves and who are the reason she is alive. Sadly, for many reasons, and for several years, she has been separated from her partner. For this reason she has put all her effort into helping her family move forward. Thanks to her efforts and the support of her parents, Sara was able to study to be a primary school teacher. In her free time she likes to play volleyball with her friends. Sometimes she cooks delicious dishes, which she enjoys with her family.
With a lot of effort and dedication, Sara began a small business selling beauty products. She has a small space in her house where she has a display cabinet to display her products. Every day, from early in the morning, she begins her work. She works about eight hours a day. She thinks her business is going well as she offers a variety of products and is friendly to her customers.
Sara is thankful for the loans from KIVA and is the help that they provide. She can buy merchandise for her business such as creams, jewelry, perfumes, powders and cosmetics as well as other similar items. Sara would like to have a well-stocked business. In this way she can increase her sales and grow her income. This will help her increase her business and help her reach her greatest dream, which is to have her own house where her children can grow up.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as creams, jewelry, perfumes, powders, cosmetics, etc.

loans.name: Nargiza

texts.en:
Nargiza is from Abasha district, West Georgia. She is 57 years old and lives with her husband and two grown daughters. Her elder daughter has chronic health problems and gets a relevant pension from the local government. Nargiza’s husband is provided with a retirement pension. The family is involved in the agricultural business. In particular, they have small dairy farm of two milk cows, whose milk is used for cheese production. Nargiza sells on average 20 kg cheese per month.  In addition, they grow nuts and maize on family-owned land. Part of the harvested production is sold at the local open market and the rest is used for family needs. She runs a poultry business and sells on average 900 eggs per season. Nargiza works hard, but the family still doesn’t have enough income for some savings and to improve the living conditions of the family.

With the received credit, Nargiza will purchase pigs. She will place the pigs in a shed located in their yard, raise them and after several months the family will be able to have piglets. This will increase the family's animal husbandry business and their income as well. With the increased income, Nargiza will improve the living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase pigs.

loans.name: Aisha

texts.en: Aisha is a 49-year-old married female and has six children. She has requested a 700 JOD loan to pay for  home improvements and painting. in the future she would like to expand her home and buy some furniture in order to improve the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to pay her home improvement expenses.

loans.name: Wilfredo

texts.en:
Wilfredo is a 54-year-old married man from Talibon, Bohol, Philippines and is the father of three children. He has been engaged in a fishing business for more than 10 years. 

Wilfredo has been a member of CEVI for some time now. He likes the services offered by the organization to the micro-entrepreneurs in the country. He is currently requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, fuel for his boat and other fishing equipment. 

Wilfredo is optimistic that this loan can make a big difference in improving his business and in improving his life together with that of his entire family.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, fuel for his boat and other fishing equipment

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy sacks of rice and various goods.

loans.name: Sara Biviana

texts.es: Sara Bibiana de 55 años de edad, casada con 7 hijos todos adultos e independiente. Ella pertenece al departamento de Chinandega, lugar que se caracteriza por ser una zona muy productiva comercialmente. El negocio es la venta de ropa nueva y  segunda mano, calzado nuevo y segunda mano. El tiempo de tener el negocio 26 años. La rutina diaria de Sara Bibiana es trabajar unas 10 horas diaria desde la 8 : am a las 6 pm lo cual distribuye su mercadería  a sus clientes fijos y eventuales de forma ambulante. El negocio lo inicio hace muchos años como iniciativa propia para ayudar a su esposo  con los gastos del hogar ya que sus hijos en ese momento estaban pequeños y necesitaban de su ayuda. Hoy en día están formados y la carga familiar es más leve. Sara ya ha trabajado con fundación león 2000 Y ha demostrado ser buena paga en tiempo y forma. Con el financiamiento comprara mercadería para surtir su pequeño negocio y satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes, y aprovechar las ventas y obtener mayores utilidades. Sara Bibiana agradece la ayuda de los inversionistas kiva  a los pequeños comerciantes de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua.
texts.en: Sara Bibiana is 55 years old, married, with seven adult children who live on their own. She lives in Chinandega province, which is known as a productive commercial area. She sells new and used clothes and shoes. She has been doing this for the past 26 years. She works ten hours a day, from 8am until 6pm. She sells her merchandise to her usual customers door to door. She began this business a long time ago in order to help her husband with household expenses. Her children were young and they needed her help. Sara has been working with the Leon Foundation since the year 2000 and she has always paid back her loans on time. With this loan she will buy merchandise in order to provide a greater variety of goods for her small business. This will help her meet her customer’s demands. She will have better sales. She is thankful for the help that KIVA provides to small businesspeople with scant resources and to poor countries like Nicaragua.

loans.use: to provide a greater variety of products for her small business such as new and second hand clothes and shoes.

loans.name: Rosa Emperatriz

texts.es:
Rosa tiene 55 años es viuda y tiene un hijo de 36 años .empezó su negocio  hace 20 años vendiendo varios productos siempre ha sido comerciante y le gusta innovar. 
En la actualidad ella trabaja sola de lunes a domingos de 6:00 am hasta 5:00 pm y en las tarde vende chuzo y alitas asadas. Con el prestamo quiere comprar para su tienda viveres como aceites, granos, dulces, confites, bebidas etc. Su meta es que su negocio crezca, para tener más ingresos y poder terminar de construir su casa.
texts.en:
Rosa is 55 years old, is a widow, and has a son who is 36 years old. She started her business 20 years ago selling various products. She has always been a merchant and she likes to innovate. She currently works alone from Monday to Sunday from 6:00am to 5:00pm. In the evenings, she sells meat brochettes and roasted wings.

With the loan, she wants to buy supplies for her store such as oil, grains, sweets, candies, beverages, etc. Her goal is to make her business grow, so she will have more income to finish building her house.

loans.use: to buy oil, grains, sweets, candies, and beverages.

loans.name: Doreen

texts.en:
Doreen is married with one child, who goes to school. She also takes care of her father. She has a business of selling cosmetics and has been in this for three years. She has applied for a loan of 500,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more vaseline, braids and cream relaxers. She generates additional income through rental rooms. 

She works in a shop seven days a week and sells to all categories of people but on a wholesale basis only. Her major business challenges include transportation and thieves. She aspires to see her business grow bigger so that she can start importing cosmetics from Dubai. She resides in her own house and the family has access to electricity but no piped water.  Her monthly expenses includes school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more vaseline, braids, and cream relaxers

loans.name: Zaibi

texts.en:
Ms. Zaibi is 32 years old, a strong lady who has had a sewing business for 4 years.  She is happily doing it to support her family. She knows the sewing techniques very well and is famous in her town. She is in charge of providing her family's bread and butter. She has improved her business gradually with the support of Kashf Foundation.

Currently she has one child and her husband makes his living by working in a factory. There were days when he could not find work and had to return home without any money. He was not even able to provide a meal for his family. She contacted Kashf foundation upon the advice of her neighbor, to help them to fight poverty. With the support of Kashf, she bought a sewing machine and started working. She has a good client list and now she has requested a repeat loan of Rs.15,000 to buy good quality threads of different colors in large quantities. She hopes to earn profit and will utilize the earned amount to provide basic necessities of life to her family members.

loans.use: To buy good quality threads of different colors in large quantities.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is a widow with five children--four of her children go to school.  She doesn’t take care of additional family members. She has a business of selling charcoal selling to all categories of customers, both retail and wholesale. She has applied for a loan of 900000 Ugandan shillings from MCDTSACCO to buy more bags of charcoal.  She has been in charcoal business for one year. 

Besides this charcoal business, she own a kiosk at the nearby school selling bread, biscuits, sweets, fried cassava and cakes.  She works seven days out of every week and works from her home. Her major business challenges include transportation of bags of charcoal from the villages to her home and also the rainy season which hinders her movements. She aspires to own a delivery van to ease transportation, to build rental rooms, and to educate her children up to university. She resides in her own house and the family has no access to piped water but has access to electricity. Her monthly expenses includes school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal

loans.name: Isam

texts.en: Isam is a 38-year-old married male from Marka in Jordan. He has four children and requested a 700 Jordan dinars (JOD) loan to pay for his home improvement expenses. He would like to buy some furniture and a room for his kids. In the future, he would like to get his children educated.

loans.use: to pay for his home improvement expenses.

loans.name: Ana Yulissa

texts.es:
Ana es una mujer de 29 años, es soltera, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; gracias a su esfuerzo y al apoyo de sus padres, Ana pudo estudiar la carrera profesional de Educación, en sus ratos libres le gusta relajarse escuchando un poco de música y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Arroz con Pollo para compartir con su familia. 
Con mucho empeño y dedicación, Ana trabaja como maestra en un pequeño colegio de su ciudad, todos los días desde tempranas horas de la mañana asiste a su centro de trabajo para iniciar su labor, ella puede trabajar un aproximado de 8 horas y cree que le va bien por su responsabilidad y por su buen desempeño.
Ana se encuentra muy agradecida don los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá cubrir los gastos de la tramitación documentaria para la obtención de sus certificado y título profesional; de esta manera Ana podrá estar mejor calificada profesionalmente, así ella seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de tener su casa propia y ser una buena profesional.
texts.en:
Ana is a 29 years old woman, is single, and lives in the city of Pucallpa. She is very kind, hard-working and enthusiastic, with a great desire to excel. Thanks to her effort and the support of her parents, Ana could study the career of Education. In her free time, she likes to relax listening to some music and sometimes she cooks a delicious Arroz con Pollo [Rice with Chicken] to share with her family.

With effort and dedication, Ana works as a teacher in a small school in her city. Every day from early morning she goes to her workplace to start her work. She works approximately eight hours and she thinks she is doing well with her responsibility and good performance.

Ana feels very grateful to Kiva lenders, because thanks to the help provided she will cover the costs to process the documentation to obtain her certificate and professional degree. This way, Ana will be better qualified professionally. She will continue to work and strive to achieve her big dream of owning a house and be a good professional.

loans.use: to cover the costs of processing her professional certificate.

loans.name: Julio Fautino

texts.es:
Julio, de 58 años de edad, de oficio pescador, originario de Granada, casado. Se dedica la pesca desde muy joven, su esposa vende comida en su casa, para ayudarle a pagar los gastos familiares. Su anterior crédito lo utilizo para reparar su lancha, pues solo cuenta con una propia y otra que alquila, además con el credito anterior tuvo la oportunidad de comprar una malla para pescar.  Su arduo trabajo en la pesca de aguas dulce, no ha sido tarea fácil pero su mayor recompensa la encuentra cuando logra llevar el sustento alimenticio para su familia y mantener estable su negocio.
Él está requiriendo el préstamo para comprar un bote para pescar. Pues ese es uno de las metas que tiene desde hace tiempo, ya que le ayudara a navegar más rápido y en mejores condiciones y reducirá los costos de estar alquilando botes.
texts.en:
Julio is 58 years old, works as a fisherman, is married, and is native of Granada. He started fishing at a young age. His wife sells food in their home in order to help him to pay the family expenses. He used his previous loan in repairing his boat, because he only has the boat that he owns and another that he rents. Also, with the previous loan, he had the opportunity to buy a fishing net. 

His hard work fishing in fresh water has not been easy, but his greatest reward is when he manages to bring sustenance for his family and keep his business stable. 

He is requesting a loan to buy a boat for fishing. This is one of the goals he has had for some time, because that will help him to navigate faster and better and will reduce the costs of renting boats.

loans.use: to buy a boat for fishing.

loans.name: Gunda

texts.en: Gunda has a store in his neighborhood where he does welding and makes and sells metal windows and doors. He started this business after gaining skills from a friend; previously he was a bicycle repairer. In time he saved money until he had enough capital to open his own business. He currently works with a cousin who helps him take care of the customers. Gunda is very happy with all that he has achieved in the time that he has been in business. He needs the loan to purchase metal materials to make more products. In the future he would like to be able buy a municipal business and open another store in the market.

loans.use: to purchase metal materials to make more products.

loans.name: Zaibi

texts.en:
Ms Zaibi is a 23-year-old enthusiastic lady who is in the business of selling crockery in her community.  She is a newly married woman. She said when she got married only two of her family members were earning income--the income earned was insufficient to meet the expenses of the family members. She then decided to initiate her small business through support of Kashf foundation, and with the the permission of her husband. She lives in a large conventional family with her husband and other relatives. She needs to be earning more to cover everyday expenditures of her family.  

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a loan of Rs.30,000. She will be using the loan to buy more sets of crockery from the local market at lower rates. In this way she will be able to drive up her sales and profits. Zaibi hopes to grow her business and dreams of giving good quality food to her family members through all her hard work in her business.

loans.use: To buy more sets of crockery from the local market at lower rates.

loans.name: Saidah

texts.en: Saidah is a 48-year-old married woman who has five family members. She is from Al Bayader, Jordan. She is requesting a loan of 700 Jordan dinars (JD) to pay for clothes and accessories to sell to her friends and neighbors in the same area. In the future, she hopes to expand her project by opening a shop.

loans.use: to pay for clothes and accessories to sell.

loans.name: Kerbbah

texts.en:
Kerbbah lives in the Ganta area. She is 30 years old, married and has a child aged 5 who is in school and lives at home. Kerbbah is a high school graduate and her husband is a businessman.

For the past 10 years, she has been running a shop where she sells rice by the bag. She started this business by selling on a table in a market with a little money that she received from her oldest sister. A problem she is facing is that her shop needs renovation. She is requesting a loan to purchase more rice by the bag and renovate her shop. Her plan is to build a house for her child and educate her child.

loans.use: to purchase more rice in bags and renovate her shop.

loans.name: Abida

texts.en:
Ms. Abida is a 29-year-old married woman. She has been doing a business of carpet manufacturing for the past 12 years with her husband. The man shown in the photo is Abida’s husband. She offers various designs of carpets and is famous for providing good quality in her town. She and her husband are happily doing it for the sake of her family.

She is a mother of three and is trying hard to fulfill their demands including food, health, clothing and education. She is also doing sewing as her part-time job. In this way, she is able to handle her family needs and requirements effectively. 

It’s her fifth year with Kashf Foundation. She is satisfied with the support of Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of Rs. 40,000 to buy bundles of wool and threads in different shades. In this way, she would be able to meet the demand time after time, and hence, increase her sales. She desires to utilize the earned revenue for building a separate room for her children.

loans.use: To buy bundles of wool and threads in different shades.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase stock of assorted items like beans, green grams (a legume), maize and black beans for sale.

loans.name: Hector Santos

texts.es:
Hector vive en la ciudad de Ica, , la cual se caracteriza por tener un clima muy cálido y acogedor, asimismo se desarrolla la agricultura en especial el cultivo de algodón, uva, esparrago, entre otros. Hector aprendió a ganarse el pan con el sudor de la frente, ya que sus padres eran de condición humilde y por ello tuvo la necesidad de apoyarlos para poder solventar los gastos del hogar, por ello solo pudo estudiar hasta el quinto grado de educación secundaria, pero le hubiera gustado estudiar computación e informática.

Día a día Hector trabaja en su pequeña parcela en la cual ha sembrado algodón, el trabaja alrededor de 6 horas al día y con el fruto de su trabajo puede solventar los gastos de su hogar y seguir apoyando a sus padres; el cree que le va bien en su negocio porque trabaja con mucho gusto.

Hector está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá comprar abono, fertilizantes, realizar la poda, limpieza y riego de su cultivo, de esta manera el podrá tener una buena cosecha y poder seguir adelante y hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Tener su casa propia”.
texts.en:
Hector lives in the city of Ica, which is characterized by very hot and warm climate. In the area there's farming, especially the cultivation of cotton, grapes, and asparagus, among others. Hector learned to earn his living with the sweat of his brow, because his parents were humble and therefore he had to support them to cover the household expenses. For this reason, he could only study through fifth grade of secondary education, but he would have liked to study computer science. 

Every day, Hector works in his small plot in which he planted cotton. He works about six hours a day and with the fruit of his work he covers the costs of his household and keeps supporting his parents. He thinks he is doing well in his business because he works with pleasure.

Hector is very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to the help they provided, he will buy manure, fertilizers, perform pruning, and will clean and irrigate his cultivation. Doing so, he will have a good harvest and will get ahead in realizing his biggest dream of "having his own home".

loans.use: to purchase manure, fertilizers, perform pruning, and to clean and irrigate his cultivation.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for her home improvements

loans.name: Stella

texts.en: Stella  is married with three children and all her children go to school. She doesn’t take care of any additional family members. She has a business of selling cosmetics and has been in this business for three years. She has applied for a loan of 2000000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more boxes of weaves, vaseline and braids. Besides this cosmetics business she also generates additional income through raising chickens. She works in a shop and sells on a retail basis seven days a week. Her major business challenges include seasonality and the ever increasing prices of cosmetics in Uganda. She aspires to see her business grow bigger into one of the leading shops selling cosmetics in Uganda, and also to build rental houses. She decided to join MCDTSACCO because of their better services. She resides in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees, paying utility bills and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy boxes of weaves, vaseline and braids

loans.name: Justine

texts.en: Justine is married with four children and all her children go to school. She has a business of selling used clothes and has been in this business 12 years, selling to all types of people but on a retail basis. She has applied for a loan of 1200000 Uganda shillings from MCDTSACCO to buy more bales of used clothes. Justine works from home seven days a week. Her major business challenges include seasonality and the ever increasing prices of used clothes in Uganda. She aspires to become a wholesaler and also to educate her children up to university level. She decided to join MCDTSACCO because of their low interest rates. She resides in her own house and the family has access to electricity but not to piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more bales of used clothes

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is 30 years old. He lives in Samtredia District with his wife, parents and two children (1 and 5 years old). George requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. His loan requests were rejected all the time because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

The only sources of income for the family are the monthly pensions of George’s parents and the small income earned by George working as an artisan in the village. It total 560 Laris per month. It is hardly enough for food for a six-member family. According to Credo estimations, the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

George requested a loan from Credo to start-up a family business. His loan request was approved in the frame of a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to the country's rural poor, who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income. 

With the received credit, George will build a greenhouse. He requested a loan to build a greenhouse. He will purchase building materials and construct it. David will sow different kinds of vegetables and greens to sell at a good price. This will increase the income of the family. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of the family. George awaits your support.

loans.use: to build a greenhouse.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James, age 30, and his life companion, Anisha, have three children. He struggles untiringly for them. He does this because he wants to be able to give them everything that he was not able to have.

James has been growing and selling vegetables for over five years. He does this with the help of his family. The loan he is requesting will enable him to buy planting materials and fertilizers and pay for labor costs. He wants to be able to invest in his garden, which is his main source of income.

He is very grateful to Yehu and Kiva for the possibility of a loan. This way, he will increase his income and help his family.

loans.use: to buy planting materials and fertilizers and pay for labor cost.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy fertilizers and to cover the cost of labor

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en:
Jackline is 30 years old. She is married to Robert and has been blessed with three children. She is an electrician and has been running the business for the last seven years. Her monthly income is 20,000 Kenyan shillings (KES).

She is servicing her first loan of KES 20,000 from KADET LTD., and this will assist her to purchase more electrical gadgets, spares and associated items. She plans to use the anticipated profits to reinvest and increase her inventory. 

Her future dreams is to have a stable business and income that will make her able to improve the living standards of the family

loans.use: to purchase additional electronics for sale.

loans.name: María Elena

texts.es:
El Sauce es un bello municipio de occidente rodeado de montañas florecidas por la temporada de invierno donde lo típico es ver las humildes viviendas con techos de tejas.

En él hay muchas personas que se caracterizan por ser trabajadoras y luchadoras como es el caso de doña María Elena, una señora de 41 años que se dedica a brindar sus servicios como maestra de primaria en una escuela rural del municipio de El Sauce donde tiene gran experiencia en este oficio por ejercerlo por más de 10 años.

Gracias a su trabajo y el apoyo de su esposo hoy tiene su propia vivienda la que ha ido mejorando poco a poco y la que quiere ir ampliando para brindarles un buen patrimonio a sus hijos, por tal motivo lucha día a día para poner mejor empeño en su labor y lograr en el futuro su objetivo. En los últimos días se ha sentido un poco mal de salud y por su bajo salario no puede cubrir los costos altos en medicamentos y realizarse exámenes que le recetaron, es por esto que está solicitando un crédito para la compra de medicamentos y realización de exámenes con el fin de mejorar su salud y seguir desempeñando de la mejor manera su oficio.

Agradece a KIVA y Ceprodel por el apoyo brindado a través de estos préstamos que vienen a resolver problemas personales que por los bajos salarios en nuestro país no pueden cubrirse.
texts.en:
El Sauce is a beautiful municipality in western Nicaragua that is surrounded by mountains, which are lush with flowers during the winter.  It is typical to see modest houses with humble roofs in the municipality.

El Sauce is known for its hardworking and tenacious inhabitants, which is true of María Elena.  She is 41 years old and makes a living as a primary school teacher at a rural school in El Sauce.  She has a lot of experience in her job, since she has worked there for more than 10 years.  

Thanks to her job and help from her husband, María Elena now has her own home, which she has been gradually improving; she wants to expand it so that she can provide her children with a good inheritance.  That is why she struggles hard each day to put her best effort into her work and to achieve her goal in the future.  

Recently María Elena has been feeling a bit ill, and because of her low salary she is unable to cover the high costs of the medicines and the medical examinations that have been prescribed for her.  That is the reason she is asking for a loan, which she will use to pay for medicines and medical examinations so she can improve her health and continue doing the best job that she can.

María Elena is grateful to Kiva and CEPRODEL for their support in providing these loans, which are going to solve people's problems that cannot be fixed with the low salaries in their country.

loans.use: to pay for medicines and medical examinations.

loans.name: Negamyehe

texts.en:
Negamyehe is 34 years old and he is married to a farmer. Negamyehe has been a maize farmer for 10 years, and he will use this Kiva loan to support labor costs and fertilizer during maize production. He needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase his production. With profits from his farming he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines like tractors that will enhance his farming capacity.

The photo taken was at the previous seasons maize ground, which the borrower will still use for this new season. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and support labor costs during maize production.

loans.name: Jean

texts.en:
Jean is 52 years old. He is married to a farmer. He has been a maize farmer for 30 years. He will use Kiva loan to pay labor costs and buy fertilizer during maize production: He needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase his production. With profits from his farming, he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines like tractors that will enhance his farming capacity.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy fertilisers and pay labor costs during maize production.

loans.name: Rosa Angelina

texts.es: Rosa Angelina de 28 años  de edad, casada con tres hijos bajo su responsabilidad de 11,6,12 años,  Rosa tiene  por actividad económica la venta de calzado de niño, sandalias, tenis, deportivos, de cuero para hombre y mujer, el negocio lo tiene ubicado en el mercado de la localidad lo cual le ofrece a clientes fijos y eventuales. Rosa sus rutina diaria es de 10 horas diarias  desde las 8: am hasta 6: pm  ofreciendo su producto en el mercado. Rosa ya ha trabajado con fundación león 2000 lo cual ha demostrado que es responsable en sus pagos, en tiempo y forma, Rosa  está solicitando el financiamiento para invertir en capital de trabajo y comprar zapatos variados para surtir su tramo y su satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes.  Ella tiene sueños en un futuro no muy lejano como es poder  pagar lo más pronto posible  el tramo que adquirió en el mercado de la localidad, ya que es su medio de vida. Agradece la ayuda que le brindan los  inversionistas kiva a personas de escasos recursos de países pobre como es Nicaragua.
texts.en: Rosa Angelina is 28 years old. She is married and has three children she is raising, aged 11,6 and 12. Rosa's economic activity is selling children's shoes, sandals, tennis shoes, and leather shoes for men and women. Her business is located in the local market where she gets regular and occasional customers. Rosa's daily routine is ten hours long, from 8 a.m. to 6 a.m., offering her product in the market. Rosa has already worked with the Fundación León 2000 and has shown herself to responsible, making her payments on time and in the correct manner. Rosa is asking for the loan to invest in working capital and in buying various shoes to stock her locale and fill her customer's demands. She dreams of a not so distant future when she can pay off the locale she acquired in the market as soon as possible, since it is how she earns her living. She is grateful for the help offered by the Kiva investors to people with low income from poor countries like Nicaragua.

loans.use: to stock her business by buying footwear such as sandals and leather shoes for men, women and children, as well as tennis and athletic shoes.

loans.name: Sandra Eloisa

texts.es: Sandra Eloísa de  49 años madre soltera, con dos hijos mayores de edad independiente económicamente. Y  dos nietos lo cuales dependen de ella, porque lamentablemente su hija falleció y sus niños quedaron bajo su responsabilidad lo cual ha sido un gran desafío  y problema pero con la ayuda de Dios ha podido salir adelante. Ella pertenece al  municipio de Chinandega. Sandra Eloísa se caracteriza por ser una mujer  muy trabajadora, responsable desde muy joven ha tenido que trabajar por la falta de recursos económicos de sus padre. En la actualidad Sandra tiene por actividad económica la venta de mercadería en general  desde hace 17 años que se dedica a esta actividad. Su trabajo consiste en vender (ropa de niño, adultos, cosméticos, perfumes) la cual distribuye en su casa y de forma ambulante, todos los días tiene que cargar con un bolso de unos 30 kg en el cual transporta la mercadería. Sandra ya ha tenido otros créditos con fundación lo cual ha demostrado ser buena paga en tiempo y forma. Sandra agradece la ayuda que le brinda los prestamista kiva a personas de escasos recursos y países pobres como es Nicaragua.
texts.en: Sandra Eloísa is a 49 year old single mother. She has two grown children who are financially independent, and 2 grandchildren who depend on her because, sadly, her daughter died and her children came under her responsibility. This has been a big challenge and problem but with God's help she has been able to get ahead. She lives in the town of Chinandega. Sandra Eloísa is described as a very hardworking, responsible woman. Since she was very young she has had to work because of her parents' lack of resources. Right now, Sandra's aconomic activity has been selling general merchandise for 17 years. Her work consists of selling adluts' and children's clothing, cosmetics and perfumes. She sells from her house and as a street vendor. Everyday she carries her 30kg bag in which she transports her merchandise. Sandra has had two previous loans with the foundation and has shown that she makes her payments on time. Sandra is thankful for the help from the Kiva lenders for people of low income and in poor countries like Nicaragua.

loans.use: to stock her street selling business buying children's and adults' clothing, cosmetics and perfumes.

loans.name: Dianela

texts.es: Dianela de 44 años de edad es una mujer dedicada a las artesanías de lencería y a otras manualidades. Ella vive con su cónyuge y sus 2 hijos en las edades de 7 y 13 años en la ciudad donde ofrece sus productos desde hace 14 años cuando inicio su negocio de tradición familiar para genera ingresos y apoyar el bienestar de su hogar. Los principales productos que ofrece son los edredones, protectores de electrodomésticos y artículos que adornas las habitaciones de los baños y dormitorios de los hogares de sus clientes, con quienes usa un canal directo para hacer su venta. Sus ventas las realiza de contado y sus ventas las hace en almacenes especializados de  insumos de artesanías y también las realiza de contado. Su tarea la combina con las actividades domésticas e inicia su tarea desde las 12 del día hasta las 6 de la tarde diariamente. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo,  con el cual comercializará muñecas fofuchas en foamy, arreglos navideños y algunas lencerías. Su meta mas adelante es lograr tener un local propio para ofrecer productos artesanales especializados, su meta familiar es que sus hijos terminen de estudiar y se profesionalicen exitosamente.
texts.en: Dianela is 44 years old. She is a woman who works with artisanal linens and other handmade crafts. She lives with her spouse and 2 children, aged 7 and 13 in the city where she has sold her products for 14 years. She started her business, which has been a family tradition, to generate income and support the wellbeing of her home. The main products she offers are comforters, covers for appliances and items to decorate bathrooms and bedrooms in her customers' homes, the ones she sells directly to. She she does her sales in cash and sells to specialized stores for artisanal crafts whom she charges upfront as well.  She does her work and her household work, starting her job at 12 noon and finishing every day at 6 p.m. Right now, she is applying for a Kiva loan, the first loan she has taken out with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. With it, she will sell foam fofucha dolls, Christmas decorations, and some linens. Her goal for the future is to be bale to have her own locale to offer specialized artisanal products. Her family goal is for her children to finish their studies and have successful careers.

loans.use: to buy foam focucha dolls, Christmas decorations and some linens

loans.name: Shaneela

texts.en:
Ms Shaneela is a 47-year-old widow. She is in the business of supplying packs of biscuits and toffees to different cities. She faced a lot of troubles after the death of her husband. Being a single parent of five, she is striving hard to provide the basic necessities of life to her children by herself. She has been in association with the Kashf Foundation for five years. She has gradually improved her business through their support. 

She needs to earn more to cover the everyday expenditures of her family.  To help her continue the operations of her business, she is requesting a loan of Rs.45,000. She will be using the loan to buy more packs of biscuits and sweets to drive up her sales. She is hopeful of earning more profits through the expansion of her business. She intends to utilize the earned profits for the improvement of her house and on the wedding ceremony of her daughter.

loans.use: To buy to more packs of biscuits and sweets to drive up her sales.

loans.name: Eman

texts.en: Eman is a 47-year-old married female from Marka in Jordan. She has requested a 1,000 JOD loan to pay for the educational fees and expenses of her daughter, Walaa. In the future she would like to make some home improvements.

loans.use: to pay for the educational fees and expenses of her daughter.

loans.name: Halima

texts.en:
This is 32 year old, married Halima. She lives with her family in Msambweni, a town in the coastal region of Kenya. Her husband is a businessman. They have two children who are currently attending school.

Four years ago she learned how to sew because she liked it. She carries out this work alone in one of the trading centres. She doesn't have a fixed timetable but she prefers opening early and works up to late in the evening. 

She will use this loan to buy sewing materials such as fabrics and thread. Over the next few years she would like to open a business where she can display the articles she makes.

loans.use: to buy sewing materials such as fabrics and thread.

loans.name: Lovette

texts.en: Lovette lives in Sinkor. She is married with two children, aged 9 and 12, who are currently in school. Her husband works in a government agency.  She has been involved in the sales of used clothing for the past nine years. She sells children's clothes for both boys and girls. She learned to sell from her stepmother. She likes this kind of business because she makes a profit when she sells, and with the profit she buys more goods for the business and  helps her husband with the expenses of the home. She is requesting a loan to purchase more used clothes for the business. Her plan for the future is to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more used clothes for the business.

loans.name: Rajabu

texts.en: Rajabu is a man who always takes advantage of every opportunity that comes along. He is asking for a new loan, being grateful for the previous loan given to him. He has a testimony that it was of great help as it enabled him to increase sales and save money. Currently, he has another business, selling spare parts. Rajabu will use this loan to purchase more spare parts to stock his store.

loans.use: to purchase more spare parts to stock his store.

loans.name: Anna

texts.ru:
Анне 32 года, замужем, имеет 2 детей. Анна работает преподавателем в местной школе  и в качестве дополнительного дохода с прошлого года занимается животноводством. Благодаря упорному труду Анны в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний  день имеется  3 дойные коровы в приплодом, 2 головы лошади, 35 овец. Ежемесячный доход от бизнеса составляет около 5,000 сом. 
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Анна обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS)  на покупку скота для откорма и перепродажи.  Доходы от кредита Анна  планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение количества домашней скотины, чтобы в перспективе построить большой дом для своей семьи.
texts.en:
Anna is 32 years old, she is married and has two children. Anna works as a teacher in the local school and since last year as an additional source of income has been doing animal husbandry. Because of her hard work Anna now has three milk cows with calves, two horses and 35 sheep in her business. Her monthly income from the business is around 5,000 som.

With the goal to further grow her business Anna has come to Bai-Tushum and Partners for a loan in the amount of 100,000 som (KGS) to buy cattle for feeding and resale. Anna plans to invest the income from the loan into further increase of the number of livestock with a plan to build a big house for her family.

loans.use: to purchase cattle.

loans.name: Nexhat

texts.en:
Loans from KosInvest to the Roma Community in Kosovo have helped to improve their lives and businesses. They have provided the opportunity to improve their various businesses and create working environments and improve their living conditions.
  
Among the people who have benefited are Nexhat and his family. Nexhat is 23 years old. He is married and has two children ranging in age from 2 to 1 year old. The family's main source of income comes from Nexhat, who works as a woodcutter in his area. The money he generates is not enough to pay for the renovation of his home. 

His house has not had any repairs or renovation in the past several years. It needs immediate renovation for windows and doors. Nexhat asked for a loan to renovate the windows and doors. This loan will help him to keep his house warm during the wintertime, which is very beneficiary for him. He hopes in this way to improve the conditions for his family.

He is very happy for this opportunity!

loans.use: To renovate windows and doors.

loans.name: Wafaa

texts.en: Wafaa is a 28-year-old single female from Marka in Jordan. She has requested a 700 JOD loan to pay for the retailing of cosmetics and accessories. In the future she would like to expand her project and buy her own shop. Since Wafa is under 30 years old, her loan is considered a youth loan.

loans.use: to pay for the retailing of cosmetics and accessories.

loans.name: Sahar

texts.en: Sahar is a 25-year-old married woman from Marka, Amman, Jordan who has 2 family members. She is requesting a loan of 600 JD to pay for her home improvements. She would like to buy new furniture. In the future she hopes to repaint the home and to buy a new home. Since Sahar is under 30 years old, her loan is considered a youth loan.

loans.use: to pay for her home improvements.

loans.name: Zanda

texts.en:
Zanda is from the small village of Khoni district. She is 19 years old and lives with her husband, Zviad, and their 1-year-old son. 

The family earns their living through a dairy farm; they have six milk cows. Zanda milks the cows twice a day and produces cheese products. The cheese is sold at the local market. The family takes good care of their livestock, as this is their only income. Zanda works hard to do the best for her family. She is a woman with a great desire to get ahead.

She requested a loan to build a greenhouse. With this credit, she will purchase building materials and construct it. Zanda and Zviad will sow different kinds of vegetables and greens to sell at a good price. This will increase the income of the family. With the increased income, she plans to expand his agricultural business and improve the living conditions of the family. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to build a greenhouse.

loans.name: Henry P.

texts.en: Henry is 32 years old and lives in Ganta. He is married and has a six-year-old child who is in school and lives at home. Henry is a high school graduate, and his wife is a businesswoman. Since 2002 he has been running a shop where he sells alcoholic drinks. He says one of the problems he is faced with is that most of his demands from his customers are not available in stock because the price of the most favorite alcoholic drinks are so high. He is requesting a loan to purchase more of the favorite alcoholic drinks to meet his customers' desires. In the near future he wants to build a house and expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase more favorite alcoholic drinks to meet is customers desire,

loans.name: Yazan

texts.en: Yazan is a 19-year-old single male from Jarash in Jordan. He has requested a 400 JOD loan to pay for opening a small grocery store near his house. Since Yazan is under 30 years old, his loan is considered a youth loan.

loans.use: to pay for opening a small grocery store near his home.

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en:
Ekua sells charcoal at Wiomoa. Ekua is married and has five children. Her husband is a farmer. 

Ekua has been selling charcoal for five years. She is responsible for supporting the husband in paying their children's school fees. 

Her loan will be used to buy bags of charcoal to sell. She hopes to use the new profits to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy bags of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Timothy

texts.en:
Two months ago, Timothy started a small business selling cosmetics. Thanks to his efforts and dedication, sales increase gradually, day to day. 

He sells perfumes, creams, deodorants, etc. He has many hopes for his life and for his business because he has a son who is still young and this is why he wants to prepare him for a better future. He therefore knows he has to start saving for him now. 

For now, he wants to vary his merchandise in order to diversify for his customers. He will stock more beauty products to sell.

loans.use: to stock more beauty products to sell.

loans.name: Nelson

texts.en:
Nelson is asking for a new loan so as to invest it in his kiosk. He used the previous loan to increase stock of charcoal in his charcoal store. Both businesses are doing well, thanks to the dedication he has towards his work.

Nelson plans to use this loan to add stock of home products like flour, detergents, sugar, sweets, pain killer medicines, etc. He hopes to have a bigger retail shop in future.

loans.use: to add stock of home products like flour, detergents, sugar, sweets, pain killer medicines, etc.

loans.name: Sabri

texts.en:
Sabri is living in the southern part of Kosovo. He is married and has four children ranging in age from 9 to 4 years old. The family's main source of income comes from Sabri, who works as a taxi driver. He doesn’t earn enough to support the needs of his family. His wife spends most of the time staying at home as a housewife, cooking and taking care of her children and her husband.

The family used to live in an old house and tried to save money to build a house. They have finally managed to start building their new home to improve their living conditions, and they have paid for the building materials, but they still need money to pay for the new windows. The money they generate in income and have in savings is not enough to finish the house.

Now Sabri requests a loan in order to buy new windows. The loan will help them to complete the new house and enter before the winter season. His goal is to improve the living conditions for his children and to offer them a good quality education.

He would like to thank all Kiva lenders for their support!

loans.use: To buy new windows.

loans.name: Hisni

texts.en:
Hisni is living in the Ashkali community in Kosovo. He is married and has five children. The oldest is 19 years old and the youngest is four years old. Hisni makes a living working as a woodcutter in his area. His wife spends most of her time at home as a housewife. 

This wonderful and loving family lives in unacceptable conditions. They have serious problems with their windows and doors. Winter is coming up and there is an immediate need to renovate the door and windows of their hpuse in order to not feel the cold during the winter.  Therefore Hisni has asked for a loan to renovate his doors and windows.  This loan will help him to improve his family's living standards.

Knowing that this is a Kiva loan Hisni would like to thank all Kiva lenders!

loans.use: to renovate doors and windows in his house.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica is a married woman.  She has one child.  She describes herself as an honest, patient and determined woman . She operates a restaurant  where she sells food.  She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located within a busy market  and her primary customers are business people. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the business. 

Veronica will use the Kes 40,000 loan to buy food ingredients for preparing food to sell.  Her business goal is to open another restaurant within five years.  She hopes that in the future, she will educate her children with profits generated from the business. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to prepare food for selling.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy materials for sewing

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en:
Nasreen is a 25-year-old married woman. She has been in the embroidery business for over two years. Since her childhood, she has watched her mother stitch clothes and make beautiful patterns of embroidery for her and her siblings. By the time she grew up she knew how to stitch, sew and make five different types of stitches, which made her embroidery exclusive and unique from all others in her town. 

Nasreen approached Kashf when she was on the brink of financial disaster and her family could barely garner sufficient resources to feed themselves. Her father was a drug addict and failed to provide for her family; her mother was sick and had no money for medicine. 

Desperate to change her fate and provide relief to her mother, she borrowed some amount from Kashf. She realized that she alone was the only hope for her family of six members. She bought a wood frame, cloth and thread and started making embroidered cloths. 

Initially she sold them in her neighborhood and was delighted to receive orders from shop keepers who wanted to display her cloths in their shops. 

Currently she has requested the amount of PKR 15,000 from Kashf to buy a wooden frame, cloth and threads of different colors. She hopes to have good a experience with this new loan.

loans.use: To buy a wooden frame, cloth and threads of different colors.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is 17 years old and lives in the town of Lugazi in the Mukono region of Uganda. For the past two years, Beatrice has been working hard to manage her small business, which selling fresh fruits. 

To help expand her business, Beatrice has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more fresh fruits for resale, and it will help Beatrice to generate greater profits and support her family with basic needs like food and clothes. Beatrice hopes that in the future she will be able to develop her business more by having different fruits. 

Beatrice is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more fresh fruits for resale.

loans.name: Ajser

texts.en:
Ajser is 41 years old and is married. She lives in the southwestern part of Kosovo. She is a very hardworking woman. 

Ajser operates a tailoring business. She has been a seamstress for more than ten years. She has a lot of customers who are satisfied with her work. In this way she can earn a living. Ajser makes shirts, traditional dresses and other things depending on the demands from her local customers.
 
Ajser is requesting a loan to purchase spare material for her work. This loan will help her to increase profit. Her goal is to earn a higher income and expand her business. 

She is happy about the financial support from Kiva lenders because it helps her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase spare material for her work.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is a 25-year-old married man. He has one child. He describes himself as a determined man. 

James operates a service business where he provides nail polishing services. He has been involved in this business for two years. His business is located within a competitive urban area and his primary customers are ladies. He describes his biggest business challenge as competition within the area. He will use the KES 10,000 loan to buy nail polish. His business goal is to expand his business within five years. In the future, he hopes that he will be financially stable. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy nail polish.

loans.name: Ferial

texts.en:
Ferial is a 24-year-old married woman who has three family members from Al Bayader, Amman, Jordan. She is requesting a loan of 400 JOD to buy accessories and makeup to sell. 

In the future, she would like to open a shop and expand her home.

Since Ferial is under 30 years old, her loan is considered a youth loan.

loans.use: to buy accessories and makeup.

loans.name: Katherina Jaoska

texts.es: Katherina Jaoska de 19 anos de edad, casada con un hijo de 2 anos de edad. Pertenece al departamento de Chinandega que esta ubicado en la zona de occidente del país. Ella tiene por actividad económica la venta de mercadería  como ropa, chinería, cosméticos, el cual  lo distribuye de forma ambulante a clientes fijos y eventuales. La rutina diaria de Katherina es de 10 horas al día y recorre la calle de su comunidad con un bulto de ropa de uno 25 kg diariamente. Aunque su rutina es pesada ella agradece la oportunidad que le brindan con los créditos para tener un medio de trabajo y brindarle mejores condiciones de vida a su pequeño hijo. El negocio lo inicio con ayuda de su mama que también era comerciante.  El financiamiento lo quiere para invertir en capital de trabajo para la compra y venta de productos como: pantalones, camisas, cosméticos variados, entre otros.  Katherina agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua.
texts.en: 19 year old Katherina is married and has a two year old son.  She lives within the Chinandega department, which is located in the west zone of the country.  She sells merchandise such as clothing, chinoiserie, and cosmetics on foot to steady and new customers.  Katherina works 10 hours a day.  She travels through the streets of her community daily with a 25 kg bundle of clothing.  Even though it’s a difficult schedule, she appreciates the work opportunity that these loans provide her, allowing her to provide better living conditions to her young son.  She started this business so that she could help out her mother who was also a merchant.  She will use the money from this loan to buy products such as: pants, shirts, and various cosmetics among other things.  Katherina appreciates the help that Kiva lenders provide to people with few resources in poor countries like Nicaragua.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy chemical fertilizers and pay for the labor.

loans.name: Efrain

texts.es:
El señor Efraín tiene 67 años de edad. Vive en el municipio Chichigalpa, un lugar en el oeste de Nicaragua, conocido por su producción de caña y azúcar. Es uno de los lugares más caliente de Nicaragua.
El señor Efraín cuenta con un negocio de diversificado de comercio de ropas, zapatos, cosméticos etcétera. Los fondos que se facilitaron el institución CEPRODEL y Kiva fueron destinados para aumentar el inventario de mercadería de negocio. Actualmente, el negocio se maneja su hija porque el señor Efraín está sufriendo de una enfermedad. Debido de que ha estado enfermo, su hija está administrando el negocio familiar. Antes de que su hija administre el mismo, el señor Efraín y su esposa eran quienes administraron el negocio.  La enfermedad del señor Efraín impacto la familia en que su esposa tenía que cuidarle y asistirle cuando el señor Efraín se decaído.
La causa de la enfermedad del señor Efraín supone que fue a causa de los 16 años que trabajo como operario de maquinaria pesada (retro excavadoras y palas mecánicas etc.). 
Esa maquinaria se utiliza para crear conductores de agua, diques, terrazas entre otros para dirigir el agua hacia la plantación de caña.
El señor Efraín está casado. Tuvo 6 hijos de los cuales 5 están vivos. Un hijo se falleció trabajando en el campo en un accidente laboral hace 2 años.  Tanto el cómo su esposa  velan por el bienestar de su nuera como de su nieto.
El señor Efraín ha trabajado alrededor de 3 años consecutivo con CEPRODEL y es su primer préstamo de Kiva.  
El señor Efraín manifestó que el los fondos que se dieron aumento los niveles de ventas en su negocio y que por ende aumento el ingreso familiar, dándoles una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Efrain is 67 years old. He lives in Chichigalpa city, which is in the western part of Nicaragua, known for its sugarcane production. It is one of the hottest regions in Nicaragua.

Efrain has a business in diversified clothing, shoes, cosmetics, as well as other things. The funds provided by CEPRODEL and Kiva were used to increase the inventory of the business. 

Currently, the business is being managed by his daughter because Efrain is suffering from an illness. Due to his medical state, his daughter is leading the family business. Before his daughter took over, Efrain and his wife were managing the business. The disease requires his wife has to take care of and support Efrain in his declining state. They believe the cause of his illness to be his 16 years of labor operating heavy machinery, (old excavators and power shovels). The machinery is used to create waterways, dikes, terraces, among other things in order to bring water to the sugar plantation.

Efrain is married, had 6 children, 5 of which are still alive today. One son passed away in a work-related accident while working in the fields 2 years ago. Both he and his wife look after their daughter-in-law and grandchild's well-being. 

Efrain has worked for about 3 consecutive years with CEPRODEL, and this is his first loan from Kiva. He says that the funds he received increased the sales in his business and consequently his family's income, offering them an improved quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase inventory for his business selling clothing, shoes, cosmetics, and other things.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy essential materials such as tires and an engine for his motorbike.

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva is married with three children, and only two of her children go to school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members. 

She has a business of selling green bananas and has been in this business for seven years. She works seven days at the market and sells to all categories of people, but only on a retail basis.  

Her major business challenges include transportation and seasonality. She aspires to buy a delivery van to ease transportation, to become a wholesaler and also to build rental houses.   

She resides in her own house, and the family has access to electricity and but not to piped water. Her monthly expenses includes school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of green bananas.

loans.name: Heba

texts.en:
Heba is a 38-year-old married woman who has seven family members and is from Al Zarqa'a, Jordan. She is requesting a loan of 400 Jordan dinars (JD) to buy clothes to resell to her friends and neighbors in the same area. 

She would like to expand her project in the future, and she wants to develop her social economic status.

loans.use: to buy clothes to resell.

loans.name: Subira

texts.en:
Subira is a farmer in the Kitale area of Western Kenya where she lives with her husband. She has been running a farming business for two years, producing milk, maize, beans and eggs for the local market.

Subira has requested a loan of 36,400 	KES from Juhudi to buy and insure a dairy cow. She says this will improve her farming business, which is her only source of livelihood for the entire family. She hopes to significantly improve her farming income.

Her business challenges include milk price fluctuations and the high cost of dairy feed.

loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Phiona

texts.en:
Phiona is 18 years old and lives in the town of Lugazi in the Mukono region of Uganda. For the past 4 years, Phiona has been working hard to manage her drug shop, which sells medicine. 

To help expand her business, Phiona has requested a loan of 900,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more medicine for the drug shop for resale, and will help Phiona to generate greater profits and support her family with basic needs like buy food and clothes. Phiona hopes that in the future she will be able to buy a plot of land. 

Phiona is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more medicine for the drug shop for resale,

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pay the labor costs for his rice-growing business

loans.name: Los Amigos Emprendedores Group

texts.es:
Este Banco Comunal se llama “ Los Amigos Emprendedores”  está conformado por 25 emprendedores, quienes se dedican a diferentes rubros, entre los cuales se encuentran; venta de fruta, venta de flores, feriantes, venta de verduras, accesorios para el hogar, servicios entre otros. Todos ellos pertenecientes a la ciudad de Valparaíso.
Juana, integrante del grupo del Banco Comunal, quien en la foto se encuentra sentada en primera fila, ocupando el primer lugar de derecha a izquierda, viste un chaleco con rayas de color café, usa una bufanda de color naranjo con flores, pantalón de color negro y botas de color café, su cabello es largo y lo usa suelto es de color castaño oscuro.
Ella se dedica al rubro de bazar, desde hace 6 años. Comenta que trabaja en una feria los días martes, jueves, sábado y domingo, donde ofrece sus accesorios a su clientela, específicamente vende juguetes.
La mercadería que va necesitando la compra en importadoras en la ciudad de Santiago a bajo costo, por lo tanto conveniente económicamente.
Con el crédito comprará remolinos, burbujas, ropa de bebe, autos a control remoto, juegos para abastecer su negocio.
Una de las metas de Juana es tener la posibilidad de crecer y continuar con su negocio, y agregar más accesorios ya que se acerca la temporada de verano, así con esto optar a una mejor calidad de vida.
Juana vive junto a su hijo de 17 años de edad, quien se encuentra estudiando. Sus sueños a nivel laboral es tener un medio de trasporte, un auto para poder movilizarse con su mercadería a diferentes partes y ferias para ofrecer su mercadería, y a nivel familiar ayudar a su hijo para que termine sus estudios y tener un buen futuro profesional.
Ella está muy contenta y agradecida de la oportunidad brindada por Fondo Esperanza, ya que le permitirá invertir en su negocio. Respecto al grupo del Banco Comunal del cual forma parte, comenta que en éste existe muy buena comunicación. Por otro lado las capacitaciones, le han servido para aprender nuevas estrategias de venta y contabilidad.
Valparaíso está situado a 120 kilómetros al noroeste de Santiago. Es la capital regional y además sede del poder legislativo del país. Es el primer puerto de la nación y ofrece gran variedad de lugares hermosos y pintorescos, como por ejemplo la casa del poeta Pablo Neruda, ganador del Premio Nobel.
texts.en:
The Community Bank, “Los Amigos Emprendedores” (The Entrepreneurial Friends), is made up of 25 members who work in various trades and professions, including: fruit sales, flower sales, vegetable sales, home accessories, fairs and markets, and other services. All the group members are from the city of Valparaíso.

In the group photo above, Juana is seated on the far right in the first row. She has long brown hair, and is wearing a brown striped sweater with an orange scarf, black pants and brown boots. 

Juana makes a living selling toys and a variety of products at regional markets and bazaars. She works at a certain fair on Monday, Thursday, Saturday and Sunday of each week selling products to her customers. She purchases her merchandise from various importers and retailers in the city of Santiago at a relatively low cost, which is crucial to her successful resale of the merchandise. 

With the support from this loan, Juana plans to purchase additional merchandise to stock her business, including: bubbles, baby clothing, remote control cars, and other children’s games and products.

One of Juana’s future goals is to grow and strengthen her business and to continue increasing the variety of products she offers to her customers. Since summer is approaching, Juana hopes this investment will help her to prepare for that busier season and will increase her profits and quality of life. 

Juana lives with her son, who is 17 years old and is in school. Another of Juana’s dreams is to acquire her own vehicle for transporting merchandise to and from the markets and fairs where she works. With regard to her family, Juana’s goals include supporting her son through all his schooling, and giving him a future full of professional opportunities.

Juana is grateful for this opportunity from Fondo Esperanza which will allow her to invest in her business. She enjoys being a member of the Community Bank, as she has learned important communication skills, marketing strategies and accounting principles through her involvement in the group.

Valparaíso is located 120 kilometers to the northeast of Santiago, and is the regional capital as well as the legislative seat for the country. Chile’s largest port, Valparaíso offers a wide range of beautiful buildings, landscapes and attractions, as well as urban art and elaborate murals throughout the city streets. The house of Pablo Neruda, Nobel Prize winner and famous writer, is also located in Valparaíso.

loans.use: Comprará remolinos, burbujas, ropa de bebe, autos a control remoto, juegos para abastecer su negocio.

loans.name: Las Jefas De Yerbas Buenas Group

texts.es:
Ese Banco Comunal se llama “Las jefas de Yerbas Buenas” está conformado por 18 emprendedores quienes se dedican a diferentes rubros entre los cuales se encuentran; venta de ropa, kiosko, venta de desayunos, venta de queso, venta de pan, venta de accesorios para el hogar, servicios entre otros. Todos ellos pertenecientes a la ciudad de Linares.
Natividad, integrante del grupo del Banco Comunal, quien en la foto se encuentra de pie en segunda fila, ocupando el segundo lugar de derecha a izquierda, viste blusa blanca con líneas rojas y encima lleva puesto una chaqueta de polar  sin mangas de color rojo, su cabello lo usa suelto y es de color castaño oscuro.
Ella se dedica al rubro de modista, desde hace 1 año. Realizo algunos curso de especialización, lo que le permitió emprender en su negocio, trabaja de martes a viernes, tiene habilitado un pequeño cuarto en su casa para trabajar, su horario lo distribuye de acuerdo a su disponibilidad.
La mercadería que va necesitando para realizar sus costuras las compra en la ciudad de Linares en tiendas donde se especializan en vender géneros donde encuentra todo a bajo costo, por lo tanto conveniente económicamente.
Con el crédito comprará géneros, hilos, agujas y cierres.
Una de las metas de Natividad es tener un local para sus costuras y confección de cortinas, manteles, cojines, y a la vez tener a su clientela más cómoda.
Natividad vive junto a su esposo y 2 hijos de 13 y 7 años de edad, quienes se encuentran estudiando. Sus sueños a nivel laboral es seguir con rubro y crecer y captar más clientela, y a nivel familiar ayudar a su familia y darles una buena educación a sus hijos.
Ella está muy contenta de la oportunidad que le ha brindado Fondo Esperanza, ya que le ha permitido invertir en su negocio. Además se siente muy cómoda con la compañía de las demás emprendedoras del grupo del Banco Comunal, ya que comparten diferentes actividades, intereses, lo cual también le ha servido como un momento de distracción. Respecto a las capacitaciones impartidas en las reuniones, ha aprendido administrar su negocio de mejor manera.
Linares es un importante centro urbano de la región del Maule, ubicado en la zona centro del país. En esta zona se desarrolla de manera importante la producción agrícola y también vitivinícola sobresaliendo en el ámbito de las exportaciones. Destacan los cultivos de cereales (arroz, trigo, maíz y avena), hortalizas (remolacha, repollo, lechuga y acelga y legumbres) y frutas. Linares es la principal provincia productora de arroz, en Chile; de hecho, el 78% de la producción nacional de este cereal se da en esta provincia, especialmente en la comuna de Parral.
texts.en:
This Communal Bank is called, "The Peppermint Leaders," and is made up of 18 hardworking individuals. They work in different types of jobs such as: clothing sales, kiosk, meal, cheese, bread, household item sales, and other services. They all live in the city of Linares.
Natividad is a member of the Communal Bank and is seen second in line, from right to left, in the photo. She is wearing a red and white stripped blouse and a sleeveless winter jacket. She wears her hair down and her hair is dark brown.
She has been working in the fashion department for a year now. She took some designing courses and was able to begin her business. She works from Tuesday to Friday. She has a room where she works from. Her work schedule is fitted around her availability. 
She purchases her merchandise from Linares City in shops that specialize in selling materials at reasonable prices.
She will use the loan to buy fabric, thread, needles, and zippers.
One of Natividad's goals is to have a local shop for clothing, curtain, tablecloth, cushion making and offer her clients a more comfortable place to shop.
Natividad lives with her husband and 2 children, of 13 and 7 years of age, who are in school. Her dreams for her job are to continue sewing and have more clientele. Her personal dreams are to help her family and offer her children a good education.
She is very happy with the help being offered by Fondo Ezperanza since this will help her invest in her business. In addition, she feels very comfortable with the other members of the Communal Bank since they share various activities, and interests that also serve as entertainment. Thanks to the training offered during the meetings she has leraned how to better manage her business. 
Linares is an important urban town in the region of Maule, in the central are of the country. This area has produced agricultural and wine exportations. 
They stand out in producing cereals (rice, wheat, corn, and oatmeal), vegetables (beets, cabbage, lettuce, chard, and legumes) and fruits. Linares is the  main province that produces rice in Chile. In fact, 78% of the national rice production comes from this province, especially in the town of Peru.
.

loans.use: buy fabrics, thread, needles, and zippers.
